analyzed: dri ma med rnams ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the pure ones.

original: zag pa med pa gsum ma gtogs so //🔽de yang mtshan gnyis /
analyzed: zag pa med pa gsum ma gtogs so // de yang mtshan gnyis /
translated: Except for the three pure controlling faculties.

original: mtshan gnyis pa dbang po tshang ba gang yin pa de ni bcu dgu dang ldan no //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa dbang po tshang ba gang yin pa de ni bcu dgu dang ldan no //
translated: The hermaphrodite possesses nineteen controlling faculties.

original: gzhan yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: Which other?

original: 'phags pa chags bcas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa chags bcas te /
translated: The noble one who is not detached.

original: slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yang nang na mang po dang ldan na bcu dgu dang ldan te /
analyzed: slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yang nang na mang po dang ldan na bcu dgu dang ldan te /
translated: The learner who is not detached possesses nineteen controlling faculties.

original: mtshan gcig dri med gnyis ma gtogs //🔽mtshan gcig dang zag pa med pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan gcig dri med gnyis ma gtogs // mtshan gcig dang zag pa med pa gnyis te /
translated: Except for one sexual faculty and two pure controlling faculties.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang / gnyis po las gang yang rung ba zhig ma gtogs so //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang / gnyis po las gang yang rung ba zhig ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for one sexual faculty and two pure controlling faculties, namely, the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown and the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: khams rab tu dbye ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa dbang po rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: khams rab tu dbye ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa dbang po rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: The detailed explanation of the classification of the controlling faculties is concluded.

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, we must examine the following points.

original: ci 'dus byas kyi chos 'di dag ci ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa de bzhin du tha dad par skye ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'dus byas kyi chos 'di dag ci ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa de bzhin du tha dad par skye ba zhig yin nam /
translated: Are all conditioned factors produced in the same manner as they are qualified?🔽Or are some produced necessarily together?

original: 'on te kha cig nges par lhan cig skye ba'ang yod ce na /🔽smras pa yod de /
analyzed: 'on te kha cig nges par lhan cig skye ba'ang yod ce na / smras pa yod de /
translated: They are produced necessarily together.🔽All factors are included in five categories: material form, thought, thought concomitants, factors not associated with thought, and unconditioned factors.🔽Among them, the unconditioned factors are not produced.🔽The conditioned factors are of two kinds: those that are material form and those that are not material form.🔽The material form factors are of two kinds: those that are resistant and those that are not resistant.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzugs dang sems dang / sems las byung ba dag dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag dang / 'dus ma byas dang lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzugs dang sems dang / sems las byung ba dag dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag dang / 'dus ma byas dang lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: The resistant factors are of two kinds: those that are sense bases and those that are not sense bases.🔽The sense bases are of eleven kinds.🔽The factors that are not sense bases are of two kinds: those that are atoms and those that are not atoms.🔽The atoms are of two kinds: those that are sound and those that are not sound.🔽The atoms that are not sound are of two kinds: those that are sense bases and those that are not sense bases.🔽The atoms that are not sense bases are of two kinds: those that are resistant and those that are not resistant.

original: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do //🔽chos gzugs can rnams kyi nges pa ni 'di yin te /🔽'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do // chos gzugs can rnams kyi nges pa ni 'di yin te / 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: The atoms that are not resistant are of two kinds: those that are a collection and those that are not a collection.🔽The atoms that are a collection are of two kinds: those that are a single substance and those that are multiple substances.🔽The atoms that are a single substance are of two kinds: those that are a single sense base and those that are multiple sense bases.🔽The atoms that are multiple sense bases are of two kinds: those that are eight substances and those that are nine substances.🔽The atoms that are eight substances are of two kinds: those that are in the desire realm and those that are in the form realm.🔽The atoms that are in the desire realm are of two kinds: those that are without faculties and those that are with faculties.🔽The atoms that are without faculties are of two kinds: those that are without sound and those that are with sound.

original: thams cad las phra ba'i gzugs ni bsags pa'i rdul phra rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad las phra ba'i gzugs ni bsags pa'i rdul phra rab ces bya ste /
translated: The atoms that are without sound are of two kinds: those that are a single substance and those that are multiple substances.🔽The atoms that are a single substance are of two kinds: those that are a single sense base and those that are multiple sense bases.🔽The atoms that are multiple sense bases are of two kinds: those that are eight substances and those that are nine substances.

original: de las ches chung ba ni mi mngon no //
analyzed: de las ches chung ba ni mi mngon no //
translated: The atoms that are eight substances are of two kinds: those that are a

original: de 'dod pa'i khams na sgra yang med dbang po yang med pa zhig yin na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan par skye ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i khams na sgra yang med dbang po yang med pa zhig yin na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan par skye ste /
translated: If it is in the desire realm and has neither sound nor sense faculty, it arises possessing eight substances.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig med par ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig med par ni ma yin no ;
translated: It does not arise without any of them.

original: / rdzas brgyad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi ste /
analyzed: / rdzas brgyad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi ste /
translated: The eight substances are the four primary elements and the four derivative forms:

original: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so /
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so /
translated: form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: rdul phra rab dbang po dang bcas la sgra med pa zhig yin na ni rdzas dgu 'am /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dbang po dang bcas la sgra med pa zhig yin na ni rdzas dgu 'am /
translated: If the subtle particle possesses sense faculty but not sound, it arises possessing nine substances.

original: rdzas bcu dang ldan par skye ste /
analyzed: rdzas bcu dang ldan par skye ste /
translated: Or it arises possessing ten substances.

original: de la re zhig / lus dbang ldan @63b la rdzas dgu'o //🔽'di la lus kyi dbang po yod pas na 'di ni lus dbang ldan no //
analyzed: de la re zhig / lus dbang ldan @63b la rdzas dgu'o // 'di la lus kyi dbang po yod pas na 'di ni lus dbang ldan no //
translated: It has nine substances if it possesses the body faculty.🔽It has ten substances if it possesses another sense faculty.🔽It has nine substances if it possesses the body faculty.

original: de la rdzas dgu ni brgyad po dag dang lus kyi dbang po'o //🔽dbang po gzhan rdzas bcu'o //
analyzed: de la rdzas dgu ni brgyad po dag dang lus kyi dbang po'o // dbang po gzhan rdzas bcu'o //
translated: The nine substances are the eight substances and the body faculty.

original: dbang po gzhan gyi rdul phra rab gang la yod pa de la rdzas bcu ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi rdul phra rab gang la yod pa de la rdzas bcu ste /
translated: It has ten substances if it possesses another sense faculty.

original: dgu po de dag nyid dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig go //
analyzed: dgu po de dag nyid dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig go //
translated: The nine faculties, plus one of the faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, or body.

original: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na ni go rims bzhin du rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang bcu gcig dang ldan bar skye ba na skye'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na ni go rims bzhin du rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang bcu gcig dang ldan bar skye ba na skye'o //
translated: When these atoms are born with sound, they are born with nine, ten, or eleven substances, respectively.

original: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yang yod de /
analyzed: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yang yod de /
translated: There is also sound that is not distinct from the faculties.

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is sound that arises from the cause of the appropriated great elements.

original: ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams tha mi dad pa las 'di na 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni sra bar dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams tha mi dad pa las 'di na 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni sra bar dmigs /
translated: How is it that the elements are not distinct, yet in a certain composite, one element is perceived, such as solidity,

original: kha cig kho na ni gsher ba'am dro ba'am g-yo bar dmigs she na /
analyzed: kha cig kho na ni gsher ba'am dro ba'am g-yo bar dmigs she na /
translated: and in another, fluidity, heat, or motion?

original: gang zhig gang na ches gsal zhing mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba de ni de na dmigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang na ches gsal zhing mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba de ni de na dmigs te /
translated: That which is most clear and predominant in power in a certain composite is perceived there.

original: dper na khab dang sdong bu'i tshogs la reg pa lta bu dang / phye dang lan tshva'i phye ma'i ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khab dang sdong bu'i tshogs la reg pa lta bu dang / phye dang lan tshva'i phye ma'i ro bzhin no //
translated: like the contact of a needle and its sheath, or like the taste of salt and water.

original: yang ji ltar de dag na lhag ma rnams yod par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de dag na lhag ma rnams yod par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How can one understand that the other primary elements exist in them?

original: las kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: las kyi sgo nas te /
translated: By reason of their actions.

original: sdud pa dang 'dzin pa dang / smin pa dang / g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud pa dang 'dzin pa dang / smin pa dang / g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The primary elements exercise the actions of cohesion, support, ripening, and expansion.

original: rkyen dang phrad na sra ba la sogs pa yang gsher ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen dang phrad na sra ba la sogs pa yang gsher ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When they encounter certain conditions, the hard, etc., become liquid, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas dro ba yod par khong du chud do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas dro ba yod par khong du chud do zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, heat exists in water by reason of a certain specific quality of cold.

original: ma 'dres kyang khyad par yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'dres kyang khyad par yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Even without a mixture, there is a difference.

original: sgra dang tshor ba'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra dang tshor ba'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: Like the difference of sound and sensation.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag las de dag sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag las de dag sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin te /
translated: According to another opinion, the primary elements exist in the others by reason of their seeds, not by reason of their nature.

original: shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: The Buddha said, “In this mass of wood there are various elements.”

original: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: What is the color of the wind?

original: don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is a matter of faith, not of inference.

original: yang na 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, because it holds a mixed smell.

original: de la ni kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For there is no error of color.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro dag med par bshad pas des na yod pa'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rdzas drug dang / bdun dang brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir mi bshad do //🔽yang ci 'dir rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ngam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro dag med par bshad pas des na yod pa'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rdzas drug dang / bdun dang brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir mi bshad do // yang ci 'dir rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ngam /
translated: Since it has been explained that smell and taste do not exist in the form realm, the atoms that exist there possess six, seven, or eight substances, as has already been explained.

original: 'on te skye mched kyi rdzas la rdzas su gzung /
analyzed: 'on te skye mched kyi rdzas la rdzas su gzung /
translated: Do the substances mentioned here refer to the substances of the elements or to the substances of the sense bases?

original: @64a * // des na cir 'gyur /
analyzed: @64a * // des na cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the problem?

original: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung nas ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa dang rdzas dgu dang bcu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ha cang nyungs par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung nas ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa dang rdzas dgu dang bcu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ha cang nyungs par smras pa yin te /
translated: If substance alone is taken as substance, then to say that it possesses eight substances, nine substances, or ten substances is to speak with too little.

original: de yang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za par de la dbyibs kyang yod do //
analyzed: de yang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za par de la dbyibs kyang yod do //
translated: And since it is a composite of subtle particles, it undoubtedly has shape.

original: lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig dang / 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig kyang yod do //
analyzed: lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig dang / 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig kyang yod do //
translated: It has either heaviness or lightness and either smoothness or roughness.

original: kha cig la ni grang ba yang yod la /
analyzed: kha cig la ni grang ba yang yod la /
translated: Some have cold.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa yang yod do //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa yang yod do //
translated: Some have hunger and thirst.

original: 'on te skye mched la rdzas su gzung na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ha cang mangs par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te skye mched la rdzas su gzung na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ha cang mangs par smras pa yin te /
translated: But if the sense sphere is taken as substance, then to say that it possesses eight substances is to speak with too much.

original: rdzas bzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rdzas bzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that it possesses four substances.

original: 'byung ba ji snyed pa dag kyang reg bya'i skye mched yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ji snyed pa dag kyang reg bya'i skye mched yin no //
translated: The primary elements are also the tangible.

original: 'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ste /
translated: Here, some of the primary elements are grasped as substance,

original: rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: namely, those that are the basis.

original: 'dir cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas la rdzas su gzung ste rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas la rdzas su gzung ste rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Some of the primary elements are grasped as substance, namely, those that are the effect.

original: de lta na yang 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams mang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams mang por 'gyur te /
translated: But in this way, the primary elements would be multiple,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams re re zhing 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams re re zhing 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each derivative form is based on a collection of the four primary elements.

original: 'dir ni rigs la rjes su gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni rigs la rjes su gzung ste /
translated: Here, the species is taken as the referent of the term.

original: 'byung ba bzhi po gzhan dag kyang rigs las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi po gzhan dag kyang rigs las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other four primary elements do not go beyond the species.

original: de ltar 'bad de bye brag tu bshad ci dgos /
analyzed: de ltar 'bad de bye brag tu bshad ci dgos /
translated: What is the use of such a distinction?

original: tshig ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin pas don la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin pas don la brtag par bya'o //
translated: The words are used according to the intention of the speaker, but the meaning should be examined.

original: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par ltan cig skye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par ltan cig skye ba bshad zin to //
translated: The simultaneous arising of the possessed and the possessor has been explained for those that have form.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /
translated: The rest are to be discussed.

original: de la re zhig / sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig ;
analyzed: de la re zhig / sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig ;
translated: First, mind and mental factors are necessarily simultaneous.

original: /'di dag ni phan tshun med na 'byung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: /'di dag ni phan tshun med na 'byung bar mi nus so //
translated: They cannot occur without each other.

original: thams cad 'dus byas mchan nyid dang // nges par lhan cig ces bya par sbyar te /
analyzed: thams cad 'dus byas mchan nyid dang // nges par lhan cig ces bya par sbyar te /
translated: All conditioned phenomena are necessarily simultaneous with the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: gzugs sam / sems sam /🔽sems las byung ba dag gam /
analyzed: gzugs sam / sems sam / sems las byung ba dag gam /
translated: Form, mind, mental factors,

original: ldan pa ma yin pa dag kyang rung /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa dag kyang rung /
translated: and also non-psychophysical phenomena🔽whatever is produced

original: gang cung zad skye ba de thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams dang lhan cig skye'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad skye ba de thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams dang lhan cig skye'o //
translated: all arise simultaneously with the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'thob pa'am / thob pa dang ni sems can du snyon pa kho na dang lhan cig skye'i gzhan dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'thob pa'am / thob pa dang ni sems can du snyon pa kho na dang lhan cig skye'i gzhan dang ni ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment is necessarily simultaneous with sentient beings alone, not with others.

original: zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ram zhes bya pa'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ram zhes bya pa'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is stated to make a distinction.

original: sems las byung ba rnams zhes brjod pa sems las byung ba de dag gang @64b zhe na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams zhes brjod pa sems las byung ba de dag gang @64b zhe na /
translated: What are the mental factors that are said to be concomitant with the mind?

original: sems byung rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: sems byung rnam lnga ste /
translated: There are five classes of mental factors.

original: sa mang la sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: sa mang la sogs tha dad phyir //
translated: because their domains are different.

original: sems las byung ba rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The mental factors are of five kinds:

original: sa mang po dag dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / mi dge pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa mang po dag dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / mi dge pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams so //
translated: those that occur in all minds, those that occur in all wholesome minds, those that occur in all afflicted minds, those that occur in all unwholesome minds, and those that occur in all slightly afflicted minds.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni go skabs kyi yul te /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni go skabs kyi yul te /
translated: The term “domain” means the sphere of activity.

original: gang zhig gang gi go skabs kyi yul yin pa de ni de'i sa zhes bya'o //🔽de la 'di dag la sa mang po pa yod pas nas mang po pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi go skabs kyi yul yin pa de ni de'i sa zhes bya'o // de la 'di dag la sa mang po pa yod pas nas mang po pa rnams te /
translated: That which is the sphere of activity of a certain factor is its domain.🔽Those that have a domain that is common to all mental factors are called “universal mental factors.”

original: gang dag sems thams cad la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag sems thams cad la 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are the ones that occur in all minds.

original: gang dag sems thams cad la 'byung ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag sems thams cad la 'byung ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ones that occur in all minds?

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
translated: Feeling, perception, intention, contact, and attention,

original: yid la byed dang mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la //
analyzed: yid la byed dang mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la //
translated: wisdom, mindfulness, concentration, and resolve occur in all minds.

original: chos bcu po 'di dag ni sems kyi skad cig ma thams cad la tshogs par 'byung ngo zhes grag go lo //
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag ni sems kyi skad cig ma thams cad la tshogs par 'byung ngo zhes grag go lo //
translated: It is well known that these ten dharmas occur in combination in every moment of mind.

original: de la tshor ba ni myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba ni myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among them, feeling is the experience of the three kinds of feeling.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //🔽'du shes ni 'dus nas shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o // 'du shes ni 'dus nas shes pa ste /
translated: Volition is the mental factor that activates the mind.

original: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Ideation is the mental factor that apprehends the signs of an object.

original: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the wish to act.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the mental factor that arises from the union of the object, sense faculty, and consciousness.

original: blo gros ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo gros ni shes rab ste /
translated: Intellect is the mental factor of wisdom.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of phenomena.

original: dran ba ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran ba ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Recollection is the mental factor that does not forget its object.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Attention is the mental factor that engages the mind.

original: mos pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Resolve is the mental factor of desire.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Concentration is the mental factor of one-pointedness of mind.

original: sems dad sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas de ni re zhig rgyun rnams la yang yongs su gcad par dka' na skad cig ma dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: sems dad sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas de ni re zhig rgyun rnams la yang yongs su gcad par dka' na skad cig ma dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since the distinctions among mental factors and the mind are subtle, it is difficult to discern them even in a continuum, let alone in a moment.

original: re zhig sman la sogs pa gzugs can rnams la yang ro mang po kha cig gi ro'i khyad par dbang pos gzung bar bya ba rnams nges par gzung bar dka' na ;
analyzed: re zhig sman la sogs pa gzugs can rnams la yang ro mang po kha cig gi ro'i khyad par dbang pos gzung bar bya ba rnams nges par gzung bar dka' na ;
translated: It is difficult to discern the specific taste of some medicines that have many tastes and whose taste is to be experienced by the sense faculty.

original: chos gang dag gzugs can ma yin zhing blos gzung bar bya ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: chos gang dag gzugs can ma yin zhing blos gzung bar bya ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that it is difficult to discern those phenomena that are not form and are to be experienced by the mind?

original: 'di dag la dge pa'i sa mang po yod pas 'di dag ni dge pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la dge pa'i sa mang po yod pas 'di dag ni dge pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin te /
translated: They are called universal mental states because they are virtuous mental states that exist in many minds.

original: gang dag dge pa'i sems la rtag tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag dge pa'i sems la rtag tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are called universal mental states because they always occur in virtuous minds.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽dad dang bag yod shin tu @65a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / dad dang bag yod shin tu @65a * //
translated: What are they?🔽Faith, conscience, shame, vigor,🔽equanimity, pliancy,

original: sbyangs ; / btang snyoms ngo tsha shes khrel yod //
analyzed: sbyangs ; / btang snyoms ngo tsha shes khrel yod //
translated: and nonviolence.

original: rtsa ba gnyis rnam mi 'tshe dang // brtson 'grus rtag tu dge las 'byung //
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis rnam mi 'tshe dang // brtson 'grus rtag tu dge las 'byung //
translated: The two roots, nonviolence and effort, always arise from virtue.

original: chos 'di dag ni dge ba'i sems la rtag tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni dge ba'i sems la rtag tu 'byung ngo //
translated: These dharmas always arise in a virtuous mind.

original: de la dad pa ni sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni sems dang ba'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind.

original: gzhan dag na ni bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu rnams la mngon bar yid ches pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na ni bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu rnams la mngon bar yid ches pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the firm conviction of the truths, the jewels, karma, and its results.

original: bag yod pa ni dge pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the cultivation of virtuous dharmas.

original: de dag las gzhan pa bsgom pa de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa bsgom pa de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of those other than those?

original: de dag nyid la gces su 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid la gces su 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cherishing of those very dharmas.

original: sde pa gzhan dag gi mdo las ni sems kun tu bsrung ba'o zhes 'don to //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag gi mdo las ni sems kun tu bsrung ba'o zhes 'don to //
translated: In the sutras of other schools, it is recited as “guarding the mind.”

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: Agility is the pliability of mind.

original: mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn’t physical agility also mentioned in the sutras?

original: ma gsungs pa ni ma yin mod kyi de ni lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma gsungs pa ni ma yin mod kyi de ni lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It is not that it is not mentioned, but it should be understood as it is in bodily feeling.

original: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be suitable as a member of enlightenment?

original: 'o na der ni lus las su rung ba kho na la lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na der ni lus las su rung ba kho na la lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In that case, it should be understood that bodily pliability is only bodily serviceability.

original: da ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: da ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be called a member of enlightenment?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dag mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dag mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is in conformity with the members of enlightenment.

original: lus las su rung ba de ni sems las su rung ba byang chub kyi yan lag 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: lus las su rung ba de ni sems las su rung ba byang chub kyi yan lag 'dren par byed do //
translated: That bodily serviceability induces the member of enlightenment which is mental serviceability.

original: de lta bu gzhan la lar snang ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu gzhan la lar snang ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there any other place where this is found?

original: smras pa yod de /
analyzed: smras pa yod de /
translated: It is said that there is.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba dang dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs pa dang / khong khro ba dang khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan gnod sems kyi sgrib par gsungs pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba rnams shes rab kyi phung por gsungs pa dag lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba dang dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs pa dang / khong khro ba dang khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan gnod sems kyi sgrib par gsungs pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba rnams shes rab kyi phung por gsungs pa dag lta bu ste /
translated: He taught that right view, thought, and effort are the aggregate of wisdom.

original: rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang de dang mthun pa'i phyir de'i sgra 'thob bo //🔽de bzhin du lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang de dang mthun pa'i phyir de'i sgra 'thob bo // de bzhin du lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Although thought and effort are not by nature wisdom, they are called that because they are compatible with it.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'i sgra 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'i sgra 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, physical pliancy is called a limb of enlightenment because it is compatible with the limbs of enlightenment.

original: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the sameness of mind and the spontaneity of mind.

original: da ni ji ltar na sems de nyid la rtsol pa'i bdag nyid yid la byed pa yang 'byung /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na sems de nyid la rtsol pa'i bdag nyid yid la byed pa yang 'byung /
translated: Now, how can it be that attention with the nature of effort arises in that very thought,

original: rtsol ba med pa'i bdag nyid btang snyoms kyang 'byung @65b zhes bya ba 'di rung par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa'i bdag nyid btang snyoms kyang 'byung @65b zhes bya ba 'di rung par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and also equanimity with the nature of non-effort?

original: 'di dag gi bye brag ni shes par dka'o zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bye brag ni shes par dka'o zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Haven't we explained that the distinction between these is difficult to understand?

original: shes par dka' ba yang shes pa ni yod kyi /
analyzed: shes par dka' ba yang shes pa ni yod kyi /
translated: It is difficult to understand, but it is not that understanding does not exist.

original: gang 'gal bzhin du yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni shin tu shes par dka'o //
analyzed: gang 'gal bzhin du yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni shin tu shes par dka'o //
translated: It is extremely difficult to understand that what appears to be contradictory is not contradictory.

original: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung la /
analyzed: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung la /
translated: Effort arises in one way,

original: rtsol ba med pa yang gzhan du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa yang gzhan du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: and non-effort arises in another way. What contradiction is there in this?

original: 'o na ni mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then all associated factors would not have the same object.

original: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur bas dang tshul gang yin pa de 'di la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur bas dang tshul gang yin pa de 'di la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: This kind of difficulty will arise, so the method that applies to this should be understood to apply to that as well.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Shame and modesty will be explained below.

original: rtsa ba gnyis ni dge pa'i rtsa ba gnyis po chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dag yin no /
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis ni dge pa'i rtsa ba gnyis po chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dag yin no /
translated: The two roots are the two roots of the wholesome, i.e., non-greed and non-hatred.

original: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi de ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi de ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Non-delusion exists, but it is of the nature of understanding.

original: shes rab ni sa mang po pa yin pas 'di dge ba'i sa mang po pa kho na yin par ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab ni sa mang po pa yin pas 'di dge ba'i sa mang po pa kho na yin par ni mi brjod do //
translated: Since understanding is a universal, it is not said that these are only the wholesome universals.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //
translated: Non-violence is the absence of violence.

original: brtson 'grus ni sems mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni sems mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: Vigor is the mental factor that is the exertion of the mind.

original: dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams bshad zin to //🔽sa mang po ni sa mang ba yin no //🔽'di dag la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po yod pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams bshad zin to // sa mang po ni sa mang ba yin no // 'di dag la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po yod pas /
translated: The wholesome universals have been explained.🔽The universal mental factors are so called because they are present in all minds.

original: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin te /
translated: They are called the universal mental factors because they are present in all defiled minds.

original: chos gang dag nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos gang dag nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They are the mental factors that always occur in a defiled mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽rmongs dang bag med le lo dang // ma dad pa dang rmugs dang rgod //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba de dag kyang gang zhe na / rmongs dang bag med le lo dang // ma dad pa dang rmugs dang rgod //
translated: What are the mental factors that always occur in a defiled mind?🔽Delusion, non-modesty, non-embarrassment, lethargy, and faithlessness always occur in a defiled mind.

original: nyon mongs can la rtag tu 'byung //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rtag tu 'byung //
translated: Delusion, non-modesty, non-embarrassment, lethargy, and faithlessness always occur in a defiled mind.

original: de la rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ste /🔽mi shes pa dang mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de la rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ste / mi shes pa dang mi gsal ba'o //
translated: Delusion is ignorance.🔽It is the non-understanding and non-illumination of an object.

original: bag med pa ni dge pa'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste /🔽bsgom pa'i mi mthun ba'i phyogs kyi chos so //🔽le lo ni sems mngon par mi spro ba ste /
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge pa'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste / bsgom pa'i mi mthun ba'i phyogs kyi chos so // le lo ni sems mngon par mi spro ba ste /
translated: Non-modesty is the lack of self-respect.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the opposite of respect.

original: ma dad pa ni sems ma dad pa ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni sems ma dad pa ste /
translated: Non-embarrassment is the lack of consideration for others.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so ;🔽/ rmugs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so ; / rmugs pa gang zhe na /
translated: It is the opposite of consideration for others.🔽Lethargy is the heaviness of the body and the heaviness of the mind.

original: lus lci ba nyid dang // sems lci ba nyid dang / lus las su mi rung ba nyid dang / sems las su mi rung ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus lci ba nyid dang // sems lci ba nyid dang / lus las su mi rung ba nyid dang / sems las su mi rung ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the unserviceability of the body and the unserviceability of the mind.🔽Faithlessness is the lack of faith.🔽It is the opposite of faith.

original: chos mngon pa las lus kyi rmugs pa dang / sems kyi rmugs pa zhes bshad pa ji ltar na sems las byung ba'i chos lus kyi @66a * //🔽zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las lus kyi rmugs pa dang / sems kyi rmugs pa zhes bshad pa ji ltar na sems las byung ba'i chos lus kyi @66a * // zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can a factor that is mental in nature be torpor of the body?

original: lus kyi tshor ba ji ltab bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba ji ltab bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is bodily sensation.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
translated: Excitement is the non-calm of the mind.

original: de ltar na drug po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin no //🔽chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na drug po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin no // chos mngon pa las /
translated: Thus these six are the great grounds of defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa bcu po 'di dag ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa bcu po 'di dag ma yin nam /
translated: In the Abhidharma, are not ten factors declared to be the great grounds of defilement?

original: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: Torpor is not listed among them.

original: ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ma rig pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa dang /
analyzed: ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ma rig pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa dang /
translated: The ten factors are non-faith, laziness, carelessness, non-conscientiousness, torpor, excitement, lack of vigilance, lack of memory, distraction, and non-attention.

original: rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: Excitement and carelessness are not listed among them.

original: 'gyur ba shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur ba shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi /
translated: The gods are pleased with the knowledge of change.

original: 'dod pa shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the knowledge of the realm of desire.

original: 'di la 'dod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la 'dod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the realm of desire?

original: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa rnams ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa rnams ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Forgetfulness, distraction, non-introspection, incorrect mental application, and false resolve are not only universal defilements, but also specific defilements.

original: dper na gti mug med pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de dge ba'i sa mang po par nges par ma bzung ba ltar nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag khon yin par nges par mi bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na gti mug med pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de dge ba'i sa mang po par nges par ma bzung ba ltar nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag khon yin par nges par mi bzung ste /
translated: For example, the absence of confusion is by nature discernment; it is not considered to be a universal good mental factor.

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can kho na brjed ngas pa yin la /
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can kho na brjed ngas pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, forgetfulness is only defiled mindfulness;

original: ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs pa can kho na rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs pa can kho na rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: distraction is only defiled concentration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag sa mang po pa yin ba de dag nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag sa mang po pa yin ba de dag nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: For this reason, are those that are universal also specific?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / 'dun pa dang / reg pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / 'dun pa dang / reg pa'o //
translated: The first alternative is: feeling, conceptualization, volition, desire, and contact.

original: gnyis pa ni ma dang pa dang / le lo dang ; ma rig pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ma dang pa dang / le lo dang ; ma rig pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is: faith, laziness, ignorance, excitement, and nonconscientiousness.

original: gsum pa ni dran pa la sogs ba nyon mongs pa can lnga ji skad bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dran pa la sogs ba nyon mongs pa can lnga ji skad bshad pa rnams so //
translated: The third alternative is: the five explained as being afflicted, such as mindfulness and so on.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The fourth alternative is: those not included in those alternatives.

original: kha cig ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba log pa'i ting nge 'dzin las gzhan du 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba log pa'i ting nge 'dzin las gzhan du 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that mental distraction is different from wrong concentration.

original: de dag gi mu bzhi pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mu bzhi pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But their four alternatives are not like that.

original: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs ba thams cad dang mtshungs bar ldan par 'dod pa de nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag tu ma bton ba su zhig gis nyes /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs ba thams cad dang mtshungs bar ldan par 'dod pa de nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag tu ma bton ba su zhig gis nyes /
translated: Someone asks: If torpor is asserted to be concomitant with all afflictions, why is it not listed among the mental factors with specific objects?

original: 'di skad du gdon par bya ba ni yin mod kyi ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ma bton te /
analyzed: 'di skad du gdon par bya ba ni yin mod kyi ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ma bton te /
translated: It should be listed, but it is not because it is not compatible with concentration.

original: rmugs pa spyod pa @66b ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu myur du skyed par 'gyur gyi rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //🔽gang zhig rgod pa mi spyod la rmugs pa spyod pa yang su zhig yod /
analyzed: rmugs pa spyod pa @66b ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu myur du skyed par 'gyur gyi rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go // gang zhig rgod pa mi spyod la rmugs pa spyod pa yang su zhig yod /
translated: It is well known that one who practices lethargy quickly generates concentration, but not one who practices excitation.🔽Who practices excitation and not lethargy?

original: yang na gang zhig rmugs pa mi spyod la rgod pa spyod pa yang su zhig yod de /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig rmugs pa mi spyod la rgod pa spyod pa yang su zhig yod de /
translated: Who practices lethargy and not excitation?

original: 'di dag ni nam du yang lhan cig spyod pa nyid 'dor bar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nam du yang lhan cig spyod pa nyid 'dor bar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: These two never abandon their mutual companionship.

original: 'on kyang gang zhig gang la shas che ba de ni spyod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig gang la shas che ba de ni spyod par shes par bya ste /
translated: But it should be understood that whichever is stronger is the one that is practiced.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa ni drug po kho nar 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa ni drug po kho nar 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the great grounds of affliction are established as only six.

original: de dag kyang rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kho na la 'byung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kho na la 'byung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: And they occur only in a defiled mind, not in other minds.

original: mi dge la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o ;
analyzed: mi dge la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o ;
translated: Nonvirtue has shamelessness and absence of conscience.

original: / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba'i sems la rtag tu 'byung bas chos 'di nyid ni mi dge ba'i sa chen po pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba'i sems la rtag tu 'byung bas chos 'di nyid ni mi dge ba'i sa chen po pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience always occur in unwholesome minds. Therefore, these two are called the great unwholesome factors.

original: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad do //🔽khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin dang g-yo dang ni //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad do // khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin dang g-yo dang ni //
translated: The characteristics of these two will be explained later.🔽Anger, enmity, dissimulation,🔽Jealousy, spite, concealment, avarice,

original: phrag dog 'tshig 'chab ser sna dang // sgyu dang rgyags dang rnam 'tshe ni //🔽nyon mongs chung ngu'i sa pa rnams //
analyzed: phrag dog 'tshig 'chab ser sna dang // sgyu dang rgyags dang rnam 'tshe ni // nyon mongs chung ngu'i sa pa rnams //
translated: Deceit, arrogance, and violence🔽are the secondary defilements.

original: 'di dag la nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa yod pas 'di ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di dag la nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa yod pas 'di ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams te /
translated: They are called secondary defilements because they are only defilements of the mind.

original: ma rig pa tsam dang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / yid kyi sa pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa tsam dang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / yid kyi sa pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are associated only with ignorance, with the mental faculty, and with the stage of mental consciousness.

original: 'di dag ni nye pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gi nang nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nye pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gi nang nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be explained later among the secondary defilements.

original: sems las byung ba rnam pa lnga po de dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnam pa lnga po de dag bshad zin to //
translated: These five types of mental factors have been explained.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang 'gyod pa dang gnyid la sogs pa ma nges pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang 'gyod pa dang gnyid la sogs pa ma nges pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas /
translated: Other mental factors such as investigation, analysis, regret, sleep, etc. are not certain.

original: de la sems gang zhig la sems las byung ba du zhig gdon mi za par 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems gang zhig la sems las byung ba du zhig gdon mi za par 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we must state how many mental factors definitely arise with which minds.

original: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: First, minds operating in the desire realm are of five types:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis te /🔽ma 'dres pa dang / nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis te / ma 'dres pa dang / nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and three neutral minds:

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: unobscured-neutral minds and obscured-neutral minds.

original: de la re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni nges par rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di la /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni nges par rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di la /
translated: First, since minds operating in the desire realm definitely possess investigation and analysis,

original: 'dod pa'i dge pa'i sems la ni //🔽rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dge pa'i sems la ni // rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa'i phyir //
translated: the desire realm has twenty-two mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba nyi shu gnyis //
analyzed: sems las byung ba nyi shu gnyis //
translated: The desire realm has twenty-two mental factors.

original: gdon mi za par  'byung ste /🔽sa mang po pa bcu dang / dge ba'i sa mang @67a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za par  'byung ste / sa mang po pa bcu dang / dge ba'i sa mang @67a * //
translated: This is certain.

original: po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: The ten universal mental factors, the ten virtuous mental factors, and initial inquiry and investigation.

original: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
analyzed: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
translated: In some places regret is added.

original: dge ba'i sems thams cad la ni 'gyod pa med pas gang la yod pa der de nyid kyis glags na sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems thams cad la ni 'gyod pa med pas gang la yod pa der de nyid kyis glags na sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: In all virtuous minds there is no regret. Where it exists, there are twenty-three mental factors, since it is added to that number.

original: 'gyod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'gyod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this so-called regret?

original: ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret is the nature of remorse.

original: 'di ni 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i chos yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i chos yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called regret because it is a phenomenon that focuses on regret and is remorse.

original: dper na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la stong pa zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i ma chags pa la mi sdug pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la stong pa zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i ma chags pa la mi sdug pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like calling the door of liberation that focuses on emptiness emptiness and calling nonattachment that focuses on the unattractive the unattractive.

original: 'jig rten na yang grong thams cad lhags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang grong thams cad lhags so //
translated: In the world, it is said, “All the villages have been destroyed.”

original: yul thams cad lhags so zhes gnas pa ston pa mthong la /
analyzed: yul thams cad lhags so zhes gnas pa ston pa mthong la /
translated: The place where the people were staying was seen to be empty.

original: 'gyod pa yang yid la gcags pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang yid la gcags pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Regret is also a cause of remorse.

original: yang na 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the effect is designated by the name of its cause.

original: dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the six sense-spheres of contact are said to be known as past action.

original: 'o na gang ma byas pa la dmigs pa de ji ltar 'gyod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang ma byas pa la dmigs pa de ji ltar 'gyod pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can regret have for its object something that has not been done?

original: ma byas pa la byas pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: ma byas pa la byas pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There is a designation of what has not been done as having been done.

original: bdag gis ma byas pa gang yin pa de ma legs pa byas so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ma byas pa gang yin pa de ma legs pa byas so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one says: “What I have not done is not good.”

original: 'gyod pa dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome regret?

original: dge ba ma byas pa dang mi dge ba byas pa nas gdung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ma byas pa dang mi dge ba byas pa nas gdung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the remorse that one feels when one has not done what is wholesome and when one has done what is unwholesome.

original: bzlog pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin te /🔽de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga la brten pa yin no /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin te /🔽de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga la brten pa yin no /
translated: The opposite of this is unwholesome regret.🔽Both kinds of regret are based on both kinds of wholesome and unwholesome action.

original: mi dge ba ni ma 'dres dang // lta dang ldan la'ang nyi shu 'byung //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni ma 'dres dang // lta dang ldan la'ang nyi shu 'byung //
translated: Twenty arise in the unmixed and in the view-possessing non-virtuous mind.

original: mi dge ba'i sems ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de la ni sems las byang ba nyi shu 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de la ni sems las byang ba nyi shu 'byung ste /
translated: Twenty mental factors arise in the unmixed non-virtuous mind.

original: sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa pa'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa pa'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: Ten universal mental states, six root afflictions, two non-virtuous mental states, and both investigation and analysis.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Unmixed means

original: sems gang la ma rig pa 'ba' zhig yod kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: sems gang la ma rig pa 'ba' zhig yod kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan med pa'o //
translated: a mind in which only ignorance exists and no other afflictions such as attachment exist.

original: mi dge ba'i sems lta ba dang ldan pa la yang nyi shu 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems lta ba dang ldan pa la yang nyi shu 'byung ste /
translated: Twenty also arise in the non-virtuous mind that possesses view.

original: ma 'dres pa la gang dag 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la gang dag 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: The same twenty that arise in the unmixed mind.

original: lta ba lhag pa'i phyir nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba lhag pa'i phyir nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Don't twenty-one arise because of the additional view?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they do not.

original: 'di ltar sa mang po pa kho na'i shes rab kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa mang po pa kho na'i shes rab kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because some specific wisdom that is a universal mental state is called view.

original: de la mi dge ba lta ba dang ldan ba ni gang la log @67b par lta ba'am /🔽lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba lta ba dang ldan ba ni gang la log @67b par lta ba'am / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The nonvirtuous mind that possesses view is the mind that possesses wrong view,🔽the overesteeming of (1) mere morality and asceticism, or

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yod pa'o //🔽nyon mongs pa zhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig / mi dge ba'i sems 'dod chags kyang rung /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yod pa'o // nyon mongs pa zhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig / mi dge ba'i sems 'dod chags kyang rung /
translated: the overesteeming of (2) a bad view.🔽The twenty-one mental factors of the nonvirtuous mind🔽The nonvirtuous mind that possesses attachment,

original: khong khro ba yang rung /🔽nga rgyal yang rung /
analyzed: khong khro ba yang rung / nga rgyal yang rung /
translated: the nonvirtuous mind that possesses anger,🔽the nonvirtuous mind that possesses pride,

original: the tshom yang rung ;
analyzed: the tshom yang rung ;
translated: and the nonvirtuous mind that possesses doubt

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan ba gang yin pa de la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan ba gang yin pa de la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ste /
translated: are concomitant with four root afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa de dang ma 'dres par bshad pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dang ma 'dres par bshad pa nyi shu'o //
translated: Twenty mental factors are explained as not mixed with those afflictions.🔽The mind that is concomitant with the secondary afflictions such as anger, as previously explained, has twenty mental factors,

original: khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bshad pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la yang nyi shu po de dag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bshad pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la yang nyi shu po de dag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: and it also has that secondary affliction.

original: 'gyod pa dang ldan pa la yang nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang ldan pa la yang nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ste /
translated: Also, when associated with regret, twenty-one mental factors occur.

original: 'gyod pa de nyid nyi shu rtsa gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa de nyid nyi shu rtsa gcig pa yin no //
translated: Regret itself is the twenty-first.

original: mdor na mi dge ba'i sems ma 'dres pa dang / lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba la yang nyi shu 'byung la /
analyzed: mdor na mi dge ba'i sems ma 'dres pa dang / lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba la yang nyi shu 'byung la /
translated: In brief, when a nonvirtuous mind is not mixed with views, twenty mental factors occur.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: When it is associated with other root afflictions and branch afflictions, twenty-one mental factors occur.

original: bsgribs la bco brgyad /
analyzed: bsgribs la bco brgyad /
translated: Eighteen occur in the obscured.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: In the desire realm, the obscured nivṛta neutral mind is that associated with the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: de la ni sems las byung ba bco brgyad 'byung ste ;
analyzed: de la ni sems las byung ba bco brgyad 'byung ste ;
translated: Eighteen mental factors occur in that mind:

original: sa dang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: the ten universal mental states, the six afflicted mental states, and both investigation and analysis.

original: lta ba ni snga ma dang 'dra ba nyid de lhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba ni snga ma dang 'dra ba nyid de lhag pa ma yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self is the same as before and is not additional.

original: lung ma bstan pa gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod /
translated: It is asserted that twelve mental factors occur in other neutral minds.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las gzhan ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las gzhan ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o ;
translated: Other than those obscured neutral minds, there are unobscured neutral minds.

original: / de la ni sems las byung ba bcu gnyis 'byung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: / de la ni sems las byung ba bcu gnyis 'byung bar 'dod de /
translated: It is asserted that twelve mental factors occur in that mind.

original: sa mang po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag go //
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag go //
translated: The ten universal mental states and both investigation and analysis.

original: nyi 'og pa dag ni 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod la yid mi bde ba yang yid bde ba dang 'dra bar lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod de /
analyzed: nyi 'og pa dag ni 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod la yid mi bde ba yang yid bde ba dang 'dra bar lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod de /
translated: Kashmiri Vaibhasikas assert that regret is neutral and mental dissatisfaction is neutral like mental satisfaction.

original: de dag gi ltar na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la bcu gsum 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la bcu gsum 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: According to them, thirteen mental factors occur in the mind that is concomitant with them.

original: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal phyir //
analyzed: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal phyir //
translated: Sleep is not incompatible with any mind.

original: gang la yod pa des bsnan no //
analyzed: gang la yod pa des bsnan no //
translated: Therefore it is added to all.

original: gnyid ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang yin pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i sems thams cad dang mi 'gal bas /
analyzed: gnyid ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang yin pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i sems thams cad dang mi 'gal bas /
translated: Sleep is virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral. Therefore it is not incompatible with any of the minds that have been explained.

original: @68a * // de'i phyir gang la de yod pa de la des bsnan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: @68a * // de'i phyir gang la de yod pa de la des bsnan par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that wherever this exists, it is added to that.

original: gang la nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung ba de la ni nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: gang la nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung ba de la ni nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Where twenty-two exist, twenty-three exist.

original: gang la nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ba de la ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ba de la ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Where twenty-three exist, twenty-four exist.

original: gang de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems las byung ba nges par bshad pa /
analyzed: gang de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems las byung ba nges par bshad pa /
translated: The mental factors of the desire realm have been explained in this way.

original: de las 'gyod gnyid mi dge rnams //
analyzed: de las 'gyod gnyid mi dge rnams //
translated: Regret, sleep, and the unwholesome factors

original: bsam gtan dang po dag na med //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dag na med //
translated: do not exist in the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po na ni ji skad bshad pa de las 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang / gang yang cung zad mi dge ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na ni ji skad bshad pa de las 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang / gang yang cung zad mi dge ba 'di lta ste /
translated: In the first absorption, regret kaukṛtya, sleep middha, and the unwholesome factors such as anger,

original: g-yo dang sgyu dang rgyags pa ma gtogs pa khro ba la sogs pa dang / khong khro ba dang nga cha med pa dang khrel med pa dag thams cad du med de /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu dang rgyags pa ma gtogs pa khro ba la sogs pa dang / khong khro ba dang nga cha med pa dang khrel med pa dag thams cad du med de /
translated: envy, avarice, concealment, dishonesty, and so on, except for pride, deceit, and pretense, do not exist.

original: gzhan thams cad ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: All other factors are similar to those of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po na med pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na dang / rtog pa'ang bsam gtan khyad par can na med de /🔽lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na med pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na dang / rtog pa'ang bsam gtan khyad par can na med de / lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The special meditative absorption is devoid of investigation.

original: de yi gong na dpyod pa yang //
analyzed: de yi gong na dpyod pa yang //
translated: The higher ones are devoid of analysis.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can las gong ma bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs med pa dag na ni ji skad rtog pa dang / dpyod pa yang med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can las gong ma bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs med pa dag na ni ji skad rtog pa dang / dpyod pa yang med do //
translated: The second meditative absorption and the higher meditative absorptions, as well as the formless meditative attainments, are devoid of analysis.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni g-yo dang sgyu yang med de /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni g-yo dang sgyu yang med de /
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are also devoid of deceit and hypocrisy.

original: lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The remaining factors are as before.🔽The formless meditative attainments are devoid of the five aggregates.🔽The formless meditative attainments are devoid of the five aggregates.🔽The original: tshangs pa'i bar du sgyu yod par 'byung gi /'khor dang 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir gong na ni med de /🔽de ni rang gi 'khor gyi nang du dge slong rta thul gyis 'byung ba chen po 'di dag yongs su ma lus par gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes dri ba dris pa dang / mi shes pas kho bo ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bar du sgyu yod par 'byung gi /'khor dang 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir gong na ni med de /🔽de ni rang gi 'khor gyi nang du dge slong rta thul gyis 'byung ba chen po 'di dag yongs su ma lus par gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes dri ba dris pa dang / mi shes pas kho bo ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: The

original: tshangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'o //
translated: It is the Great Brahma.

original: dbang phyug go //🔽byed pa po'o ;
analyzed: dbang phyug go // byed pa po'o ;
translated: It is the Lord.🔽It is the creator.

original: / sprul pa po'o //🔽'byin par byed pa po'o //
analyzed: / sprul pa po'o // 'byin par byed pa po'o //
translated: It is the transformer.🔽It is the one who sends forth.

original: 'byin pa po'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa po'o //
translated: It is the one who emits.

original: dngos po rnams kyi pha lta bu yin no zhes gtam rlung la bskur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi pha lta bu yin no zhes gtam rlung la bskur ro //
translated: It is the father of all things.

original: sa gang na sems gang la sems las byung ba ji snyed cig 'byung ba de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sa gang na sems gang la sems las byung ba ji snyed cig 'byung ba de ni bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained in which stage and in which thought how many thought-concomitants are found.

original: da ni gzhung la sems las byung ba kha cig gi tha dad du bya ba 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhung la sems las byung ba kha cig gi tha dad du bya ba 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we must explain the differences in the classifications of the thought-concomitants.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between lack of self-respect and lack of moral conscience?

original: ma gus ngo tsha med /
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med /
translated: Lack of self-respect is disrespect.

original: yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la ma gus pa nyid de /
analyzed: yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la ma gus pa nyid de /
translated: Lack of self-respect is disrespect for the qualities and those who possess the qualities.

original: bkur ba med pa nyid dang / 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid ni ngo tsha med pa nyid de gus pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs @68b so ;
analyzed: bkur ba med pa nyid dang / 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid ni ngo tsha med pa nyid de gus pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs @68b so ;
translated: Lack of self-respect is the opposite of respect, the absence of fear of the consequences of one's actions, the absence of submission to the power of others.

original: / khrel med /
analyzed: / khrel med /
translated: Lack of moral conscience is the opposite of moral conscience.

original: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
translated: Lack of moral conscience is the absence of fear of the consequences of one's actions.

original: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste /
translated: The blameworthy is that which is censured by the wise.

original: de la 'jigs par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jigs par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o //
translated: Lack of dread of the blameworthy is shamelessness.

original: 'dir 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Dread is the undesirable result of an action,

original: 'di las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is afraid of that.

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: How is this known?

original: mi 'jigs par lta ba 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid yin nam 'on te 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid yin /
analyzed: mi 'jigs par lta ba 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid yin nam 'on te 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid yin /
translated: Is it the view that there is nothing to fear, or is it the lack of fear?

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence?

original: gal te mi 'jigs par lta ba yin na ni shes rab yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi 'jigs par lta ba yin na ni shes rab yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the view that there is nothing to fear, then it is wisdom.

original: gal te 'jigs par mi lta ba yin na ni ma rig par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jigs par mi lta ba yin na ni ma rig par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the lack of fear, then it is ignorance.

original: lta ba yang lta ba nyid ma yin la mi lta ba yang mi lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba yang lta ba nyid ma yin la mi lta ba yang mi lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Neither view nor the lack of view is shamelessness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the proximate factor of instability that is the basis of both.

original: de ni khrel med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni khrel med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is shamelessness.

original: gzhan dag na re ni bdag la ltos nas nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni bdag la ltos nas nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha med pa yin te /
translated: Others say: Shamelessness is not to avoid wrongdoing in relation to oneself.

original: gzhan la ltos nas ni khrel med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas ni khrel med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Lack of conscience is not to avoid wrongdoing in relation to another.

original: de lta na yang ltos pa gnyis cig car ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ltos pa gnyis cig car ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can both types of reliance be established simultaneously?

original: bdag dang gzhan la ltos pa cig car ro zhes ni mi zer ro //🔽'on kyang mi 'dzem pa kha cig bdag la ltos nas kyang 'jug pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo tsha med pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la ltos pa cig car ro zhes ni mi zer ro // 'on kyang mi 'dzem pa kha cig bdag la ltos nas kyang 'jug pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo tsha med pa yin no //
translated: We do not say that both types of reliance are simultaneous.🔽However, some who do not avoid wrongdoing in relation to oneself are shameless.

original: gzhan la ltos nas 'jug pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni khrel med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas 'jug pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni khrel med pa yin no //
translated: Some who do not avoid wrongdoing in relation to another are without conscience.

original: bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa yin par rig par bya ste /
