translated: It should be understood that the opposite of these is shame and conscience.

original: re zhig rtog pa dang po ltar na gus pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: re zhig rtog pa dang po ltar na gus pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: According to the first conception, shame is to have respect,

original: bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba dang bcas pa nyid ni ngo tsha shes pa yin la ;
analyzed: bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba dang bcas pa nyid ni ngo tsha shes pa yin la ;
translated: to have esteem, to be controlled by fear.

original: kha na ma tho ba dag la 'jigs par lta ba nyid ni khrel yod pa yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dag la 'jigs par lta ba nyid ni khrel yod pa yin no //
translated: Shame is the fear of being blamed by others.

original: rtog pa gnyis pa ltar na ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos ba dag las 'dzem pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis pa ltar na ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos ba dag las 'dzem pa dag yin no //
translated: According to the second theory, shame and abashment consist of the avoidance of what is blameworthy in relation to oneself and others.

original: dga' ba dang gus pa la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /🔽dga' dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang gus pa la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na / dga' dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the difference between joy and respect?

original: dga' ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dga' ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Joy is of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ni srid pa ste /
translated: The defiled is craving,

original: dper na bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dag la dga' ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dag la dga' ba lta bu'o //
translated: like the joy one has in one’s wife, children, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: The undefiled is faith,

original: dper na ston pa dang bla ma dang yon tan can rnams la dga' ba lta bu'o //🔽dad pa yin la dga' ba @69a * //
analyzed: dper na ston pa dang bla ma dang yon tan can rnams la dga' ba lta bu'o // dad pa yin la dga' ba @69a * //
translated: like the joy one has in the Teacher, the preceptor, and the virtuous.

original: ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is faith that is not joy,

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the faith that has suffering and the origin of suffering for its object.

original: dga' ba yin la dad pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dga' ba yin la dad pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is joy that is not faith.

original: dga' ba nyon mongs pa can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dga' ba nyon mongs pa can lta bu'o //
translated: For example, afflicted joy.

original: gnyi ga yin pa ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'i dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'i dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is that which is both, such as faith that focuses on cessation and the path.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: There is that which is neither, such as joy and faith that are not included in those mentioned above.

original: gang zag dag la ltos nas ni dga' ba yin la gus pa ma yin pa ni bu dang chung ma dang / lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag la dga' ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zag dag la ltos nas ni dga' ba yin la gus pa ma yin pa ni bu dang chung ma dang / lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag la dga' ba lta bu'o //
translated: In terms of persons, there is joy that is not respect, such as joy toward one's son, wife, co-emergent and attendant.

original: gus pa yin la dga' ba ma yin pa ni bla ma gzhan dag la gus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gus pa yin la dga' ba ma yin pa ni bla ma gzhan dag la gus pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is respect that is not joy, such as respect for other gurus.

original: gnyi ga yin pa ni rang gi bla ma dag la gus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa ni rang gi bla ma dag la gus pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is that which is both, such as respect for one's own gurus.

original: de gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: There is that which is neither, such as joy and respect that are not included in those mentioned above.

original: gzhan dag na re dad pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan la yid ches pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dad pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan la yid ches pa yin la /
translated: Others say: Faith is conviction in qualities.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba ni dga' pa yin te /
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba ni dga' pa yin te /
translated: Joy is joy preceded by that.

original: de lta bas na de nyid dga' ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid dga' ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, it is the same thing that is called both joy and respect.

original: gus nyid ngo tsha shes ;
analyzed: gus nyid ngo tsha shes ;
translated: Respect is shame.

original: gus pa ni ngo tsha shes pa ji skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gus pa ni ngo tsha shes pa ji skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: Respect is shame as it has been explained.

original: gzhan dag na re gus pa zhes bya ba ni bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gus pa zhes bya ba ni bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
translated: According to another opinion, respect is the quality that consists of honoring;

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa yin te /
translated: shame is the quality that consists of shrinking away from doing wrong, which is preceded by respect.

original: de'i phyir gus pa nyid ngo tsha shes pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gus pa nyid ngo tsha shes pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus respect is not shame.

original: de gnyis 'dod dang gzugs dag na ;
analyzed: de gnyis 'dod dang gzugs dag na ;
translated: Joy and respect exist in the realms of desire and of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni dga' ba dang gus pa dag med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni dga' ba dang gus pa dag med do //
translated: Joy and respect are absent in the realm of immateriality.

original: dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dge pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir de na yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dge pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir de na yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But faith and shame are among the factors that are present in every wholesome thought.

original: dad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Faith is of two types:🔽faith in the object of faith, i.e., the Three Jewels;

original: chos dag dang gang zag la dad pa yin la /🔽bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos dag dang gang zag la dad pa yin la /🔽bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: faith in the object of esteem, i.e., the wholesome dharmas.

original: de la gang dag gang zag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa de dag de na med de /
analyzed: de la gang dag gang zag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa de dag de na med de /
translated: Faith and shame are absent in the formless realm.

original: 'dir ni dga' ba dang gus pa de dag la bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni dga' ba dang gus pa de dag la bsams pa yin no //
translated: Here, the root text is concerned with joy and respect.

original: rtogs pa dang dpyod pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang dpyod pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between discursive thought and sustained thought?

original: rtog dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib nyid //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib nyid //
translated: Discursive thought and sustained thought are grossness and calmness of the mind.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: Of what?

original: sems kyi'o zhes 'og nas 'chad de /🔽rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi'o zhes 'og nas 'chad de / rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'o //
translated: The root text will say, “of the mind.”🔽Discursive thought is grossness of the mind.

original: dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa'o //
translated: Sustained thought is calmness of the mind.

original: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhe na /
analyzed: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhe na /
translated: How can these two be associated with a single mind?🔽Some say: For example, when butter is placed in water, it is not too cold

original: kha cig na re dper na mar sar chu dag gi nang du bor ba steng nas nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis reg na ha cang yang mi 'khyag la /
analyzed: kha cig na re dper na mar sar chu dag gi nang du bor ba steng nas nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis reg na ha cang yang mi 'khyag la /
translated: because it is touched by the sun’s rays from above, and it is not too hot🔽because it is covered by water from below.

original: ha cang yang mi 'ju @69b ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ha cang yang mi 'ju @69b ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, the mind is not too calm

original: sems kyang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ha cang zhib par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems kyang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ha cang zhib par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: because it is associated with discursive thought and sustained thought,

original: ha cang rtsing bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ha cang rtsing bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: and it is not too gross.

original: de la gnyi ga'i bya ba yang yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la gnyi ga'i bya ba yang yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: But they are the cause of both.

original: de lta na ni ji ltar nyi ma dang chu mar sar 'khyag pa nyid dang 'ju ba nyid dag gi rgyu mtshan nyid yin gyi de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pa ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag
analyzed: de lta na ni ji ltar nyi ma dang chu mar sar 'khyag pa nyid dang 'ju ba nyid dag gi rgyu mtshan nyid yin gyi de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pa ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag
translated: In that case, just as the sun and water are the causal conditions of the solidification and melting of snow, but are not their intrinsic natures, so too investigation and analysis are the causal conditions of coarseness and subtlety,

original: gi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin no /
analyzed: gi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin no /
translated: but are not their intrinsic natures.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib pas dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis ltos pa can yang yin pas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib pas dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis ltos pa can yang yin pas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since coarseness and subtlety are relative, investigation and analysis exist up to the summit of existence.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid kyis rang bzhin tha dad par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid kyis rang bzhin tha dad par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that they are different in substance because of coarseness and subtlety.

original: gzhan dag na re mdo las rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni ngag mngon par 'du byed pa yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo las rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni ngag mngon par 'du byed pa yin par gsungs te /
translated: Others say: A sūtra declares that investigation and analysis are the formative force that is speech.

original: brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra'i ma brtags ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra'i ma brtags ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They speak after examining and investigating, not without examining and investigating.

original: de la rtsing ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rtsing ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni rtog pa yin no //
translated: Those that are gross are discursive thoughts.

original: zhib pa gang dag yin pa de dag na dpyod pa yin no zher zer ro //
analyzed: zhib pa gang dag yin pa de dag na dpyod pa yin no zher zer ro //
translated: Those that are subtle are analyses.

original: gal te sems rtse gcig la rtsing ba yang chos gzhan yin /
analyzed: gal te sems rtse gcig la rtsing ba yang chos gzhan yin /
translated: If a single thought has a different factor that is gross

original: zhib pa yang chos gzhan yin na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: zhib pa yang chos gzhan yin na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: and a different factor that is subtle, what is the contradiction?

original: gal te tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du rigs tha dad pa zhig yin na ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du rigs tha dad pa zhig yin na ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: If it is a different type, like feeling and conception, there is no contradiction.

original: rigs gcig pa ni chung du dang chen pa nyid cig car 'byung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: rigs gcig pa ni chung du dang chen pa nyid cig car 'byung ba mi srid do //
translated: But it is not possible for a single type to occur both as small and as large.

original: rigs tha dad pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also a different type.

original: 'o na ni de brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni de brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Then it must be explained.

original: de brjod par ni dka' ste /
analyzed: de brjod par ni dka' ste /
translated: It is difficult to explain.

original: de'i phyir chung du dang chen po'i nyid kyis gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chung du dang chen po'i nyid kyis gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that they are small and large.

original: de lta na ni gsal bar mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de lta na ni gsal bar mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If that is so, it is not clear.

original: rigs re re la yang chung du dang chen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs re re la yang chung du dang chen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For each family has a small and a great type.

original: gzhan dag na re sems gcig la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag mi 'byung ba nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems gcig la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag mi 'byung ba nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, vitarka and vicāra do not exist together.

original: da ni ji ltar bsam gtan dang po yan lag la par bshad ce na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar bsam gtan dang po yan lag la par bshad ce na /
translated: How can the first meditation, which has five members, be associated with joy and pleasure?

original: sa las de yan lag lnga par bshad kyi skad cig las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa las de yan lag lnga par bshad kyi skad cig las ni ma yin no //
translated: The Sūtra teaches that the first meditation has five members: initial inquiry, investigation, joy, pleasure, and concentration.

original: nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between conceit and pride?

original: nga rgyal khengs pa rgyags pa ni //🔽rang gi chos la chags pa yi //🔽sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o //🔽pha rol po las gang yang rung pa'i khyad par zhig yongs su brtags nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal khengs pa rgyags pa ni // rang gi chos la chags pa yi // sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o // pha rol po las gang yang rung pa'i khyad par zhig yongs su brtags nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Conceit is the swelling up of the mind due to attachment to pleasure, youth, etc.🔽Pride is the swelling up of the mind due to the consideration of oneself from a particular point of view.🔽Conceit is the swelling up of the mind due to attachment to pleasure, youth, etc.

original: @70a * // rgyags pa ni rang gi chos rnams kho na la chags pa'i sems yongs su gtugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @70a * // rgyags pa ni rang gi chos rnams kho na la chags pa'i sems yongs su gtugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind due to the consideration of oneself from a particular point of view.

original: gzhan dag na re chang las skyes pa ji lta bde bzhin du rgyags pa yang 'dod chags las skyes pa'i kun tu dga' ba'i bye brag yin no zhas zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chang las skyes pa ji lta bde bzhin du rgyags pa yang 'dod chags las skyes pa'i kun tu dga' ba'i bye brag yin no zhas zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, intoxication is a certain type of joy which has its origin in attachment.

original: sems las byung ba rnams sems dang bcas te rnam pa re re nas bshad zin to //🔽gsung rab las 'di dag gis tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i phyir de dag gi ming 'di dag brjod de /🔽sems dang yid dang rnam shes ni don gcig 'byed pas na sems so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams sems dang bcas te rnam pa re re nas bshad zin to // gsung rab las 'di dag gis tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i phyir de dag gi ming 'di dag brjod de / sems dang yid dang rnam shes ni don gcig 'byed pas na sems so //
translated: The mental factors have been explained along with the mind.🔽The Sūtra teaches that there are fifty one mental factors: ten universals, ten particular s, ten unwholesome factors, six wholesome factors, and five undetermined factors.🔽Mind, thought, and consciousness are synonymous.

original: shes pas na yid do //
analyzed: shes pas na yid do //
translated: Thought is that which is capable of reflection.

original: rnam par shes pa nas rnam par shes pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas rnam par shes pa'o ;
translated: Consciousness is that which is aware of an object.

original: / kha cig na re dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams dag gis bsags pas na sems so /
analyzed: / kha cig na re dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams dag gis bsags pas na sems so /
translated: According to another opinion, mind is that which is accumulated by the wholesome and unwholesome factors.

original: de nyid rten du gyur pa ni yid do //
analyzed: de nyid rten du gyur pa ni yid do //
translated: Thought is that which is the basis of the mind.

original: rten par gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rten par gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Consciousness is that which is based on the thought.🔽According to another opinion, mind is that which is accumulated by the wholesome and unwholesome factors.

original: ji ltar sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba don gcig pa de bzhin du sems dang sems byung dang ; / rten dang dmigs dang rnam bcas dang / mtshungs par ldan ba'ang /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba don gcig pa de bzhin du sems dang sems byung dang ; / rten dang dmigs dang rnam bcas dang / mtshungs par ldan ba'ang /
translated: and also with association.

original: don gcig ste /
analyzed: don gcig ste /
translated: These have the same meaning.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag nyid dbang po la brten pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag nyid dbang po la brten pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: These minds and mental factors are said to be with support because they are supported on the sense faculties.

original: yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: They are said to have an object because they apprehend objects.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: They are said to have an aspect because they discriminate the object in a specific way.

original: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan ba dag go //
analyzed: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan ba dag go //
translated: They are said to be associated because they are equivalent in five ways.

original: rnam pa gang dag gis mtshungs par ldan zhe na /🔽rnam pa lngas /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag gis mtshungs par ldan zhe na / rnam pa lngas /
translated: In what way are they equivalent?🔽They are equivalent in five ways.

original: mtshungs pa rnam pa lnga po rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnam pa lnga po rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: They are equivalent in five ways: support, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: rdzas mtshungs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas mtshungs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the similarity of substance?

original: ji ltar sems gcig kho na yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang re re yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems gcig kho na yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang re re yin pa'o //
translated: Just as there is only one mind, so too there is only one mental factor for each category.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rgyas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag bstan zin to //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rgyas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag bstan zin to //
translated: The mind and mental factors have been explained in their entirety, together with their classifications.

original: mi ldan pa yi 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yi 'du byed rnams //
translated: The formations dissociated from the mind are:🔽attainment, nonattainment, homogeneity,

original: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes med snyoms 'jug dag dang / srog dang mtshan nyid rnams dang ni //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes med snyoms 'jug dag dang / srog dang mtshan nyid rnams dang ni //
translated: the meditative development of the attainment of non-perception, life faculty, the characteristics,

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yang //
translated: and also the groups of words, phrases and syllables.

original: 'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la gzugs kyi nga bzhin yang ma yin bas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag @70b ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la gzugs kyi nga bzhin yang ma yin bas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag @70b ces bya'o //
translated: These formations are described as being 'dissociated from the mind' because they are neither conjoined with the mind nor are they of the nature of form.🔽Of these, attainment is twofold:

original: de la re zhig thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o //
translated: attainment and possession.

original: thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Attainment is twofold:

original: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa dang / thob nas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa dang / thob nas ldan pa'o //
translated: attainment in the sense of acquisition and attainment in the sense of possession.

original: bzlog pa ni ma thob pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma thob pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The opposite of that is nonacquisition.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa 'di dag gang gi yin zhe na /🔽thob dang ma thob dang rgyud du //
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa 'di dag gang gi yin zhe na / thob dang ma thob dang rgyud du //
translated: What is the nature of acquisition and nonacquisition?🔽They belong to those that are obtained and not obtained and to the stream.

original: gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: They belong to those that are obtained and not obtained and to the stream.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not belong to those that are possessed by others,

original: gzhan gyi dag dang ni 'gal yang ldan pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dag dang ni 'gal yang ldan pa med do //
translated: because there is no possession of that which is possessed by others.

original: rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not belong to those that are not possessed by a stream,

original: sems can du mi bgrang ba dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //
analyzed: sems can du mi bgrang ba dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //
translated: because there is no possession of that which is not counted as a sentient being.

original: 'di ni re zhig 'dus ma byas dag gi nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig 'dus ma byas dag gi nges pa yin no //
translated: This is the certainty of unconditioned states.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams kyi thob pa dang ma thob pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams kyi thob pa dang ma thob pa dag ni /
translated: Obtainment and nonobtainment of conditioned and unconditioned states

original: 'gog gnyis kyi /
analyzed: 'gog gnyis kyi /
translated: Obtainment and nonobtainment of the two cessations

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ni sems can thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ni sems can thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: All sentient beings possess nonanalytical cessation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las /
translated: Therefore Abhidharma states:

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang su zhig ldan zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang su zhig ldan zhe na /
translated: Who possesses uncontaminated states?

original: smras pa / sems can thams cad do zhes 'byung ngo zhes grag go //
analyzed: smras pa / sems can thams cad do zhes 'byung ngo zhes grag go //
translated: It is said that all sentient beings possess it.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang ni 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa ma gtogs pa 'phags pa thams cad dang / so so'i skye bo kha cig kyang yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang ni 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa ma gtogs pa 'phags pa thams cad dang / so so'i skye bo kha cig kyang yin no //
translated: The possession of analytical cessation is possessed by all āryas except those abiding in the first moment of the sixteenth moment of the path of seeing who possess all the bonds and by some ordinary beings.

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'ga' yang ldan ba med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'ga' yang ldan ba med de /
translated: No one possesses space.

original: de bas na 'di la thob pa med de /🔽gang la thob pa med pa de la ni ma thob pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la thob pa med de / gang la thob pa med pa de la ni ma thob pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not obtained.🔽It is a tenet of this system that if something is not obtained, it is not possessed.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba 'di gang las /
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba 'di gang las /
translated: What is the source for the assertion that something called obtainment is a discrete real entity?🔽It is said that it is stated in sūtra.

original: smras pa mdo las te /
analyzed: smras pa mdo las te /
translated: The sūtra states:

original: mdo las de mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag bskyed cing so sor thob pa las kun tu ldan pas na yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa'i 'phags par gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las de mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag bskyed cing so sor thob pa las kun tu ldan pas na yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa'i 'phags par gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: “The noble one who generates these ten qualities of the nonlearner and possesses them individually becomes an ārya who abandons five factors.”

original: 'o na ni des ni sems can du mi sten pa dag dang sems can gzhan dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni des ni sems can du mi sten pa dag dang sems can gzhan dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: But then it would be concomitant with those not related to sentient beings and with other sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽Because a sutra states:

original: mdo las dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Monks, a wheel-turning king possesses the seven jewels.

original: der ni dbang ba de nyid la ldan pa'i sgrar gsungs te /
analyzed: der ni dbang ba de nyid la ldan pa'i sgrar gsungs te /
translated: Here the term possess means to have mastery over.

original: de rin po che sna bdun dag la dbang nyid dga' dgur byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de rin po che sna bdun dag la dbang nyid dga' dgur byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because he has mastery over the seven jewels and can use them as he wishes.

original: ldan ba der ni dbang ba nyid yin la /🔽gzhan du ni rdzas gzhan yin no //
analyzed: ldan ba der ni dbang ba nyid yin la / gzhan du ni rdzas gzhan yin no //
translated: Possession is mastery over something.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dag las /🔽de lta @71a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dag las / de lta @71a * //
translated: But elsewhere it is a different substance.

original: na yang mi rung ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: na yang mi rung ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: mi rung ba 'di dag yod de /🔽gang gi phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ltar ram /
analyzed: mi rung ba 'di dag yod de / gang gi phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ltar ram /
translated: These are the problems.🔽What is wrong with that?

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ltar 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang mi snang la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ltar 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang mi snang la /
translated: The nature of this is not apparent, like form, sound, and so on, or attachment, anger and so on.

original: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa ltar bya ba yang mi snang ba de'i phyir rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa ltar bya ba yang mi snang ba de'i phyir rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo //
translated: But the activity of the possession of the factors of existence is not perceived, as is the case with the eye, ear, etc. Therefore, it is not possible for a real entity to exist.

original: gal te chos rnams skye ba'i rgyu la thob pa'o zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams skye ba'i rgyu la thob pa'o zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause of the arising of factors of existence is possession,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be unconditioned.

original: chos gang dag ma thob pa rnams dang / gang dag sa 'phos pa dang 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms pa de dag kyang ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gang dag ma thob pa rnams dang / gang dag sa 'phos pa dang 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms pa de dag kyang ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And how could those factors of existence that are not obtained, and those that are abandoned through the change of stage or through the absence of passion, arise?

original: 'on te lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu rkyen yin no zhe na /🔽de'i tshe skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu rkyen yin no zhe na / de'i tshe skye ba'am /
translated: If you say that the cause of possession is co-arising,🔽then what would the arising of possession do?

original: skye ba'i skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: Or what would the arising of the arising of possession do?

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po skye ba'i khyad par du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po skye ba'i khyad par du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And there would be no distinction in the arising of the small, medium, and great defilements of those who are bound with all bonds,

original: thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no distinction in possession.

original: 'on te de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur na ni de kho na las de dag skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur na ni de kho na las de dag skye ba yin no //
translated: But if they are distinguished from that, then they are produced from that itself.

original: de lta bas na thob pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na thob pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no /
translated: Thus, acquisition is not the cause of the arising of the unarisen.

original: thob pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes de skad du su zer /
analyzed: thob pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes de skad du su zer /
translated: Who says that acquisition is the cause of the arising of the unarisen?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin te /🔽thob pa med na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams la 'di dag ni 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin te / thob pa med na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams la 'di dag ni 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the classification of beings.

original: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo ngo shes rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo ngo shes rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no acquisition, then the classification of beings would not exist: “These are āryas, these are ordinary beings.🔽”

original: de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag las 'gyur bar 'os so //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag las 'gyur bar 'os so //
translated: It is proper that this classification should exist due to the distinction of whether or not the afflictions are abandoned.

original: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: “These have abandoned the afflictions.🔽These have not abandoned the afflictions.”

original: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But how could this be?

original: thob pa yod na ni de dang bral ma bral las 'di yang 'grub bo //
analyzed: thob pa yod na ni de dang bral ma bral las 'di yang 'grub bo //
translated: If acquisition exists, then this is established from whether or not one is separated from it.

original: 'di ni rten gyi bye brag las 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni rten gyi bye brag las 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: This is established by the specific basis.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas de ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthus ji ltar de dag gis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang 'byung bar mi nus pa de ltar gyur pa yin te /🔽de'i phyir rten 'bru mes tshig pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon du ma gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas de ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthus ji ltar de dag gis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang 'byung bar mi nus pa de ltar gyur pa yin te / de'i phyir rten 'bru mes tshig pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon du ma gyur pa'am /
translated: That is, the state of āryas is such that the afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation are incapable of arising again through the power of the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par byas na nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bya la /🔽bzlog pa ni ma spangs pa ma yin pas gang ma spangs pa de dang mi ldan /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par byas na nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bya la / bzlog pa ni ma spangs pa ma yin pas gang ma spangs pa de dang mi ldan /
translated: Therefore, like seeds burned by fire, they are said to abandon afflictions when the seeds of afflictions are transformed or the state of seeds of mundane paths is impaired.🔽But if they are not abandoned, they are not abandoned.

original: gang spangs @71b pa de dang ni mi ldan no zhes gdags so //
analyzed: gang spangs @71b pa de dang ni mi ldan no zhes gdags so //
translated: Thus it is said that those not abandoned are not possessed and those abandoned are not possessed.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Virtuous phenomena are also of two types:

original: ma 'bad par skye ba rnams dang / 'bad de skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: ma 'bad par skye ba rnams dang / 'bad de skye ba rnams te /
translated: those that arise without effort and those that arise with effort.

original: gang dag skye bas thob pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba de dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag skye bas thob pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba de dag yin no //
translated: Those that are obtained through birth and those that are cultivated.

original: de la ma 'bad par skye ba rnams dang ni rten de dag gi sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas pa'i phyir ldan la /
analyzed: de la ma 'bad par skye ba rnams dang ni rten de dag gi sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas pa'i phyir ldan la /
translated: Those that arise without effort are possessed because the seeds of those factors have not been damaged in that person.

original: nyams par byas pa'i phyir mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyams par byas pa'i phyir mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those that are damaged are not possessed.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa yin no //
translated: This is the severance of the wholesome roots.

original: de yang log par lta bas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang log par lta bas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is due to wrong views.

original: rgyu la dge ba'i chos rnams gyi  sa bon gyi dngos po gtan du yang dag par bcom pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: rgyu la dge ba'i chos rnams gyi  sa bon gyi dngos po gtan du yang dag par bcom pa ni ma yin no /
translated: The seeds of wholesome factors have not been completely destroyed in the causal basis.

original: gang dag 'bad de skye ba ni skyes pa de dag dang rgyud la de dag skye ba'i dbang nyid thogs pa med pa'i phyir ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'bad de skye ba ni skyes pa de dag dang rgyud la de dag skye ba'i dbang nyid thogs pa med pa'i phyir ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that arise through effort are possessed because the power of the arising of those factors in the life-stream is unimpeded.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sa bon kho na rtsa nas ma bton pa dang / nyams par ma byas pa dang / dbang nyid kyi dus na rgyas par gyur pa ni ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob kyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sa bon kho na rtsa nas ma bton pa dang / nyams par ma byas pa dang / dbang nyid kyi dus na rgyas par gyur pa ni ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob kyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: Thus, here, the seed is not something that is not uprooted, not something that is not damaged, not something that is not developed at the time of the initiation. It obtains the name “endowed” but it is not a different substance.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this thing called a “seed”?

original: 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rgyud 'gyur ba'i bye brag gi mngon sum mam brgyud pas nus pa'i ming dang gzugs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rgyud 'gyur ba'i bye brag gi mngon sum mam brgyud pas nus pa'i ming dang gzugs gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is name-and-form, which is capable of producing an effect, either directly or indirectly, through a transformation of the stream.

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this thing called “transformation”?

original: rgyud gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the stream into another state.

original: rgyud ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin /
analyzed: rgyud ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this thing called a “stream”?

original: 'du byed dus gsum pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'du byed dus gsum pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rnams so //
translated: It is the three time periods of the formations, both as causes and as effects.

original: gang las chags pa dang ldan pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gzhi po dag bsgom pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan no zhes gsungs pa der ni ldan pa chags pa dang du len ba'am mi sel ba yin te /🔽ji srid du de dang du len ba'am mi sel ba de srid du de dag bsgom pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: gang las chags pa dang ldan pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gzhi po dag bsgom pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan no zhes gsungs pa der ni ldan pa chags pa dang du len ba'am mi sel ba yin te / ji srid du de dang du len ba'am mi sel ba de srid du de dag bsgom pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan no //
translated: One who possesses attachment does not have the fortune to cultivate the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽As long as one does not abandon or eliminate that attachment, one does not have the fortune to cultivate the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de ltar na ldan pa 'di dang de 'gog pa mi ldan pa ni rnam pa thams cad du btags pa'i chos yin gyi rdzas kyi chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ldan pa 'di dang de 'gog pa mi ldan pa ni rnam pa thams cad du btags pa'i chos yin gyi rdzas kyi chos ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, this possession and its cessation are both imputed factors, not substantial factors.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gnyi ga rdzas kho na yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gnyi ga rdzas kho na yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Vaibhasikas say that both are substantial.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ni kho bo cag gis grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag gis grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is our tenet.

original: thob pa de ni /
analyzed: thob pa de ni /
translated: Obtainment

original: dus gsum pa'i rnam pa gsum zhes grag ste /
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i rnam pa gsum zhes grag ste /
translated: Obtainment is of three types, past, future, and present.

original: chos 'das pa rnams kyi thob pa 'das pa yang yod /
analyzed: chos 'das pa rnams kyi thob pa 'das pa yang yod /
translated: Obtainment of past phenomena is past.🔽Obtainment of future phenomena is future.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yang yod la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yang yod la /
translated: The future and the present also exist.🔽

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yang so sor rnam pa @72a * //🔽gsum mo // dge la sogs kyi dge la sogs //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yang so sor rnam pa @72a * // gsum mo // dge la sogs kyi dge la sogs //
translated: The obtainment of past and future states is also like this.🔽The obtainment of present states is threefold.🔽The obtainment of virtuous and so on is virtuous and so on.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //🔽der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no // der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //
translated: The obtainment of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral states is, respectively, virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.🔽The obtainment of those belonging to a realm is of that realm.

original: chos gang dag khams gang du gtogs pa de dag gi thob pa ni rang gi khams pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gang dag khams gang du gtogs pa de dag gi thob pa ni rang gi khams pa yin te /
translated: The obtainment of those phenomena belonging to a realm is of that realm.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //🔽ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no // ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The obtainment of those belonging to the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm is, respectively, of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.🔽The obtainment of those not belonging is of four types.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni mdong bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni mdong bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The obtainment of uncontaminated states is, in brief, of four types.

original: khams gsum pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The three realms and the uncontaminated.

original: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i ni khams gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i ni khams gsum pa yin no //
translated: The unconditioned factors are the cessation due to deliberation and the cessation not due to deliberation.🔽The cessation not due to deliberation is of the realm of desire, of the realm of fine-materiality, and of the realm of immateriality.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang yin la /
translated: The cessation due to deliberation is of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality.

original: zag pa med pa yang yin no ;
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang yin no ;
translated: It is also pure.

original: / lam gyi bden pa'i zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: / lam gyi bden pa'i zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is the pure part of the truth of the path.

original: de ni mdor bsdus te rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdus te rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: In brief, it is of four types.

original: slob pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni slob pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni slob pa kho na yin no //
translated: The possession of factors of those in training is of those in training.

original: mi slob pa rnams kyi ni mi slob pa kho na yin no //🔽slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams kyi ni bye brag yod pas de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyi ni mi slob pa kho na yin no // slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams kyi ni bye brag yod pas de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The possession of factors of those beyond training is of those beyond training.🔽The possession of factors of those neither in training nor beyond training is of three types.

original: slob dang mi slob min gyi gsum //
analyzed: slob dang mi slob min gyi gsum //
translated: The possession of factors of those neither in training nor beyond training is of three types.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos zhas bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos zhas bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The factors of those neither in training nor beyond training are the impure factors and the unconditioned factors.

original: de dag gi thob pa ni slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa ni slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Their obtainment is threefold by the specific categories of learner and so on.

original: re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pas thob pa so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pas thob pa so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin no //
translated: First, the obtainment of contaminated states, nonanalytical cessation and analytical cessation obtained by non āryas is neither learner nor nonlearner.

original: de nyid slob pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid slob pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni slob pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of those obtained by the learner path is learner.

original: mi slob pa'i lam gyi sa thob pa'i ni mi slob pa'o //🔽mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du mthong bas dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gyi sa thob pa'i ni mi slob pa'o // mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du mthong bas dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: The obtainment of those obtained by the nonlearner path is nonlearner.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams kyi ni bye brag yod pas de bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams kyi ni bye brag yod pas de bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: The obtainment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, respectively.

original: sang bya min pa'i rnam gnyis 'dod //
analyzed: sang bya min pa'i rnam gnyis 'dod //
translated: The obtainment of objects not to be abandoned has two types.🔽It is asserted that objects not to be abandoned are of two types.

original: spang bar bya ba @72b ma yin pa'i chos dag ni zag pa med pa rnams te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba @72b ma yin pa'i chos dag ni zag pa med pa rnams te /
translated: Unrejectable phenomena are uncontaminated phenomena.

original: de dag las so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pas thob pa so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pas thob pa so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Obtainment of nonanalytical cessation and analytical cessation obtained by non-Aryas is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i dang / lam gyi bden pa ni zag pa med pa ste spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i dang / lam gyi bden pa ni zag pa med pa ste spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Obtainment of that very analytical cessation obtained by the ārya path and the truth of path are uncontaminated and not to be abandoned.

original: dus gsum pa'i rnam pa gsum zhes spyir bstan pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs kyis bstan pa ni 'di yin te /🔽lung bstan min thob lhan cig skye //
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i rnam pa gsum zhes spyir bstan pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs kyis bstan pa ni 'di yin te / lung bstan min thob lhan cig skye //
translated: The general statement is that those of the three times have three types.🔽Obtainment of unobscured neutral states arises simultaneously.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni stobs chung ba'i phyir lhan cig skye ba kho na ste /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni stobs chung ba'i phyir lhan cig skye ba kho na ste /
translated: Because the obtainment of unobscured neutral states is weak, it arises simultaneously with them.

original: sngar skye ba yang med la dus phyis skye ba yang med do //
analyzed: sngar skye ba yang med la dus phyis skye ba yang med do //
translated: It does not arise prior to them and it does not arise later.

original: des na de dag gi ni 'das pa rnams kyi yang 'das pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: des na de dag gi ni 'das pa rnams kyi yang 'das pa kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore the obtainment of those that are past is only past.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams kyi bar du yang da ltar byung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams kyi bar du yang da ltar byung ba kho na yin no //
translated: The present is only present.

original: ci ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa thams cad kyi de dang 'dra'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa thams cad kyi de dang 'dra'am zhe na /
translated: Is the possession of all unobscurednondefined factors like that?

original: mngon shes sprul pa ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: mngon shes sprul pa ma gtogs pa //
translated: Except for the superknowledges and the fictive creation.

original: thams cad kyi de dang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi de dang mi 'dra ste /
translated: The possession of all other unobscurednondefined factors is not like that.

original: mngon par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa gnyis dang / sprul pa'i sems ma gtogs pa'o //🔽de dag ni sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig tu skye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa gnyis dang / sprul pa'i sems ma gtogs pa'o // de dag ni sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig tu skye ba yang yod do //
translated: Except for the two unobscurednondefined superknowledges and the fictive creation.🔽These two superknowledges and the fictive creation arise, respectively, through the power of meditation and the power of thought.🔽The possession of these three types of factors arises simultaneously with them.

original: bzo'i gnas pa kha cig dang / spyod lam pa shin tu goms pa yang 'dod do //🔽ci ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'i thob pa la lhan cig skye ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas pa kha cig dang / spyod lam pa shin tu goms pa yang 'dod do // ci ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'i thob pa la lhan cig skye ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: The possession of certain factors related to skill in arts and crafts and certain factors related to deportment arises before and after these factors.🔽Is the possession of unobscurednondefined factors only simultaneous with them?

original: smras pa / bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyi'ang /
analyzed: smras pa / bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyi'ang /
translated: Objection: The possession of obscurednondefined form also arises before and after it.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rig byed bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i thob pa yang lhan cig skye ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rig byed bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i thob pa yang lhan cig skye ba kho na ste /
translated: The obtainment of obscured neutral form is only concomitant.

original: chen pos kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi slob pas stobs chung bas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen pos kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi slob pas stobs chung bas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is weak, even though it is great, it does not generate nonindicative form.

original: ji ltar lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa'i bye brag 'di yin pa ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi thob pa la yang bye brag 'ga' zhig yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa'i bye brag 'di yin pa ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi thob pa la yang bye brag 'ga' zhig yod dam zhe na /
translated: Just as there are different types of obtainment of neutral phenomena, are there any differences in the obtainment of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena?

original: smras pa / yod de ;🔽'dod pa na /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de ; 'dod pa na /
translated: Objection: There are.

original: gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba med /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba med /
translated: In the desire realm, form does not arise prior.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad du sngar skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad du sngar skye ba med do //
translated: The obtainment of desire realm form never arises prior to the obtainment of form.

original: lhan cig skye ba dang / dus phyis skye ba ni yod do //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba dang / dus phyis skye ba ni yod do //
translated: It does arise simultaneously and later.

original: ci ma thob pa yang thob pa bzhin du rnam pa'i bye brag yod dam /
analyzed: ci ma thob pa yang thob pa bzhin du rnam pa'i bye brag yod dam /
translated: Objection: Is nonobtainment like obtainment in that it has different types?

original: smras pa med do /
analyzed: smras pa med do /
translated: Objection: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ci lta bu zhe na @73a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci lta bu zhe na @73a * //
translated: What is it like?

original: ma thob ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //
analyzed: ma thob ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //
translated: Non-possession is unobscured-non-defined.

original: ma thob pa thams cad ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa thams cad ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: All non-possession is unobscured-non-defined.

original: dus kyi bye brag gis ni /
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag gis ni /
translated: It is classified according to time.

original: 'das ma skyes kyi de rnam gsum //
analyzed: 'das ma skyes kyi de rnam gsum //
translated: Past and future non-possession is threefold.

original: da ltar byung ba'i ma thob pa da ltar byung ba ni med do //🔽'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi ni dus gsum pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i ma thob pa da ltar byung ba ni med do // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi ni dus gsum pa ma yin no //
translated: Present non-possession does not exist.🔽Past and future non-possession is not of the present.🔽It is also classified according to realm.

original: 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang //
analyzed: 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang //
translated: The three realms, uncontaminated.

original: rnam gsum zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam gsum zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The three realms should be applied to the phrase “it is also classified according to realm.”

original: 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin la /
translated: The non-possession of those belonging to the desire realm is of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams dang / ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams dang / ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The non-possession of those belonging to the form realm and the formless realm is also like that.

original: ma thob pa zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med de /🔽'di ltar / lam ma thob pa so so yi //
analyzed: ma thob pa zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med de / 'di ltar / lam ma thob pa so so yi //
translated: There is no uncontaminated non-possession at all.🔽Thus:

original: skye bor 'dod do //
analyzed: skye bor 'dod do //
translated: The non-acquisition of the path is asserted to be the nature of an ordinary being.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of an ordinary being?

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa'o zhes 'don te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa'o zhes 'don te /
translated: The reading of the sutra is “the non-acquisition of the arya dharmas.”

original: gal te ma rnyed pa zhes bya ba ma thob pa yin pas so so'i skye bo nyid ni zag pa med pa yin par mi 'os so //
analyzed: gal te ma rnyed pa zhes bya ba ma thob pa yin pas so so'i skye bo nyid ni zag pa med pa yin par mi 'os so //
translated: If non-acquisition is non-acquisition of what has not been obtained, then the state of an ordinary being would not be suitable as uncontaminated.

original: 'phags pa'i chos gang dag gi ma rnyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos gang dag gi ma rnyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to which arya dharmas is there non-acquisition?

original: thams cad kyi yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi yin te /
translated: There is non-acquisition of all of them,

original: khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they occur without distinction.

original: de ni rnyed pa med par ma rnyed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa med par ma rnyed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That is to say, non-acquisition is that which is not acquired without acquisition.

original: da lta ma yin na sangs rgyas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da lta ma yin na sangs rgyas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then even a buddha would not possess the lineages of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas and he would not be an arya.

original: 'o na ni kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don dgos so //
translated: In that case, the word “only” must be supplied.

original: gdon mi dgos te /
analyzed: gdon mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to supply it,

original: tshig gcig pu dag kyang nges par 'dzin pa yin te /🔽dper na chu 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig pu dag kyang nges par 'dzin pa yin te / dper na chu 'thung ba'o //
translated: because single words can also have a definitive meaning.

original: rlung za ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung za ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, “drinking water” and “eating wind” are definitive.

original: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, it is the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and the factors that coexist with it.

original: de dag btang bas 'phags pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag btang bas 'phags pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But, if one loses these two receptivities, one does not become a worldling again.

original: de dag gi ma rnyed pa gtan du bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ma rnyed pa gtan du bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the nonacquisition of these two receptivities is definitely destroyed.

original: 'o na ni de dag kyang rigs gsum pa yin na gang dag gi ma rnyed pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag kyang rigs gsum pa yin na gang dag gi ma rnyed pa yin /
translated: But if the worldling is endowed with the nonacquisition of the three receptivities, why is he not called a noble one?

original: thams cad kyi yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the nonacquisition of all the receptivities.

original: 'o na ni nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the objection is still valid.

original: lan yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: lan yang de nyid yin no //
translated: The answer is still the same.

original: 'o na ni 'bad pa don med par 'gyur bas mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de lta bu ni legs pa yin no //🔽mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta bu yin /🔽'phags pa'i chos @73b rnams ma skyes pa'i rgyud ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //🔽yang ma thob pa 'di ji ltar rnam par nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'bad pa don med par 'gyur bas mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de lta bu ni legs pa yin no //🔽mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta bu yin /🔽'phags pa'i chos @73b rnams ma skyes pa'i rgyud ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //🔽yang ma thob pa 'di ji ltar rnam par nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But then the effort of the noble ones is useless. The Sautrāntikas say that the explanation of the Vaibhāṣikas is the best.

original: chos gang gi ma thob pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos gang gi ma thob pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The non-acquisition of any dharma

original: de thob dang / sa 'phos nas ni rnam nyams 'gyur //🔽re zhig 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de thob dang / sa 'phos nas ni rnam nyams 'gyur // re zhig 'di lta ste /
translated: is acquired when it is acquired, and is lost through changing the stage.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi ma rnyed pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi ma rnyed pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid de /
translated: For example, the non-acquisition of the noble path is the state of ordinary being.

original: de ni de rnyed pa dang sa 'phos pa las rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de rnyed pa dang sa 'phos pa las rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: It is lost through acquiring the noble path and through changing the stage.

original: gzhan dag gi yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: rnam par nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa de ma thob pa skye zhing thob pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa de ma thob pa skye zhing thob pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-acquisition of the non-acquisition is lost when the acquisition of the non-acquisition is acquired.

original: ci ma thob pa dang thob pa dag gi yang thob pa dang / ma thob pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci ma thob pa dang thob pa dag gi yang thob pa dang / ma thob pa yod dam /
translated: Do the acquisition and non-acquisition of acquisition and non-acquisition exist?

original: smras pa / gnyi ga'i yang gnyi ga yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi ga'i yang gnyi ga yod do //
translated: Both exist for both.

original: de lta na thob pa rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na thob pa rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, would it not follow that there is an infinite regress of acquisition?

original: phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no infinite regress because they possess each other.

original: chos bdag nyid gtogs pa gsum skye ste /
analyzed: chos bdag nyid gtogs pa gsum skye ste /
translated: When a dharma arises, three things occur together: the dharma itself, its acquisition, and the acquisition of that acquisition.

original: chos de dang / de'i thob pa dang / thob pa'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dang / de'i thob pa dang / thob pa'i thob pa'o //
translated: the phenomenon itself, the obtainment of that phenomenon, and the obtainment of the obtainment of that phenomenon.

original: de la thob pa skyes pas chos de dang / thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la thob pa skyes pas chos de dang / thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: When the obtainment of a phenomenon arises, one possesses the phenomenon itself and the obtainment of that phenomenon.🔽When the obtainment of the obtainment of a phenomenon arises, one possesses only the obtainment of that phenomenon.

original: thob pa'i thob pa skyes pas thob pa kho na dang ldan par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa'i thob pa skyes pas thob pa kho na dang ldan par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no infinite regress.

original: de ltar byas na skad cig ma gnyis pa la dge ba'ang rung nyon mongs pa can yang rung chos bdag gnyid gtogs par gsum gyi thob pa gsum skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na skad cig ma gnyis pa la dge ba'ang rung nyon mongs pa can yang rung chos bdag gnyid gtogs par gsum gyi thob pa gsum skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: When this is applied to virtuous or afflicted phenomena, three obtainments arise in the second moment.

original: de dag gi rjes kyi thob pa yang gsum yin pas drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes kyi thob pa yang gsum yin pas drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there are three obtainments of obtainments, there are six.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la ni skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa la skyes pa'i rdzas rnams kyi thob pa dgu po rjes kyi thob pa dang bcas pas bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la ni skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa la skyes pa'i rdzas rnams kyi thob pa dgu po rjes kyi thob pa dang bcas pas bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the third moment, there are eighteen because there are nine substances that arise in the first and second moments and their obtainments and obtainments of obtainments.

original: de ltar thob pa rnams gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres kyis bskyed na srog chags gcig la yang skad cig skad cig la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i skad cig ma mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar bcas pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor bar gtogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' yas pa dag skye bar 'gyur bas sems can rnams kyi so so'i rgyud kyi lus
analyzed: de ltar thob pa rnams gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres kyis bskyed na srog chags gcig la yang skad cig skad cig la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i skad cig ma mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar bcas pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor bar gtogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' yas pa dag skye bar 'gyur bas sems can rnams kyi so so'i rgyud kyi lus
translated: If one extends this process of obtaining the afflictions and so on in the same way, then in each moment of time, one would obtain all the afflictions and secondary afflictions of the past and future, and all the virtuous and nonvirtuous moments of the same type and coexistent with them, without exception, that exist in the beginningless and endless cycle of existence.

original: kyi skad cig ma la rdzas mtha' yas pa can dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kyi skad cig ma la rdzas mtha' yas pa can dag 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, in the continuum of each sentient being, there would be an infinite number of substances in each moment of the body.

original: kye ma 'di ni thob pa rnams kyi dga' ston chen po @74a * //
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni thob pa rnams kyi dga' ston chen po @74a * //
translated: Oh my! This is a great festival of obtaining.

original: zhig ste ; de thogs pa med pas 'di ltar go skabs rnyed kyi /
analyzed: zhig ste ; de thogs pa med pas 'di ltar go skabs rnyed kyi /
translated: Since it is unobstructed, it finds an opportunity in this way.

original: de lta ma yin na srog chags gnyis pa'i ni nam mkha' la go skabs yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na srog chags gnyis pa'i ni nam mkha' la go skabs yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then there would be no opportunity for a second sentient being in the sky.

original: yang skal ba mnyam pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /🔽skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang skal ba mnyam pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na / skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
translated: What is this homogeneous character?🔽Homogeneous character is the similarity of sentient beings.

original: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdzas ni sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdzas ni sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The substance called “homogeneous character” is the similarity of sentient beings.

original: bstan bcos las ni 'di'i ming ris mthun pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni 'di'i ming ris mthun pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the treatises, it is called “the same type.”

original: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa ste /
translated: It is both nondifferent and different.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Nondifferent means

original: sems can thams cad sems can du skal ba mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sems can du skal ba mnyam pa ste /
translated: all sentient beings are homogeneous as sentient beings,

original: thams cad la yang sems can re re yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang sems can re re yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each sentient being possesses the nature of a sentient being.

original: tha dad pa ni sems can de dag nyid khams dang sa dang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs dang / pho dang / mo dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge slong dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni sems can de dag nyid khams dang sa dang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs dang / pho dang / mo dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge slong dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so sor nges pa'o //
translated: Different means those sentient beings are differentiated by the specific distinctions of realm, stage, destiny, birth, caste, male, female, layperson, monastic, trained, untrained, and so on.

original: chos kyi skal ba mnyam pa ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: chos kyi skal ba mnyam pa ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Homogeneity of the dharmas is by way of the aggregates, sense spheres, and elements.

original: gal te skal pa mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas khyad par med pa zhig med na phan tshun khyad par tha dad pa'i sems can rnams la bye brag med par sems can zhes bya ba'i blo 'jug pa dang / 'dogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skal pa mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas khyad par med pa zhig med na phan tshun khyad par tha dad pa'i sems can rnams la bye brag med par sems can zhes bya ba'i blo 'jug pa dang / 'dogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no undifferentiated substance called homogeneity, then the cognition and designation of sentient beings would not occur without distinction among sentient beings who are mutually differentiated.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i blo dang 'dogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i blo dang 'dogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: The cognition and designation of the aggregates and so on should be applied in the same way.

original: 'chi 'pho bar yang 'gyur zhing skye bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho bar yang 'gyur zhing skye bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: Is there death and rebirth

original: sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor par yang mi 'gyur thob par yang mi 'gyur pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor par yang mi 'gyur thob par yang mi 'gyur pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: but no relinquishment or acquisition of the homogeneity of sentient beings?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni gang nas 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni gang nas 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye ba na'o //
translated: The first possibility is when one dies and is reborn in the same place.

original: gnyis pa ni nges pa la 'jug pa na ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nges pa la 'jug pa na ste /
translated: The second is when one enters the state of certainty.

original: de ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor zhing /
analyzed: de ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor zhing /
translated: At that time, one relinquishes the homogeneity of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob bo //
translated: they acquire the status of noble ones.

original: gsum pa ni 'gro ba 'pho ba las so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'gro ba 'pho ba las so //
translated: The third is the status of those who are in the process of passing from one destiny to another.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the status of those who are not included in the above three categories.

original: gal te so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdzas shig yod na go so so'i skye bo nyid kyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdzas shig yod na go so so'i skye bo nyid kyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If there were a real entity called the status of ordinary worldlings, what would be the point of positing the quality of being an ordinary worldling?

original: mi'i skal pa mnyam pa las ni mi nyid gud na brtag tu med do //
analyzed: mi'i skal pa mnyam pa las ni mi nyid gud na brtag tu med do //
translated: The status of human being is not conceived apart from the status of human being.

original: 'jig rten gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthong ba nyid la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthong ba nyid la /
translated: The world does not see the status of ordinary worldling because it is not a visible.

original: 'di shes rab kyis kyang yongs su mi chod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di shes rab kyis kyang yongs su mi chod mod kyi /
translated: It is not even known by means of the other cognitions.

original: @74b sems can rnams kyi rigs tha mi dad pa yang khong du chud do //
analyzed: @74b sems can rnams kyi rigs tha mi dad pa yang khong du chud do //
translated: Nevertheless, one can infer the existence of a difference in the species of sentient beings.

original: de yod du chug na yang de las ji lta bu zhig byed /
analyzed: de yod du chug na yang de las ji lta bu zhig byed /
translated: Even if it existed, what would it do?

original: gzhan yang sems can ma yin pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod de //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can ma yin pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod de //
translated: Why not accept that there is a status of ordinary worldling that is not a sentient being?

original: s'a lu dang / nas dang / mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang / aa mra dang / shing pa nas dang / lcags dang / gser la sogs pa rnams rang gi rigs 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
