analyzed: s'a lu dang / nas dang / mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang / aa mra dang / shing pa nas dang / lcags dang / gser la sogs pa rnams rang gi rigs 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: rice, barley, beans, peas, mangoes, breadfruit, iron, gold, etc.

original: skal pa mnyam pa phan tshun tha dad pa de dag kyang ji ltar bye brag med par skal ba mnyam pa nyid du 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa phan tshun tha dad pa de dag kyang ji ltar bye brag med par skal ba mnyam pa nyid du 'dogs par byed /
translated: But how can they be designated as homogeneous when they are mutually distinct?

original: de lta na ni bye brag pa rnams kyis gsal pa byas pa yin te ;
analyzed: de lta na ni bye brag pa rnams kyis gsal pa byas pa yin te ;
translated: In that case, the Vaiśeṣikas have done a good job of explaining it,

original: de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni spyi zhes bya ba'i dngos po zhig yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni spyi zhes bya ba'i dngos po zhig yod de /
translated: for their doctrine is that there is a real entity called a universal,

original: des na rnam pa mi 'dra ba rnams la yang shes pa mtshungs pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa mi 'dra ba rnams la yang shes pa mtshungs pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: and it is on account of that that a cognition of similarity arises with regard to things that are dissimilar.

original: de dag gcig yin yang du ma la 'jug pa 'di ni de dag gi khyad par yin no //🔽bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gal te gsal bar byas kyang rung /
analyzed: de dag gcig yin yang du ma la 'jug pa 'di ni de dag gi khyad par yin no // bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gal te gsal bar byas kyang rung /
translated: The difference between them is that the universal is said to be one, but to occur in many.

original: gal te gsal bar ma byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te gsal bar ma byas kyang rung ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that it is irrelevant whether or not the universal is manifested.

original: mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Homogeneity exists because it is mentioned in the sutras.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa 'di lta bu nyid du 'ong na zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa 'di lta bu nyid du 'ong na zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Bhagavan also says, “If you come to be a human, you will be of the same status as humans.”

original: de skad gsungs mod kyi rdzas gzhan no zhes ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad gsungs mod kyi rdzas gzhan no zhes ni ma gsungs so //
translated: Although he said that, he did not say that it is a different substance.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gang dag la mi la sogs par 'dogs pa'i 'du byed de lta bur gyur pa de dag kho nar zad de /
analyzed: gang dag la mi la sogs par 'dogs pa'i 'du byed de lta bur gyur pa de dag kho nar zad de /
translated: It is merely the formations that are designated as humans and so on.

original: s'a lu la sogs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: s'a lu la sogs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the homogeneity of rice and so on.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
translated: But that is not what is being said here.

original: yang 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this state called nondiscernment?

original: 'du shes med pa pa 'du shes //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa 'du shes //
translated: Nondiscernment is the absence of discernment.🔽The mind and mental factors

original: med par sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: med par sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: cease in nondiscernment.

original: 'gog pa'o // 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba dag gi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'o // 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba dag gi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas yin te /
translated: The substance called “non-perceptive sentient beings” is the cessation of mind and mental factors of those born among the gods devoid of ideation.

original: gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dus gzhan gyi bar du klung gi chu 'gog pa bzhin du 'gog cing skyer mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dus gzhan gyi bar du klung gi chu 'gog pa bzhin du 'gog cing skyer mi ster ba'o //
translated: It is a substance that causes the mind and mental factors of the future to cease for a period of time, like a dam that blocks the flow of a river.

original: de yang gcig tu rnam par smin //
analyzed: de yang gcig tu rnam par smin //
translated: It is the result of a single cause.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is its result?

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i yin no //🔽gang dag na 'du shes @75a * //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i yin no // gang dag na 'du shes @75a * //
translated: It is the result of the meditative attainment of non-perceptive beings.🔽What sentient beings are devoid of ideation?

original: med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod pa'i sems can de dag gang zhe na /🔽de 'bras che'ang /
analyzed: med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod pa'i sems can de dag gang zhe na / de 'bras che'ang /
translated: They are the sentient beings who reside in the plane of non-perceptive sentient beings.

original: gang dag gi phyogs gcig na sems can 'du shes med pa kha cig 'khod pa'i lha de dag ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gi phyogs gcig na sems can 'du shes med pa kha cig 'khod pa'i lha de dag ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: They are the gods of the plane of non-perceptive sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can bzhin no //
translated: It is like the special meditative attainment of the fourth absorption.

original: ci de dag nam yang 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dag nam yang 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do they never have discernment?

original: skye ba'i dus dang 'chi 'phos pa'i dus na 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus dang 'chi 'phos pa'i dus na 'gyur te /
translated: They have discernment when they are born and when they die and transmigrate.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / sems can de dag dus ring mo zhig tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: mdo las / sems can de dag dus ring mo zhig tu 'dug ste /
translated: Those sentient beings live for a very long time.

original: 'du shes skyes nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes skyes nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: When discernment arises, they die and transmigrate from that realm.🔽They die and transmigrate from that realm and are born in the desire realm, like one waking from a long sleep.

original: de dag kyang yun ring por gnyid kyis log pa las sangs pa bzhin du de nas shi 'phos nas sngon gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du byed yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang / sngon med pa ma bsags pa'i phyir mda' 'phangs pa shugs zad pa dag sa la ltung ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang yun ring por gnyid kyis log pa las sangs pa bzhin du de nas shi 'phos nas sngon gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du byed yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang / sngon med pa ma bsags pa'i phyir mda' 'phangs pa shugs zad pa dag sa la ltung ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are born in the desire realm because the prior compositional activity of meditative attainment is exhausted and because they do not accumulate the prior nonexistence of meditative attainment.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not born in other realms.

original: gang zhig der skye bar 'gyur ba de la ni gdon mi za bar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod de /
analyzed: gang zhig der skye bar 'gyur ba de la ni gdon mi za bar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod de /
translated: Those who are born there definitely possess karma to be experienced in a third life in the desire realm.

original: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi lhar skye ba myong bar 'gyur ba bzhin no /
analyzed: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi lhar skye ba myong bar 'gyur ba bzhin no /
translated: For example, it is like the karma of gods to be experienced by beings of Kuru in the north.🔽Again, it is said:

original: yang / snyoms 'jug dag ces gang bshad pa //
analyzed: yang / snyoms 'jug dag ces gang bshad pa //
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment🔽and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are these meditative attainments?

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment?

original: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa la 'du shes med pa par bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa la 'du shes med pa par bshad pa /
translated: Just as the state of nondiscernment is explained as the cessation of mind and mental factors,

original: de bzhin 'du shes med snyoms 'jug /'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am 'du shes med pa can yin pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin 'du shes med snyoms 'jug /'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am 'du shes med pa can yin pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: so too it is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment because it is the meditative attainment of those who are nondiscernment or it possesses nondiscernment.

original: de yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'gog pa yin no //
translated: It is the cessation of thought and thought concomitants.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de tsam zhig mthun par 'don to ;
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de tsam zhig mthun par 'don to ;
translated: The word “also” indicates that the other characteristics are similar to those of the attainment of non-perception.

original: / snyoms par 'jug pa de ni bsam gtan tha mar /
analyzed: / snyoms par 'jug pa de ni bsam gtan tha mar /
translated: This attainment is in the final meditative development.

original: bsam gtan tha ma ni bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan tha ma ni bzhi pa ste /
translated: The final meditative development is the fourth meditative concentration.

original: de ni der gtogs pa yin gyis gzhan pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de ni der gtogs pa yin gyis gzhan pa ni ma yin no /
translated: This attainment is included in that meditative concentration, but not in the others.

original: ci'i phyir 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce na /🔽'byung 'dod pas /🔽'di la nges par 'byung bar sems te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce na / 'byung 'dod pas / 'di la nges par 'byung bar sems te /
translated: Why is this attainment called “final”?🔽Because it is desired for the purpose of deliverance.

original: de'i phyir thar par 'dod @75b pas snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir thar par 'dod @75b pas snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: It is considered to be deliverance, and therefore it is entered by those who desire liberation.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The attainment of non-perception is indeterminate because it is the karmic maturation of the meditative development of the formless realm.

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o //
translated: This attainment is wholesome.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge ba kho na yin no //
translated: The attainment of non-perception is wholesome.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du phung po lnga 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du phung po lnga 'grub pa'o //
translated: Its karmic maturation is the establishment of the five aggregates in the realm of the non-percipient beings.

original: de dge ba yin yang /
analyzed: de dge ba yin yang /
translated: Though it is virtuous,

original: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid /
analyzed: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid /
translated: it is definitely experienced after rebirth.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi mthong ba'i chos dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la ma nges pa yang ma yin no //🔽gang zhig gis 'di bskyed nas yongs su nyams pa de yang gdon mi za bar yang bskyed nas 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi mthong ba'i chos dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la ma nges pa yang ma yin no // gang zhig gis 'di bskyed nas yongs su nyams pa de yang gdon mi za bar yang bskyed nas 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is definitely experienced after rebirth alone, but it is not experienced in the current life or in a third life, nor is it not definite.

original: zhes grag go //
analyzed: zhes grag go //
translated: It is said that🔽one who generates this but then regresses will definitely generate it again and be born among beings devoid of discernment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de thob pa ni nges pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de thob pa ni nges pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore one who obtains it does not enter the state of definite separation.

original: de yang so so'i skye bo kho na'i yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de yang so so'i skye bo kho na'i yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: It is asserted that this is the meditative attainment of beings of the desire and form realms alone.

original: 'phags pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ma yin /
translated: It is not that of āryas.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di la rnam par ltung ba'i gnas lta bur gzigs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par mi 'jug gi nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes can dag ni de la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di la rnam par ltung ba'i gnas lta bur gzigs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par mi 'jug gi nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes can dag ni de la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Aryas do not enter the meditative attainment of nondiscernment because they view it as a state of downfall. Those who possess the discernment of definite emergence enter it.

original: yang ci 'phags pa bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas bsam gtan bzhin du 'di 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang 'thob bam zhe na /🔽re zhig gzhan dag gis kyang mi 'thob po ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci 'phags pa bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas bsam gtan bzhin du 'di 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang 'thob bam zhe na / re zhig gzhan dag gis kyang mi 'thob po ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Do noble ones who obtain the fourth absorption also obtain past and future absorptions, as they do for the absorptions?

original: 'di ni 'dris pa yin yang mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dus gcig 'thob dus gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dris pa yin yang mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dus gcig 'thob dus gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: They do not obtain them, because they are not familiar with them, because they are established through great effort, and because they are mindless states.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin du da ltar gyi dus pa kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin du da ltar gyi dus pa kho na 'thob po //
translated: They obtain them in one time, which is to say, in the present, just as they do for pratimokṣa vows.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par ni ji srid mi gtong bde srid du thob pa 'das pa dang yang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par ni ji srid mi gtong bde srid du thob pa 'das pa dang yang ldan pa yin no //
translated: In the second moment and so on, they possess past and future states for as long as they do not relinquish them.

original: sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ni mi 'thob po //
analyzed: sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ni mi 'thob po //
translated: They do not obtain future states because they are mindless states.

original: da ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: da ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative attainment of cessation?

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ji lta bur /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ji lta bur /
translated: The attainment of non-perception is like the attainment of cessation.

original: 'gog pa zhes pa'ang de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes pa'ang de bzhin nyid //
translated: The attainment of cessation is like the attainment of non-perception.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras rnam pa gang zhig gzung zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras rnam pa gang zhig gzung zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word “like”?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba gzung ngo//
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba gzung ngo//
translated: The meaning is that the attainment of cessation is like the attainment of non-perception in five ways:

original: @76a * // 'di'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: @76a * // 'di'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The attainment of cessation is distinguished from the attainment of non-perception in one way:

original: 'di gnas don du /
analyzed: 'di gnas don du /
translated: it is entered for the sake of abiding in peace.

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas 'di la snyoms par 'jug gi / de la ni nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas so //🔽yang de ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin gyi 'di ni ;🔽srid rtse skyes /
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas 'di la snyoms par 'jug gi / de la ni nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas so // yang de ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin gyi 'di ni ; srid rtse skyes /
translated: One enters the attainment of non-perception by means of attention that is preceded by the perception of peace, but one enters the attainment of cessation by means of attention that is preceded by the perception of definite emergence.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi sa pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi sa pa kho na yin no //
translated: The attainment of non-perception belongs to the fourth meditative absorption, but the attainment of cessation belongs to the summit of existence.

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //🔽dge ba kho na yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o // dge ba kho na yin te / nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
translated: It is wholesome.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is wholesome, not defiled, and not neutral.

original: dge ba yin yang /
analyzed: dge ba yin yang /
translated: It is wholesome.

original: gnyis su myong 'gyur dang ma nges //
analyzed: gnyis su myong 'gyur dang ma nges //
translated: It is experienced in two ways, or it is not determined.

original: skye nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skye nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is experienced after rebirth, or it is experienced in a third life, or it is experienced in some subsequent life.

original: dus gnyis su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dus gnyis su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin te /
translated: Or it is experienced in two ways, or it is not determined with regard to the time of its retribution.

original: gal te 'dir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed na nam yang rnam par mi smin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed na nam yang rnam par mi smin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one attains nirvana here, it will never be retributed.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po bzhi yin no //
translated: Its retribution is the four aggregates of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: de yang gcig tu 'phags pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang gcig tu 'phags pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, ordinary beings are not able to generate the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: chad pas 'jigs pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: chad pas 'jigs pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because they fear annihilation and because it is generated by the power of the ārya path.

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa ni de la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa ni de la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana in this life is due to aspiration for it.

original: 'phags pa'i yang 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yang 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not to be obtained by one who is free from attachment.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽sbyor bas 'thob /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / sbyor bas 'thob /
translated: If that is so, then how is it obtained?🔽It is obtained by practice.

original: 'di ni sbyor bas 'thob par bya ba kho na yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor bas 'thob par bya ba kho na yin pas /
translated: It is obtained only by practice.

original: 'das pa yang mi 'thob la ma 'ongs pa yang mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'das pa yang mi 'thob la ma 'ongs pa yang mi 'thob ste /
translated: It is not obtained in the past or future,

original: de ni sems kyi stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obtained by the power of the mind.

original: ci bcom ldan 'das kyi yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das kyi yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it also obtained by practice by the Bhagavat?

original: smras pa ; ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ; ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it obtained?

original: thub pa'i byang chub kyis thob bya //
analyzed: thub pa'i byang chub kyis thob bya //
translated: The Sage obtains it through enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni 'di zad pa mkhyen pa dang dus mnyam du brnyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni 'di zad pa mkhyen pa dang dus mnyam du brnyes so //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha obtains it at the same time as the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: The Buddhas have nothing that is called obtained by practice.

original: de dag gi yon tan 'byor ba mngon sum du 'gyur ba thams cad ni bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa yin pas de lta bas na de dag gi thams cad ni /🔽'dod chags dang bral bas brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan 'byor ba mngon sum du 'gyur ba thams cad ni bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa yin pas de lta bas na de dag gi thams cad ni / 'dod chags dang bral bas brnyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of them are attained through freedom from attachment.

original: da ni yang bcom ldan 'das @76b kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma bskyed na zad pa mkhyen pa'i dus su gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol bar ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: da ni yang bcom ldan 'das @76b kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma bskyed na zad pa mkhyen pa'i dus su gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol bar ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: Now, if the Lord did not generate the meditative attainment of cessation, how could he be one liberated from both aspects at the time of his knowledge of elimination?

original: 'grub ste / bskyed zin pa bzhin du de la mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub ste / bskyed zin pa bzhin du de la mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He could, because he has mastery over it, just as he does over the meditative attainment that has already been generated.

original: nub phyogs pa dag na re de ni dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nub phyogs pa dag na re de ni dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhasikas of the west say that he generates it at the time of training as a bodhisattva.

original: yang 'di ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang 'di ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is this not accepted?

original: de ltar na gnas brtan nye bsrungs kyi lugs kyi tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas zad pa mkhyen pa skyed par mdzad do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan nye bsrungs kyi lugs kyi tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas zad pa mkhyen pa skyed par mdzad do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata generates the cognition of exhaustion after generating the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ba 'di tshad mar byas pa yin no //🔽dang por ma yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ba 'di tshad mar byas pa yin no // dang por ma yin /
translated: This is the opinion of the Vaibhasikas of Kasmir.

original: kha che ba rnams na re de ltar bskyed du mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re de ltar bskyed du mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that this is not correct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽skad cig ma /🔽sum cu rtsa bzhis 'thob phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / skad cig ma / sum cu rtsa bzhis 'thob phyir ro //
translated: Why?🔽Because the Buddha obtains enlightenment in thirty-four moments.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig ma sum cu rtsa bzhis byang chub rjes su 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig ma sum cu rtsa bzhis byang chub rjes su 'thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva obtains enlightenment in thirty-four moments of mind.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa na bcu drug dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba na nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spong bar byed pa na bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu dgu skye ba'i phyir bco brgyad de /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa na bcu drug dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba na nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spong bar byed pa na bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu dgu skye ba'i phyir bco brgyad de /
translated: When one is free from attachment to the summit of existence, there are eighteen, because nine uninterrupted paths and nine liberated paths arise when one abandons the nine aspects of affliction.

original: de dag ni sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are thirty four.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba de nges pa la 'jug pa'i phyir sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni yang spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba de nges pa la 'jug pa'i phyir sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni yang spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the base of nothingness enters the state of ascertainment and does not abandon the afflictions of lower levels.

original: de'i phyir bar skabs 'dir mi 'dra ba'i sems mi srid pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar skabs 'dir mi 'dra ba'i sems mi srid pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since dissimilar minds are impossible in this context, it is illogical that one enters meditative attainment of cessation.

original: zhes grag go //
analyzed: zhes grag go //
translated: This is well known.

original: gal te bar skabs su mi 'dra ba'i sems mngon du byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bar skabs su mi 'dra ba'i sems mngon du byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens if one manifests a dissimilar mind in the interim?

original: bsam ba ldang ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam ba ldang ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: One would rise from meditative attainment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam ba mi ldang ba can yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam ba mi ldang ba can yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas are not of the type to give up their intention.

original: nyi 'og pa rnams na re bsam pa mi ldang ba can yin ba bden mod kyi /
analyzed: nyi 'og pa rnams na re bsam pa mi ldang ba can yin ba bden mod kyi /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas of the West say that it is true that they do not give up their intention,

original: zag pa med pa'i lam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in regard to the pure path.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: zag pa zad pa ma thob kyi bar du re zhig skyil mo krung mi gzhig go snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di mi ldang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ma thob kyi bar du re zhig skyil mo krung mi gzhig go snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di mi ldang ba'i phyir te /
translated: As long as they have not obtained the destruction of the cankers, they do not give up the intention of not rising from their cross-legged posture.

original: stan gcig kho na la don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: stan gcig kho na la don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: For them, all the aims are realized in one sitting.

original: snga ma kho na yin no zhes ni brjod do //
analyzed: snga ma kho na yin no zhes ni brjod do //
translated: We say that the first opinion is correct.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis kyi rnam ba'i bye brag ma yin mod kyi /🔽gnyi ga 'dod dang gzugs @77a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis kyi rnam ba'i bye brag ma yin mod kyi / gnyi ga 'dod dang gzugs @77a * //
translated: Although these two attainments do not differ in their mode of acquisition,🔽Both are of the realm of desire and of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: rten can // 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skyed do //
analyzed: rten can // 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skyed do //
translated: The attainment of non-perception and the attainment of cessation are produced in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gang dag 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gzugs kyi khams su mi 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na chos mngon pa'i gzhung gzugs kyi srid pa yin la /
analyzed: gang dag 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gzugs kyi khams su mi 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na chos mngon pa'i gzhung gzugs kyi srid pa yin la /
translated: Those who do not assert that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment exists in the form realm would contradict this Abhidharma treatise.

original: srid pa de rnams dang 'drid pa can snga ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa de rnams dang 'drid pa can snga ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do any existences exist that are both existences and existences of the form realm?🔽Yes, they do.🔽The Abhidharmakośa mentions:

original: yod de / gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lha 'du shes can sems mi 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / lha 'du shes med pa 'du shes med pa pa thob pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba 'di dang 'gal te /
analyzed: yod de / gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lha 'du shes can sems mi 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / lha 'du shes med pa 'du shes med pa pa thob pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba 'di dang 'gal te /
translated: The existence of beings who are gods of the form realm, who possess discernment, who abide with different minds, who enter meditative attainment of nondiscernment and meditative attainment of cessation and who obtain the state of nondiscernment that is a god of the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod pa dang gzugs la brten pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod pa dang gzugs la brten pa dag yin no //
translated: Therefore both existences exist in the desire and form realms.

original: de la yang khyad par ni 'di yod do //
analyzed: de la yang khyad par ni 'di yod do //
translated: But there is a difference between them.

original: 'gog pa dang por mi'i nang du ;
analyzed: 'gog pa dang por mi'i nang du ;
translated: Cessation first arises in humans.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dang po nyid du mi dag gi nang du skyed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dang po nyid du mi dag gi nang du skyed do //
translated: The attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation is first generated among humans.

original: phyis ni sngar yongs su nyams pa dag gis gzugs kyi khams su yang skyed do //
analyzed: phyis ni sngar yongs su nyams pa dag gis gzugs kyi khams su yang skyed do //
translated: Later, those who have previously regressed generate it in the form realm.

original: ci 'di las kyang yongs su nyams pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di las kyang yongs su nyams pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Can one also retrogress from this attainment?

original: smras pa yod do //
analyzed: smras pa yod do //
translated: Yes, one can.🔽Otherwise, the Udayana Sutra would not say:

original: de lta ma yin na 'char byed kyi mdo las tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /🔽ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'char byed kyi mdo las tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin / ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: Venerable Ones, there is a state in which a bhikṣu is perfect in morality, perfect in concentration, perfect in discernment, perfect in liberation, perfect in the knowledge and vision of liberation.🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the origin of suffering.”🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the cessation of suffering.”🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.”🔽He knows as it really is: “These are the defilements of the mind.”🔽He knows as it really is: “These are the members of enlightenment.”🔽He knows as it really is: “These are the members of the path.”🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the fruit of the srāvaka.”🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the fruit of the pratyekabuddha.”🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the supreme enlightenment.”🔽He knows as it really is: “This is the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.”

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin pa de ni yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin pa de ni yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is: “This is the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.”

original: de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa thob par yang mi byed cing 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang ma yin la lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa thob par yang mi byed cing 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang ma yin la lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te /
translated: They do not obtain the state of an arhat in this life, nor at the time of death, nor do they transcend the gods who consume material food after their body degenerates.

original: yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that they first obtain complete knowledge of the truths in this life, nor is it that they obtain it at the time of death, but rather that they transcend the gods who consume physical food and are born in a divine body created by mind.🔽They are born there and again and again they enter and arise from the meditative attainment that is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: de der skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang pa'i gnas de yang yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de der skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang pa'i gnas de yang yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: This contradicts the statement, “There is a state that is the meditative attainment of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.”

original: der yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yid las byung ba'i lus can gyi lha ni gzugs na @77b spyod pa yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: der yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yid las byung ba'i lus can gyi lha ni gzugs na @77b spyod pa yin par gsungs la /
translated: The Bhagavān said that gods who possess a body created by mind are gods who enjoy the form realm.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin na de ji ltar de thob pa yongs su ma nyams pa gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin na de ji ltar de thob pa yongs su ma nyams pa gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If this meditative attainment is of the summit of existence, how could one who has obtained it and not lost it be born in the form realm?

original: sde pa gzhan dag 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yang yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na 'di yongs su nyams pa med bzhin du yang 'grub pa 'dra mod kyi /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yang yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na 'di yongs su nyams pa med bzhin du yang 'grub pa 'dra mod kyi /
translated: According to other schools, the meditative attainment of cessation is also on the level of the fourth absorption.🔽For them, it is established that one who has not lost it is born in the form realm,

original: 'di bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yang yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yang yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: but it is not established that it is on the level of the fourth absorption.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because a sūtra declares:

original: mdo las mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There are nine serial absorptions.

original: gal te de nges pa yan na ji ltar thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nges pa yan na ji ltar thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: If it is definite that it is on the level of the fourth absorption, how can one enter meditative attainment by skipping levels?

original: 'di ni rtsom pa dang po pa las nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtsom pa dang po pa las nges pa yin te /
translated: This is definite for beginners.

original: dga' mgu'i dbang thob pa dag yin na ni rnam par rgal te yang snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: dga' mgu'i dbang thob pa dag yin na ni rnam par rgal te yang snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: But those who have obtained control over meditative attainment enter meditative attainment by skipping levels.

original: de ltar na snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ni sa las kyang khyad par yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ni sa las kyang khyad par yod de /
translated: Thus these two meditative attainments differ in terms of their level,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist on the level of the fourth absorption and the summit of existence.

original: sbyor ba las kyang nges par 'byung ba dang gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las kyang nges par 'byung ba dang gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They differ in terms of their preparation, because they are prepared for by the mental attention that precedes the discernment of definite release and nondiscernment.

original: rgyud las kyang so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i rgyud la skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud las kyang so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i rgyud la skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They differ in terms of their continuum, because they arise in the continuum of ordinary beings and āryas.

original: 'bras bu las kyang 'du shes med pa pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang 'du shes med pa pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They differ in terms of their result, because they are the result of nondiscernment and the summit of existence.

original: myong bar 'gyur ba las kyang myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur ba las kyang myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They differ in terms of their experience, because they are definitely experienced and experienced in both ways.

original: dang po skyed pa las kyang khams gnyis dang mi'i nang du skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po skyed pa las kyang khams gnyis dang mi'i nang du skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They differ in terms of their initial generation, because they are generated in two realms and in the desire realm.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yin na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yin na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these meditative attainments called meditative attainment of nondiscernment, meditative attainment of cessation, and so on, if they are by nature the cessation of mind and mental factors?

original: de dag dang mi mthun pas de dag la snyoms par 'jug par sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag dang mi mthun pas de dag la snyoms par 'jug par sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: They are so called because they are antidotes to the three types of discernment.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang shes mod kyi gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang shes mod kyi gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Although feeling and so on are also known, they are not mentioned because they are subordinate.

original: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las yang sems skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las yang sems skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how does mind arise again from mind that has long since ceased?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'das pa yang yod pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'das pa yang yod pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du 'dod de /
translated: Vaibhasikas assert that past states exist and thus they assert that past states are equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon gzhan dag na re ni re zhig gzugs @78a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon gzhan dag na re ni re zhig gzugs @78a * //
translated: Other past masters say: First, when form is generated in the formless realm, form that has long since ceased is generated.

original: med par skyes pa rnams kyi gzugs 'gags nas ring du lon na yang gzugs ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: med par skyes pa rnams kyi gzugs 'gags nas ring du lon na yang gzugs ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How is form generated when a long time has elapsed since the cessation of form?

original: de ni sems kho na las skye'i gzugs las ni ma yin /
analyzed: de ni sems kho na las skye'i gzugs las ni ma yin /
translated: It arises from mind alone, not from form.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di kho na las skye'i sems las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di kho na las skye'i sems las ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, mind arises from this body that possesses faculties, not from mind.

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: For example,

original: sems dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: the two, mind and the body that possesses faculties, are reciprocal seeds.

original: btsun pa dbyig bshes kyis ni yongs su dris pa las /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyig bshes kyis ni yongs su dris pa las /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says in the Paramarthaśāstra:

original: 'di ni gang gi ltar na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems med pa pa yin pa de la skyon du 'gyur gyi kho bo ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi ltar na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems med pa pa yin pa de la skyon du 'gyur gyi kho bo ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This fault applies to those who say that the meditative attainment of cessation is mindless, but I say that the meditative attainment of cessation possesses mind.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs na re de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs na re de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Bhadanta Ghoṣaka says: That is not correct.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa yod na gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa yod na gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
translated: The Bhagavān says: If consciousness exists, the three meet, and from the three meeting there is contact.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: From the condition of contact there is feeling, discrimination, and intention.

original: de'i phyir 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this state, neither ideation nor sensation is blocked.

original: 'on te tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes gsungs mod kyi dgra bcom pa la tshor ba yod bzhin du sred pa mi skye ba de bzhin du reg pa yod bzhin du tshor ba las sogs pa mi 'byung ngo zhe na /🔽khyad par du byas pa'i phyir de ni ma yin te /🔽ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skyes so zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'on te tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes gsungs mod kyi dgra bcom pa la tshor ba yod bzhin du sred pa mi skye ba de bzhin du reg pa yod bzhin du tshor ba las sogs pa mi 'byung ngo zhe na / khyad par du byas pa'i phyir de ni ma yin te / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skyes so zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: But even though the perfected being has sensation, craving does not arise in him. In the same way, even though contact exists, sensation, etc., do not arise.🔽This is not so, because the Sūtra specifies the cause: “Craving arises in dependence on sensation which is caused by contact which is caused by the six sense spheres.”

original: tshor ba skyes pa la reg pa ni bye brag tu ma byas pas 'di ni mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshor ba skyes pa la reg pa ni bye brag tu ma byas pas 'di ni mi 'dra'o //
translated: The Sūtra does not specify the cause of sensation: “Sensation arises in dependence on contact which is caused by the six sense spheres.”🔽Thus the two cases are not parallel.

original: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems med pa pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems med pa pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the attainment of cessation is without thought.

original: ji ltar na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be an attainment?

original: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it is the cause of the equality of the great elements, or

original: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis de la snyoms par 'jug cing 'thob par 'gyur bas na snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis de la snyoms par 'jug cing 'thob par 'gyur bas na snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: because the mind of meditative attainment attains and enters it, it is called meditative attainment.

original: yang ci snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag rdzas su yod dam 'on te btags par yod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag rdzas su yod dam 'on te btags par yod ce na /
translated: Are these meditative attainments substantially existent or are they imputedly existent?

original: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir rdzas su yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir rdzas su yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: They are substantially existent because they obstruct the arising of mind.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind of meditative attainment itself obstructs it.

original: snyoms @78b par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de dang 'gal ba'i rten skyed pa'i phyir gang gis na dus gzhan gyi bar du sems mi 'jug pa tsam du 'gyur ba de las gzhan pa'i sems dang 'gal bar skye ste /
analyzed: snyoms @78b par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de dang 'gal ba'i rten skyed pa'i phyir gang gis na dus gzhan gyi bar du sems mi 'jug pa tsam du 'gyur ba de las gzhan pa'i sems dang 'gal bar skye ste /
translated: The mind of meditative attainment itself arises in opposition to that mind which is other than it, because it generates a basis that is incompatible with it, by which the mere nonarising of mind occurs for a period of time.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags so //
translated: It is designated as meditative attainment.

original: mi 'jug pa tsam ste yang sngon ma byung ba dang phyis langs pa la med pa yin pas snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni 'dus byas su btags so //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa tsam ste yang sngon ma byung ba dang phyis langs pa la med pa yin pas snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni 'dus byas su btags so //
translated: It is simply the non-functioning of mind, and since it is not a non-functioning that existed previously or will exist later, this meditative attainment is designated as a conditioned thing.

original: yang na rten nyid de ltar mnyam par bsgrubs pas na snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rten nyid de ltar mnyam par bsgrubs pas na snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the support itself is thus placed in equipoise, and so it is called meditative attainment.

original: 'du shes med pa pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The attainment of the non-perceptual state should be understood in the same way.

original: 'dis des sems kho na sems 'jug pa dang 'gal ba thob ste /
analyzed: 'dis des sems kho na sems 'jug pa dang 'gal ba thob ste /
translated: By this, the mind itself obtains a state that is incompatible with the functioning of mind.

original: mi 'jug pa tsam de yang 'du shes med pa par gdags so //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa tsam de yang 'du shes med pa par gdags so //
translated: That mere non-functioning is designated as the attainment of the non-perceptual state.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
translated: But this is not stated.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dag bshad zin to //
translated: The meditative attainments have now been explained.

original: srog gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gang zhe na /
translated: What is life?

original: srog ni tshe yin /
analyzed: srog ni tshe yin /
translated: Life is the life faculty.

original: chos mngon pa las 'di skad du /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las 'di skad du /
translated: In the Abhidharma it is said:

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the life faculty?

original: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the life of the three realms.🔽But since it is not known what this life is,

original: tshe zhes bya ba'i chos de gang yin pa de yang mi shes pas /🔽drod dang ni /
analyzed: tshe zhes bya ba'i chos de gang yin pa de yang mi shes pas / drod dang ni /
translated: it is said:

original: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the support of heat and consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du //
translated: The Lord has said:

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes 'dis //🔽gang tshe lus ni 'dor byed cing //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes 'dis // gang tshe lus ni 'dor byed cing //
translated: Life, heat and consciousness🔽Abandon the body

original: bor nas de tshe 'dug pa ni ;
analyzed: bor nas de tshe 'dug pa ni ;
translated: When it is discarded, it remains

original: / sems med ji ltar shing bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: / sems med ji ltar shing bzhin no // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Without mind, like a piece of wood.

original: de lta bas na drod dang rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur ba'i chos gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni tshe yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na drod dang rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur ba'i chos gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni tshe yin no //
translated: Therefore, life is that which is the cause of the persistence of the factor that is the support of heat and consciousness.

original: da ni tshe de'i rten du gyur ba gang yin zhe na //
analyzed: da ni tshe de'i rten du gyur ba gang yin zhe na //
translated: Now, what is the support of that life?

original: drod dang rnam par shes pa de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: drod dang rnam par shes pa de dag nyid yin no //
translated: It is those two, heat and consciousness.

original: 'o na ni phan tshun ltos te 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni phan tshun ltos te 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: But if they are mutually dependent,

original: de dag las gang gi dbang gis na gzhan dag ldog par 'gyur ba gang zhig sngar ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag las gang gi dbang gis na gzhan dag ldog par 'gyur ba gang zhig sngar ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: which one ceases first, by whose power does the other cease?

original: rtag tu ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that they would never cease.

original: 'o na ni tshe'i rten du gyur pa las yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni tshe'i rten du gyur pa las yin te /
translated: But if it is the support of life,

original: las kyis ji srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: las kyis ji srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the life faculty continues to function for as long as it is projected by action.

original: drod dang rnam par shes pa dag gi rten du gyur pa yang las kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: drod dang rnam par shes pa dag gi rten du gyur pa yang las kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: Why not accept that action alone is the support of heat and consciousness?

original: ma shi ba'i bar du rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par smin par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: ma shi ba'i bar du rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par smin par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: If that were so, then all consciousness would be the result of action until death.

original: 'o na ni drod kyi rten du gyur pa las yin par 'gyur la /🔽drod kyang rnam par @79a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni drod kyi rten du gyur pa las yin par 'gyur la / drod kyang rnam par @79a * //
translated: But then heat would be the result of action,

original: shes pa'i rten du gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rten du gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and heat would be the support of consciousness.

original: de lta na ni gzugs med pa dag na drod med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rten med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs med pa dag na drod med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rten med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that were so, then since there is no heat in the formless realm, consciousness would be without a support there.

original: de'i rten ni las yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rten ni las yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Its support would be action.

original: gang la lar ni rnam par shes pa'i rten drod kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la lar ni rnam par shes pa'i rten drod kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes the support of consciousness would be heat alone,🔽and sometimes it would be action alone.

original: la lar ni las kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'dod dgu mi 'thob pa nyid de bshad kyang zin to //
analyzed: la lar ni las kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'dod dgu mi 'thob pa nyid de bshad kyang zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is not tenable to assert that you can choose whatever you like.

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: What is it that is said?

original: ma shi ba'i bar du rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par smin par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ma shi ba'i bar du rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par smin par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that until death, all consciousnesses would be results.

original: de lta bas na de gnyis kyi rkyen du gyur pa tshe ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyis kyi rkyen du gyur pa tshe ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, life force exists as a condition for those two.

original: med do zhes ni mi smra mod kyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: med do zhes ni mi smra mod kyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: We do not say that it does not exist, but it is not a substance.

original: 'o na de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: khams gsum pa'i las kyis ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i las kyis ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa yin te /
translated: It is the duration of the life of a class affiliate projected by karma of the three realms.

original: dus 'di srid cig tu gnas par bya'o zhes ji srid du las kyi ris mthun pa 'phangs pa de srid du de gnas pa de la tshe zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dus 'di srid cig tu gnas par bya'o zhes ji srid du las kyi ris mthun pa 'phangs pa de srid du de gnas pa de la tshe zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called life because one remains for a certain period of time, as long as the class affiliate projected by karma remains.

original: 'bru rnams kyi smin pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa lta bu dang / mda' 'phangs pa dag gi gnas pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bru rnams kyi smin pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa lta bu dang / mda' 'phangs pa dag gi gnas pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the duration of the ripening of grain and the duration of the flight of an arrow.

original: gang zhig 'du byed ces bya ba yon tan gyi khyad par 'ga' mda' la skye ste //
analyzed: gang zhig 'du byed ces bya ba yon tan gyi khyad par 'ga' mda' la skye ste //
translated: Some say: A special quality called formation arises in an arrow.

original: de'i dbang gis na ma ltung gi bar du 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de'i de ni gcig pu yin pa'i phyir dang / gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu mgyogs pa dang ches dang shin tu ches mgyogs par phyin pa'i dus kyi bye brag kyang mi 'thad la ltung ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis na ma ltung gi bar du 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de'i de ni gcig pu yin pa'i phyir dang / gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu mgyogs pa dang ches dang shin tu ches mgyogs par phyin pa'i dus kyi bye brag kyang mi 'thad la ltung ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Consequently, it is untenable that it moves quickly, very quickly, extremely quickly to another place, and that it falls.

original: gal te rlung gis de la gegs byed do zhe na //
analyzed: gal te rlung gis de la gegs byed do zhe na //
translated: If you say that the wind impedes it,

original: rlung la khyad par med pa'i phyir drung du ltung ba'am yang na gzhar yang mi ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung la khyad par med pa'i phyir drung du ltung ba'am yang na gzhar yang mi ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that it would fall to the ground or never fall, because there would be no difference in the wind.

original: 'di skad du tshe rdzas gzhan kho na zhig yod do zhes ni brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad du tshe rdzas gzhan kho na zhig yod do zhes ni brjod do //
translated: We say that there is a separate substance called life force.

original: yang ci tshe zad pa kho nas 'chi bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yang ci tshe zad pa kho nas 'chi bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Does death occur only through the exhaustion of life?

original: 'on te gzhan du yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du yang yin zhe na /
translated: Or does it occur in other ways?

original: btags pa las /
analyzed: btags pa las /
translated: The Exegesis of the Levels declares:

original: tshe zad par 'chi bar 'gyur la bsod nams zad pas ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe zad par 'chi bar 'gyur la bsod nams zad pas ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhi gsungs te /
translated: There are four possibilities: death through the exhaustion of life but not through the exhaustion of merit;

original: mu dang po ni tshe rnam par smin pa can gyi las yongs su gtugs pa las so //
analyzed: mu dang po ni tshe rnam par smin pa can gyi las yongs su gtugs pa las so //
translated: The first alternative is when the action that ripens in life is exhausted.

original: gnyis pa ni longs spyod rnam par smin pa can gyi las yongs su gtugs pa las so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni longs spyod rnam par smin pa can gyi las yongs su gtugs pa las so //
translated: The second is when the action that ripens in enjoyment is exhausted.

original: gsum pa ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: The third is when both are exhausted.

original: bzhi pa ni ya nga ba yongs su @79b ma spangs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ya nga ba yongs su @79b ma spangs so //
translated: The fourth is when the danger is completely avoided.

original: tshe btang ba las kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe btang ba las kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should also be stated for the giving up of life.

original: tshe zad na bsod nams zad pa 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa med do //
analyzed: tshe zad na bsod nams zad pa 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa med do //
translated: When life is exhausted, merit exhausted, there is no power to die.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga zad na gnyi ga zad pa las 'chi bar bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga zad na gnyi ga zad pa las 'chi bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, when both are exhausted, it is said that death is due to the exhaustion of both.

original: ye shes la 'jug pa las /🔽tshe rgyud la rag lus te 'jug pa zhes brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: ye shes la 'jug pa las / tshe rgyud la rag lus te 'jug pa zhes brjod par bya'am /
translated: In the Avatiira,🔽it says, “Should it be said that life is dependent on the continuum of causes and engages in activity,

original: lan cig skyes nas gnas pa zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: lan cig skyes nas gnas pa zhes brjod par bya /
translated: or should it be said that once it arises, it endures?”

original: smras pa ; 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par ma zhugs pa rnams kyi ni rgyud la rag lus te /
analyzed: smras pa ; 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par ma zhugs pa rnams kyi ni rgyud la rag lus te /
translated: He says: The first is the lifeforce of sentient beings in the desire realm who have not entered the meditative attainment of nonperception or the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'jug pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said to be engaged because it is dependent on the mindstream.🔽The second is the lifeforce of sentient beings who have entered meditative attainment, or sentient beings in the form and formless realms.🔽It is said to be born once and remain because it remains as it was born.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi ni lan cig skyes nas gnas pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa bshad pa 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi ni lan cig skyes nas gnas pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa bshad pa 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this explanation?

original: gang la lus la gnas pas gnod par 'gyur ba de ni rgyud la rag lus pa'i phyir dang po yin no //
analyzed: gang la lus la gnas pas gnod par 'gyur ba de ni rgyud la rag lus pa'i phyir dang po yin no //
translated: The first is the lifeforce of sentient beings in the desire realm who have not entered meditative attainment because it is harmed by remaining in the body.

original: gang gi lus la gnod pa nyid med pa de ni ji ltar skyes pa bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi lus la gnod pa nyid med pa de ni ji ltar skyes pa bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second is the lifeforce of sentient beings who have entered meditative attainment, or sentient beings in the form and formless realms because it remains as it was born, since it is not harmed by remaining in the body.

original: kha che ba rnams na re glo bur dang bcas pa ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re glo bur dang bcas pa ni dang po yin no //
translated: Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say: The first is that which is associated with adventitious states.

original: glo bur med pa ni gnyis pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: glo bur med pa ni gnyis pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: The second is not untimely death.

original: de lta bas na dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni yod do /
analyzed: de lta bas na dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni yod do /
translated: Therefore untimely death exists.🔽A sutra declares:

original: mdo las lus thob pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdo las lus thob pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of obtaining a body.

original: lus thob pa gang la bdag nyid 'chi bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis gsod pas ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lus thob pa gang la bdag nyid 'chi bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis gsod pas ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhir gsungs pa /
translated: There is one type of obtaining a body where one dies by oneself and not through being killed by another.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na lha rtsed mos myos pa rnams dang / yid rab tu 'khrugs pa rnams ni bdag nyid 'chi ba kho nar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na lha rtsed mos myos pa rnams dang / yid rab tu 'khrugs pa rnams ni bdag nyid 'chi ba kho nar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the desire realm, gods who are intoxicated by play and those whose minds are disturbed die by themselves.

original: de rnams ni rab tu dga' ba dang yid rab tu 'khrugs pa dag gi gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni rab tu dga' ba dang yid rab tu 'khrugs pa dag gi gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They die and transmigrate from that abode due to intense joy and intense mental disturbance, but not otherwise.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that this also applies to buddhas.

original: bdag nyid 'grongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'grongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they die by themselves.

original: mngal dang sgo da na 'dug pa rnams ni gzhan gyis gsod pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mngal dang sgo da na 'dug pa rnams ni gzhan gyis gsod pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Those who are in the womb or an egg are killed by others.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams gzhan dag phal cher ni gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams gzhan dag phal cher ni gnyi ga yin no //
translated: Most of the others in the desire realm are both.

original: srid pa bar ma pa thams cad dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa kha cig 'di lta sta dmyal pa ba rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / mthong @80a * //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma pa thams cad dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa kha cig 'di lta sta dmyal pa ba rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / mthong @80a * //
translated: All intermediate beings, those in the form and formless realms, and some in the desire realm, such as hell beings, those in Uttarakuru, those on the

original: ba'i lam dang / byams pa dang 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / rgyal po'i drang srong dang / rgyal po'i pho nya dang / rgyal bas bstan pa dang / chos len pa dang /
analyzed: ba'i lam dang / byams pa dang 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / rgyal po'i drang srong dang / rgyal po'i pho nya dang / rgyal bas bstan pa dang / chos len pa dang /
translated: path of seeing, those absorbed in the meditative attainment of loving-kindness, cessation, and nonperception, the king’s sages, the king’s messengers, those taught by the Victor, and those who uphold the Dharma are not both.

original: mchog can dang / gang la len pa dang / tshong dpon gyi bu grags pa gzhon nu dang / 'tsho byed la sogs pa rnams dang / srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yum de lhums na gnas pa dang /
analyzed: mchog can dang / gang la len pa dang / tshong dpon gyi bu grags pa gzhon nu dang / 'tsho byed la sogs pa rnams dang / srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yum de lhums na gnas pa dang /
translated: the supreme being, the one who takes rebirth, the youthful merchant son Yashodhara, Jivaka and so on, bodhisattvas in their final phase of cyclic existence, the mother of the Bodhisattva while she is carrying him in her womb,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i ma de mngal na gnas pa gnyi ga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i ma de mngal na gnas pa gnyi ga ma yin no //
translated: a cakravartin and the mother of a cakravartin while she is carrying him in her womb are not both.

original: yang ci'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Why does a sutra state:

original: btsun pa gang dag bdag nyid 'gum par yang mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis gsod pa yang ma lags pa'i sems can de dag gang lags /
analyzed: btsun pa gang dag bdag nyid 'gum par yang mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis gsod pa yang ma lags pa'i sems can de dag gang lags /
translated: Venerable One, what are those sentient beings who neither die by their own hand nor are killed by others?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams yin no zhes gsungs she na ;
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams yin no zhes gsungs she na ;
translated: Sariputra, they are those who proceed to the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa gzhan dag ni bdag nyid 'chi ba ni rang gi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa gzhan dag ni bdag nyid 'chi ba ni rang gi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yin la /
translated: The other absorptions and formless states are the arya path of their own level that causes death.

original: gzhan gyis gsod pa ni sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsod pa ni sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs yin gyi /
translated: The formless realm is not killed by others, because it is the access concentration to the higher stage.

original: de na ni gnyi ga med do zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: de na ni gnyi ga med do zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: But it is said that both are absent there.

original: de lta na 'o na de na yang gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gzhan gyis gsod par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de na yang gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gzhan gyis gsod par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the ārya path of another stage would not kill it.

original: 'o na ni mthar smos pas de la sogs pa go'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni mthar smos pas de la sogs pa go'o //
translated: If that is so, then the term “final” should be understood to include the rest.

original: la lar ni mtha' yang dang pos go ste /
analyzed: la lar ni mtha' yang dang pos go ste /
translated: In some cases, the final is understood by the first,

original: 'di lta ste tshangs ris kyi lha dag lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs ris kyi lha dag lta bu ste /
translated: for example, “like the gods of the class of Brahma,”

original: 'di ni bde ba skye ba dang po yin no zhes gang bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba skye ba dang po yin no zhes gang bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: which explains that this is the first birth of bliss.

original: la lar ni dang po yang mthas go ste /
analyzed: la lar ni dang po yang mthas go ste /
translated: In some cases, the first is understood by the final,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: for example,

original: 'od gsal ba'i lha rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i lha rnams lta bu ste /
translated: “like the gods of the Abhasvara realm,”

original: 'di ni bde ba skye ba gnyis pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba skye ba gnyis pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: which explains that this is the second birth of bliss.

original: 'dir ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dper na brjod pa yin pas 'di las lhag ma go bar yang rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dper na brjod pa yin pas 'di las lhag ma go bar yang rigs te /
translated: Here the term “like” is used as an example, so it is logical that the rest is understood from that.

original: dpe'i chos ni gang gcig yin yang de dang 'dra ba yang ston par byed pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i chos ni gang gcig yin yang de dang 'dra ba yang ston par byed pa 'di yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the example is that it shows what is similar to something else, even though it is not that.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra de yang 'di na med pas 'di ni nye bar sbyar du mi rung ngo //🔽gal te 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dper brjod pa yin na ni sems can lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra de yang 'di na med pas 'di ni nye bar sbyar du mi rung ngo // gal te 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dper brjod pa yin na ni sems can lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: But since the expression “for example” does not occur in the above passage, it cannot be an example.🔽If the expression “for example” were an example, then the passage “There are sentient beings who have different bodies and different ideations, namely humans and some gods” would not be an example,

original: 'di lta ste mi rnams dang lha kha @80b cig go zhes bya ba 'dir thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi rnams dang lha kha @80b cig go zhes bya ba 'dir thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: because the expression “for example” does not occur in it.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nye bar bstan pa'i don kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nye bar bstan pa'i don kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the expression “for example” should be regarded as an indication.

original: ha cang thal bas chog go //
analyzed: ha cang thal bas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extended discussion!

original: srog bshad zin to //
analyzed: srog bshad zin to //
translated: The life faculty has been explained.🔽The characteristics of the conditioned are origination,

original: mtshan nyid dag ni skye ba dang // rga dang gnas dang mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag ni skye ba dang // rga dang gnas dang mi rtag nyid //
