translated: duration, change, and impermanence.

original: bzhi po 'di rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin te /
translated: These four are the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: gang la 'di dag yod pa'i chos de ni 'dus byas su mngon no //
analyzed: gang la 'di dag yod pa'i chos de ni 'dus byas su mngon no //
translated: A phenomenon that possesses them is clearly conditioned.

original: bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The opposite is unconditioned.

original: de la skye bas ni chos de skyed par byad do //
analyzed: de la skye bas ni chos de skyed par byad do //
translated: Origination causes the generation of the factor.

original: gnas pas ni gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pas ni gnas par byed do //
translated: Enduring causes it to last.

original: rga bas ni rnyings par byed do //
analyzed: rga bas ni rnyings par byed do //
translated: Aging causes it to become old.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni 'jig par byed do //
translated: Impermanence causes it to perish.

original: mdo las gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mdo las gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it said in the sūtra that these three are the characteristics of the conditioned?

original: der bzhi pa yang brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der bzhi pa yang brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then a fourth characteristic should be mentioned.

original: der gang zhig ma gsungs /
analyzed: der gang zhig ma gsungs /
translated: What is it that is not mentioned?

original: smras pa / gnas pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gnas pa'o //
translated: It is enduring.

original: 'o na ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di yin no //
translated: But then it is just this that is called the transformation of enduring.

original: 'di ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: This is a synonym for aging,

original: dper na skye ba'i 'byung ba zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skye ba'i 'byung ba zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as the generation of generation is a synonym for origination and the destruction of impermanence is a synonym for impermanence.

original: mdo las ni yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos gang dag 'du byed rnams kyi dus 'pho bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa de dag nyid mtshan nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las ni yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos gang dag 'du byed rnams kyi dus 'pho bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa de dag nyid mtshan nyid du gsungs te /
translated: The sutras state that the characteristics are those formations that are engaged in transferring the time of formations because they cause one to feel revulsion.

original: skye bas ni 'du byed rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar byung ba'i dus su skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye bas ni 'du byed rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar byung ba'i dus su skyed par byed do //
translated: Birth generates formations from the future into the present.

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ni da ltar byung ba nas 'das par te /
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ni da ltar byung ba nas 'das par te /
translated: Aging and impermanence do so from the present into the past.

original: nyam chung ngur byas te 'joms par byed pa'i phyir dper na thibs por zhugs pa'i mi zhig la dgra gsum yod de /
analyzed: nyam chung ngur byas te 'joms par byed pa'i phyir dper na thibs por zhugs pa'i mi zhig la dgra gsum yod de /
translated: For example, it is like a man who has entered a thicket and three enemies are trying to kill him.

original: de las gcig gis ni thibs po nas 'byin par byed /🔽gnyis kyis ni srog gcod par byed pa de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: de las gcig gis ni thibs po nas 'byin par byed / gnyis kyis ni srog gcod par byed pa de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: One enemy pulls him out of the thicket.🔽The other two kill him.

original: gnas pa ni mi 'bral bar 'dod pa de bzhin du 'du byed de dag 'khyud nas gnas so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni mi 'bral bar 'dod pa de bzhin du 'du byed de dag 'khyud nas gnas so //
translated: It is said that endurance is asserted to be the desire not to be separated from formations and it endures by embracing them.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: Thus, these are not considered to be the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan dag rtog par byed pa ni mdo las gnas pa dang rga ba bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag rtog par byed pa ni mdo las gnas pa dang rga ba bsdus te /
translated: But the unconditioned factor, i.e., space, also endures by means of its intrinsic nature.🔽Other masters maintain that the Sūtra intends to include duration in the characteristic of duration-change.

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ces mtshan nyid gcig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ces mtshan nyid gcig tu gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra says that the characteristic of duration-change is the transformation of that which endures.

original: ci dgos she na /
analyzed: ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of this teaching?

original: 'di dag gi nang na 'di ni chags pa'i gzhi yin pas de'i phyir @81a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang na 'di ni chags pa'i gzhi yin pas de'i phyir @81a * //
translated: The Sūtra teaches that the characteristic of duration-change is the basis of attachment.

original: de la ma chags par bya ba'i don du de ni dpal dang 'dra ba 'di dang rna nag ma dang lhan cig tu bstan te /
analyzed: de la ma chags par bya ba'i don du de ni dpal dang 'dra ba 'di dang rna nag ma dang lhan cig tu bstan te /
translated: In order to detach oneself from this basis, the Sūtra teaches that this characteristic is like a glorious ornament and like a black snake.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni bzhi kho na'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni bzhi kho na'o snyam mo //
translated: Thus, the characteristics of conditioned factors are only four in number.

original: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since these characteristics, origination, etc., are conditioned factors, they should have other characteristics of conditioned factors, origination, etc.

original: yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yod pa kho na ste /
translated: They do have them.

original: de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs //
translated: The origination of origination, etc.

original: de dag la yang skye ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de dag la yang skye ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi yod do //
translated: and for these there are four characteristics, origination of origination, duration of duration, etc.

original: de dag la yang skye ba la sogs pa gzhan du thal ba'i phyir re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhi pa dang mthar thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la yang skye ba la sogs pa gzhan du thal ba'i phyir re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhi pa dang mthar thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But then, since these would have other origination, etc., there would be the fault of an infinite regress, and there would be the fault of each having four characteristics.🔽No, there is no fault,

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: because:🔽Eight apply to conditioned factors, one to both.

original: 'di ltar / de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug / skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni chos brgyad la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug / skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni chos brgyad la 'jug go //
translated: Origination, etc., apply to eight conditioned factors.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “apply”?

original: byed pa ste skyes bu'i rtsal lo //
analyzed: byed pa ste skyes bu'i rtsal lo //
translated: It means to function, to be a human capacity.

original: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la 'jug go //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la 'jug go //
translated: The origination of origination, etc., apply to one factor.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: chos bdag nyid gtogs par mtshan nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad dang lhan cig tu dgu skye la /
analyzed: chos bdag nyid gtogs par mtshan nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad dang lhan cig tu dgu skye la /
translated: The arising of the primary nature itself arises together with eight characteristics that conform with their object, for a total of nine.

original: de la skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed do ;
analyzed: de la skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed do ;
translated: Arising causes the arising of eight phenomena, excluding itself.

original: / skye ba'i skye bas ni skye ba de kho na skyed par byed do //
analyzed: / skye ba'i skye bas ni skye ba de kho na skyed par byed do //
translated: The arising of arising causes the arising of arising alone.

original: dper na khyim bya mo la la las ni phru gu mang du 'brang la /
analyzed: dper na khyim bya mo la la las ni phru gu mang du 'brang la /
translated: For example, some hens produce many eggs,

original: la las ni nyung du 'brang ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: la las ni nyung du 'brang ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: but others produce few.

original: gnas pas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan brgyad gnas par byed la /
analyzed: gnas pas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan brgyad gnas par byed la /
translated: Enduring causes the enduring of eight phenomena, excluding itself.

original: gnas pa'i gnas pas ni gnas pa de kho na gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i gnas pas ni gnas pa de kho na gnas par byed do //
translated: The enduring of enduring causes the enduring of enduring alone.

original: de bzhin du rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Aging and impermanence should be applied in the same way.

original: de bas na thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: de bas na thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes grag go //
translated: Therefore it is said that the error of infinite regress does not arise.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re 'di ni nam mkha' la 'dral bar bskyod pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re 'di ni nam mkha' la 'dral bar bskyod pa yin te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say: You are splitting hairs in regard to space.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos can de dag ni ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos can de dag ni ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The factors of birth, etc., do not exist as real entities in the way that they are distinguished.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /🔽de dag rdzas su yod pa'i tshad ma ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos bzhin du mngon sum pa 'am /
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir te / de dag rdzas su yod pa'i tshad ma ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos bzhin du mngon sum pa 'am /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition to establish them.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'am /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'am /
translated: There is no direct perception or inference that can establish them as real entities, as is the case with the factors of form, etc.

original: yid ches pa'i lung ni cung zad kyang med do//
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung ni cung zad kyang med do//
translated: Nor is there any reliable testimony.

original: @81b 'on gang mdo sde las /
analyzed: @81b 'on gang mdo sde las /
translated: But, it is said in a Sutra:

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon no //
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon no //
translated: One can see that conditioned factors arise,

original: 'jig par yang mngon no //
analyzed: 'jig par yang mngon no //
translated: one can see that they disappear,

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du yang mngon no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du yang mngon no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: one can see that their transformation is due to their duration changing.

original: tshig shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi don shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi don shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The gods rejoice in the knowledge of the letter, but not in the knowledge of the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni don la brten par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni don la brten par gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said that one should rely on the meaning.

original: 'di'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this passage?

original: ma rig pas ldongs pa'i byis pa rnams 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag dang bdag gir mos pas mngon par zhen pas mos pa de bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pas ldongs pa'i byis pa rnams 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag dang bdag gir mos pas mngon par zhen pas mos pa de bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: Childlike beings, blinded by ignorance, are attached to the continuum of the formative forces through their belief in “I” and “mine.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed kyi rgyun de 'dus byas nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed kyi rgyun de 'dus byas nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: In order to reverse that belief, the Bhagavān, wishing to teach that the continuum of the formative forces is conditioned and dependently arisen,

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes gsungs par zad kyi yang skad cig ma la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes gsungs par zad kyi yang skad cig ma la ni ma yin no //
translated: stated that “these three are the characteristics of the conditioned.” He did not say that they are characteristics of a moment.

original: skad cig ma la ni skye ba la sogs pa mi mngon no //
analyzed: skad cig ma la ni skye ba la sogs pa mi mngon no //
translated: Birth, etc., are not evident in a moment.

original: mi mngon pa de dag ni mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mngon pa de dag ni mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not appropriate that what is not evident is a characteristic.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo de las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo de las /
translated: Therefore, in that sūtra,

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon no zhes gsungs so //
translated: it says, “The arising of the conditioned is evident.”

original: yang 'dus byas zhes smos pa ni ci nas kyang 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no snyam du shes par bya ba'i chu dang chu skyar ltar ram /
analyzed: yang 'dus byas zhes smos pa ni ci nas kyang 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no snyam du shes par bya ba'i chu dang chu skyar ltar ram /
translated: The expression “conditioned phenomena” is used in order to understand that these are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena alone, and not of unconditioned phenomena, like the water and the water fowl.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi bu mo'i mtshan bzhin du 'dus byas kyi dngos po yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes na ni mi rung ngo snyam nas smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi bu mo'i mtshan bzhin du 'dus byas kyi dngos po yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes na ni mi rung ngo snyam nas smos pa yin no //
translated: Or, like the marks of a maiden, these are the marks of the existence of conditioned phenomena, like virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de la rgyun gyi dbang po ni skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyun gyi dbang po ni skye ba yin no //
translated: The faculty of continuity is birth.

original: ldog pa ni 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ni 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of continuity is destruction.

original: rgyun de nyid rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun de nyid rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: The continuity itself is duration.

original: de'i snga phyi'i bye brag ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i snga phyi'i bye brag ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: The difference between its earlier and later states is change.

original: de lta yin pas na /
analyzed: de lta yin pas na /
translated: Since this is so,

original: rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du skye'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, I know that feeling arises.

original: rig bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: rig bzhin du gnas so //
translated: I know that it endures.

original: rig bzhin du nub pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rig bzhin du nub pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: It will disappear, be completely exhausted, and come to an end.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
analyzed: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
translated: Arising is the beginning of a continuum.

original: chad pa 'jig pa gnas pa ste //
analyzed: chad pa 'jig pa gnas pa ste //
translated: Destruction is the end of a continuum.

original: de nyid snga phyi'i bye brag ni ;
analyzed: de nyid snga phyi'i bye brag ni ;
translated: The difference between earlier and later

original: / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: moments is the transformation of a continuum.

original: yang 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: yang 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sngon med las byung skye ba ste //
analyzed: sngon med las byung skye ba ste //
translated: Arising is the occurrence of what did not previously exist.

original: rgyun gnas de chad 'jig pa yin //🔽rgyun gyi snga phyi'i bye brag ni //
analyzed: rgyun gnas de chad 'jig pa yin // rgyun gyi snga phyi'i bye brag ni //
translated: Destruction is the end of a continuum.🔽The difference between earlier and later

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: moments is the transformation of a continuum.

original: skad cig ma yi chos la ni //🔽gnas pa med na 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig ma yi chos la ni // gnas pa med na 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: A phenomenon that is momentary🔽cannot endure.

original: de yang 'jig 'gyur de @82a * //
analyzed: de yang 'jig 'gyur de @82a * //
translated: If it endures, it is not momentary.

original: yi phyir // de yi der rtogs don med do //
analyzed: yi phyir // de yi der rtogs don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless to think that it endures.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin no //
translated: Thus endurance is a continuum.

original: de ltar bshad na chos mngon pa las gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na chos mngon pa las gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: If this is explained in this way, then what is endurance?

original: 'dus byas skye ba rnams mi 'jig pa yin no zhes bstan pa 'di yang 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas skye ba rnams mi 'jig pa yin no zhes bstan pa 'di yang 'thad pa yin te /
translated: This teaching that conditioned states that have arisen do not disintegrate is also tenable.

original: skyes pa skad cig ma la ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa skad cig ma la ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no disintegration in the moment of their arising.

original: gang yang ye shes la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: gang yang ye shes la 'jug pa las /
translated: Moreover, in the Compendium of Knowledge,🔽it says:

original: sems gcig la 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gcig la 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is origination in the mind?

original: smras pa / skye ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba'o //
translated: It is birth.

original: 'jig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is disintegration?

original: 'chi ba'o // gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'o // gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: It is death. What is abiding as transformation?🔽It is aging.

original: rga ba'o zhes gsungs pa der yang ris mthun pa'i sems la rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rga ba'o zhes gsungs pa der yang ris mthun pa'i sems la rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is also tenable in terms of a continuum of moments of the mind.

original: skad cig ma re re la yang rdzas gzhan du rtogs pa med pa bzhin du 'dus byas kyi de dag rung ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang rdzas gzhan du rtogs pa med pa bzhin du 'dus byas kyi de dag rung ste /
translated: The conditioned states of the mind are also tenable, even though they are not recognized as different substances in each moment.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: skad cig ma re re la ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Origination is the arising of that which did not previously exist in each moment.

original: byung nas med pa ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: byung nas med pa ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: Disintegration is the nonexistence of that which previously existed.

original: snga ma snga ma dang phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig ma rjes su 'brel ba ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma dang phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig ma rjes su 'brel ba ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding as transformation is the connection of earlier and later moments.

original: de'i mi 'dra ba nyid ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mi 'dra ba nyid ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Its difference is its transformation.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skye'o zhe na /
translated: But when it is produced as similar,

original: de dag khyad par med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag khyad par med pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not without difference.

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know this?🔽Because of the difference in the speed of the falling of a vajra, etc.,

original: rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang / stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa bul ba dang myur ba dang / ches dal ba dang / ches myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag las de'i 'byung ba rnams yongs su gyur ba'i bye brag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang / stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa bul ba dang myur ba dang / ches dal ba dang / ches myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag las de'i 'byung ba rnams yongs su gyur ba'i bye brag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: when it is thrown or not thrown, when it is thrown with great force or with little force, and because of the difference in the speed of the transformation of its primary elements.

original: 'dus byas rnams ni bye brag gi khyad par chen po mtshar cig med pas gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod du zin kyang 'dra ba bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni bye brag gi khyad par chen po mtshar cig med pas gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod du zin kyang 'dra ba bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Since compounded things do not have a great difference in their specific characteristics, they appear as similar even though they are different.

original: 'o na ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe'i skye mched drug la skad cig ma phyi ma med pa'i phyir gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe'i skye mched drug la skad cig ma phyi ma med pa'i phyir gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: But the last moment of sound and the last moment of the six sense spheres of a person who is entering parinirvāṇa would not have the characteristic of change of state, because they are not followed by a subsequent moment.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gnas pa kho na yang ma yin gyi gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gnas pa kho na yang ma yin gyi gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the conditioned is not only endurance, but also change of state.

original: de'i phyir gang la gnas pa yod pa de la gdon mi za bar gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod pas rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la gnas pa yod pa de la gdon mi za bar gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod pas rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the presentation of the characteristics, because if something endures, it must also change.

original: mdor na bcom ldan 'das kyis ni mdo 'di las 'dus @82b byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdor na bcom ldan 'das kyis ni mdo 'di las 'dus @82b byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In brief, the Bhagavān said in this sūtra that the characteristic of the conditioned is

original: gang ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang mi 'byung ba 'di 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: gang ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang mi 'byung ba 'di 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par gsungs la /
translated: the arising of that which did not previously exist and the subsequent cessation of that which arose.

original: 'di'i gnas pa zhes bya ba rgyun gang yin pa de yang gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di'i gnas pa zhes bya ba rgyun gang yin pa de yang gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: And that which is called its endurance is a continuum that is different from moment to moment.

original: 'dir skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan dag gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan dag gis ci zhig bya /
translated: What purpose is served by positing birth, etc., as other substantial entities?

original: de ni ji ltar na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos de nyid kyi mtshan nyid du rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos de nyid kyi mtshan nyid du rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be tenable that the characteristics are the characteristics of that very entity that is the basis of those characteristics?

original: re zhig ji ltar na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams skyes bu chen po las mi gzhan pa yin /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams skyes bu chen po las mi gzhan pa yin /
translated: How could the major marks of a great being not be different from a great being?

original: ba lang nyid kyi mtshan nyid lkog shal dang / mjug ma dang / nog dang / rmig pa dang / rva rnams kyang ba lang las mi gzhan pa yin /
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi mtshan nyid lkog shal dang / mjug ma dang / nog dang / rmig pa dang / rva rnams kyang ba lang las mi gzhan pa yin /
translated: How could the characteristics of a cow—its dewlap, tail, hump, hoof, and horns—not be different from a cow?

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang de dag las mi gzhan pa yin /
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang de dag las mi gzhan pa yin /
translated: How could the characteristics of the elements, such as solidity, not be different from the elements?

original: gzhan yang ji ltar gyen du 'gro ba las ni thag ring po nas du ba la du ba nyid du shes mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar gyen du 'gro ba las ni thag ring po nas du ba la du ba nyid du shes mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, how could it be tenable that smoke is known to be smoke from its mere upward movement?

original: de ni de las kyang mi gzhan pa ltar 'dir yang tshul de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni de las kyang mi gzhan pa ltar 'dir yang tshul de nyid yin no //
translated: It is the same here, as in the case of other things.

original: 'dus byas gzugs la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo bzung yang ji srid du snga na med pa dang phyis med pa dang rgyun gyi bye brag mi shes pa de srid du 'dus byas nyid du mi shes te /
analyzed: 'dus byas gzugs la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo bzung yang ji srid du snga na med pa dang phyis med pa dang rgyun gyi bye brag mi shes pa de srid du 'dus byas nyid du mi shes te /
translated: Even though one apprehends the intrinsic nature of conditioned things, such as form, etc., as long as one does not know the absence of prior existence, the absence of subsequent existence, and the particularities of the continuum, one does not know that they are conditioned.

original: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are not characterized by that alone.

original: de dag las skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor do origination, etc., exist as real entities that are different from them.

original: 'on te skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan zhig tu gyur na yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan zhig tu gyur na yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if origination, etc., were to exist as real entities that are different from them, what would be the consequence?

original: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir chos gcig dus gcig tu skyes pa dang gnas pa dang rgas pa dang zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir chos gcig dus gcig tu skyes pa dang gnas pa dang rgas pa dang zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would occur simultaneously, because they would occur together. Thus, a single entity would be originated, would endure, would age, and would be destroyed at one time.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not,

original: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the times of their activity are different.

original: skye ba ma 'ongs pa ni bya ba byed de /
analyzed: skye ba ma 'ongs pa ni bya ba byed de /
translated: Future origination performs its activity.

original: 'di ltar ma skyes pa skyed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa skyed do //
translated: In this way, it originates that which has not yet originated.

original: bskyed zin pa'i chos la ni da ltar gnas pa la sogs pa bya ba byed pas gang gi tshe skye ba de tshe gnas pa'am /
analyzed: bskyed zin pa'i chos la ni da ltar gnas pa la sogs pa bya ba byed pas gang gi tshe skye ba de tshe gnas pa'am /
translated: But with regard to a factor that has already arisen, it is not tenable that it is arising at the same time that it endures or that it ages or that it passes away, because it is already arisen.🔽It is not tenable that it is arising at the same time that it endures,

original: rga ba 'am /🔽'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rga ba 'am / 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ages, or passes away.

original: re zhig 'dir ci ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod dam med ces bya ba 'di dpyad dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir ci ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod dam med ces bya ba 'di dpyad dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, first of all, it must be investigated whether the future exists as a real entity or not.

original: phyis ni skyed par byed dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis ni skyed par byed dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it can be established whether or not it generates.

original: de yod du chug na yang skye ba bya ba byed na ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yod du chug na yang skye ba bya ba byed na ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Even if it exists, if arising performs its activity, how can it be established as future?

original: de lta bas na ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the future must be stated.

original: byung ba yang bya ba zhig pa yin na @83a * //
analyzed: byung ba yang bya ba zhig pa yin na @83a * //
translated: And if the activity of arising has already passed,

original: ji ltar na da ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar na da ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: how can it be established as present?

original: de lta bas na da lta'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na da lta'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the present must be stated.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa yang cig car bya ba la 'jug pa yin na ni skad cig ma gcig kho na la chos gnas pa dang rga ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa yang cig car bya ba la 'jug pa yin na ni skad cig ma gcig kho na la chos gnas pa dang rga ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If such things as endurance were to engage in action all at once, then it would follow that a phenomenon would endure, age, and disintegrate in a single moment.

original: 'di gang gi tshe gnas pas gnas par byed pa de nyid kyi tshe rga bas rga bar byed cing mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'di ci dus der gnas sam /
analyzed: 'di gang gi tshe gnas pas gnas par byed pa de nyid kyi tshe rga bas rga bar byed cing mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'di ci dus der gnas sam /
translated: When it endures through endurance, at that time it ages through aging and disintegrates through impermanence. Therefore, what is it that endures at that time?

original: 'on te rga ba 'am /
analyzed: 'on te rga ba 'am /
translated: Or does it age?

original: 'on te 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: Or does it disintegrate?

original: gang yang skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang bya ba rim gyis byed do zhes zer ba de'i ltar na skad cig ma gcig la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang bya ba rim gyis byed do zhes zer ba de'i ltar na skad cig ma gcig la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, if you say that such things as arising perform their action gradually, then they would be harmed by momentariness.

original: 'on te ji skad du kho bo cag gi skad cig ma ni ji tsam gyis 'di thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur bde yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te ji skad du kho bo cag gi skad cig ma ni ji tsam gyis 'di thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur bde yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say, “Our moment is that by which all of this is completed,”

original: de lta na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba las re zhig gnas pas ni gnas par byed kyi rga bas kyang rgas par mi byed la /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba las re zhig gnas pas ni gnas par byed kyi rga bas kyang rgas par mi byed la /
translated: Still, it is only endurance that endures, not aging or impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis kyang 'jig par mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis kyang 'jig par mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
translated: Why is this?

original: gnas pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because endurance is powerful.

original: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Why is it not powerful later?

original: gang gi phyir na 'di chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na 'di chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms /
translated: Because impermanence destroys it together with the dharma.

original: bya ba byas zin pas yang mi nus te skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba byas zin pas yang mi nus te skye ba bzhin no //
translated: Since its function has already been performed, it cannot perform it again, like arising.

original: skye bas ni mi nus par rigs te ;
analyzed: skye bas ni mi nus par rigs te ;
translated: It is reasonable that arising cannot perform its function,

original: skye bas bskyed par bya ba da lta nyid du khyer te 'ongs nas yang bkur bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: skye bas bskyed par bya ba da lta nyid du khyer te 'ongs nas yang bkur bar ni mi nus so //
translated: because arising brings the object to be arisen into the present and cannot bring it again.

original: gnas pas ni gnas par bya ba ye gnas par bya bar yang nus so //
analyzed: gnas pas ni gnas par bya ba ye gnas par bya bar yang nus so //
translated: But endurance can perform its function, which is to make the object endure, and can perform it again.

original: de lta bas na gang mi nus pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang mi nus pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is unreasonable that it cannot perform its function.

original: yang na 'di la bgegs byed pa yang gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di la bgegs byed pa yang gang zhig yin te /
translated: What then is the obstacle to their activity?

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na yin no //
translated: Aging and impermanence are the obstacles.

original: gal te de dag stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon kho na yin no //
translated: If they are powerful, then they are active from the very beginning.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang de dag kyang mi gnas la chos de yang mi gnas na ji ltar gang la bya ba byed pa nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang de dag kyang mi gnas la chos de yang mi gnas na ji ltar gang la bya ba byed pa nus par 'gyur /
translated: But if the activity of endurance has ceased, then they are not enduring, nor is the dharma enduring. How then could they be capable of activity?

original: yang na de dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: yang na de dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Or, what would they do?

original: gnas pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chos skyes pa tsam de ma zhig par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chos skyes pa tsam de ma zhig par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The dharma that has arisen is not destroyed because it is grasped by endurance.

original: des de yal bar btang na ni nges par mi gnas pas 'di nyid 'di'i 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: des de yal bar btang na ni nges par mi gnas pas 'di nyid 'di'i 'jig pa yin no //
translated: If it is abandoned by them, it certainly does not endure. This is its destruction.

original: re zhig chos skyes pa gcig la mi 'jig pa ni gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: re zhig chos skyes pa gcig la mi 'jig pa ni gnas pa yin la /
translated: Endurance is the non-destruction of a dharma that has arisen.

original: 'jig pa ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: Impermanence is its destruction.

original: gcig la rga ba ni rnam pa @83b thams cad du mi srid de /
analyzed: gcig la rga ba ni rnam pa @83b thams cad du mi srid de /
translated: Aging is impossible for a single dharma.

original: rga ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhing rnam par 'gyur ba yin na de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid du ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rga ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhing rnam par 'gyur ba yin na de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid du ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Aging is the transformation and alteration of that which is another. It is not tenable that that very thing is another.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: de bzhin na ni rga mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin na ni rga mi 'gyur //
translated: If it is the same, it does not age.

original: gzhan du 'gyur na de gzhan nyid //🔽de lta bas na dngos gcig la //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur na de gzhan nyid // de lta bas na dngos gcig la //
translated: If it is another, it is not that.🔽Therefore,

original: rga zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rga zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: aging is not tenable in a single thing.

original: gang yang sde pa gzhan dag na re 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed do zhes zer ba de'i ni 'khru ba dang phrad nas lhas 'khru bar byed do zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang sde pa gzhan dag na re 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed do zhes zer ba de'i ni 'khru ba dang phrad nas lhas 'khru bar byed do zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if another school says that impermanence causes destruction when it encounters the cause of destruction, then it would be like saying that a washerman causes washing when he encounters water.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig na de brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig na de brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is destroyed by that very cause of destruction, what is the point of postulating impermanence?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pas de dag gis mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag dus tha mi dad par bya ba byed par 'gyur bas cig la
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pas de dag gis mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag dus tha mi dad par bya ba byed par 'gyur bas cig la
translated: Since it is accepted that minds and mental factors are momentary, their impermanence does not depend on a cause of destruction, and so endurance and impermanence would perform their functions at the same time.

original: dus gcig tu gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it follows that endurance and destruction would occur at the same time.

original: de lta bas na rgyun la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyun la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore these characteristics of conditioned states were taught in terms of a continuum.

original: de lta na mdo de legs par drangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na mdo de legs par drangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus this sutra is cited well.

original: gzhan yang gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba bskyed par bya ba skyed par byed pa yin nam 'ongs pa thams cad cig car ci'i phyir mi bskyed /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba bskyed par bya ba skyed par byed pa yin nam 'ongs pa thams cad cig car ci'i phyir mi bskyed /
translated: Moreover, if future arising generates that which is to be generated, why doesn’t it generate all future states simultaneously?🔽Because arising does not generate that which is to be generated

original: 'di ltar / rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni //🔽skye bas bskyed bya skyed byed min //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni // skye bas bskyed bya skyed byed min //
translated: without causes and conditions assembling.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa med par ni skye bas skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa med par ni skye bas skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Arising does not generate that which is to be generated without causes and conditions assembling.

original: 'o na ni tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la med na ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na'i mthu yin par blta bar bya'i skye ba ni ma yin pas rgyu dang rkyen kho na skyed par byed pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la med na ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na'i mthu yin par blta bar bya'i skye ba ni ma yin pas rgyu dang rkyen kho na skyed par byed pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But if the effect arises when the complex of causes and conditions is present, and does not arise when it is not present, it is the power of the causes and conditions that is effective, not the activity of arising. Thus causes and conditions are the only things that produce.

original: kye yod pa thams cad dmigs sam ci chos kyi rang bzhin phra mo dag yod bzhin du yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: kye yod pa thams cad dmigs sam ci chos kyi rang bzhin phra mo dag yod bzhin du yang mi dmigs so //
translated: But do you claim to perceive all that exists? Subtle natures of things exist, but are not perceived.

original: skye ba zhig med na skyes zhes bya ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes mi bya ba bzhin no /
analyzed: skye ba zhig med na skyes zhes bya ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes mi bya ba bzhin no /
translated: If there were no arising, there would be no such thing as the expression “arisen,” nor would there be the expression “the arising of form,” as in “the arising of form,” just as there is no such thing as the expression “the form of form.”

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to impermanence, etc., as appropriate.

original: 'o na ni des na bdag med pa'i blo 'grub par bya ba'i phyir bdag med pa nyid cig kyang 'dod par byas la //
analyzed: 'o na ni des na bdag med pa'i blo 'grub par bya ba'i phyir bdag med pa nyid cig kyang 'dod par byas la //
translated: But if that is so, then you should accept the existence of nonself in order to establish the cognition of nonself.

original: gcig dang / gnyis dang / chen po dang / chung ngu dang / tha dad pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / yod pa la sogs pa'i blo 'grub par bya ba'i @84a * //
analyzed: gcig dang / gnyis dang / chen po dang / chung ngu dang / tha dad pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / yod pa la sogs pa'i blo 'grub par bya ba'i @84a * //
translated: one, two, great, small, different, possessed, divided, other, not other, existent, etc.🔽In order to establish the cognition of one, two, great, small, different, possessed, divided, other, not other, existent, etc.,

original: phyir dang / drug par bya ba'i phyir mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtag pa grangs dang / tshad dang / tha dad pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / yod pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: phyir dang / drug par bya ba'i phyir mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtag pa grangs dang / tshad dang / tha dad pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / yod pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: the tīrthikas imagine number, measure, difference, possession, division, otherness, non-otherness, existence, etc.

original: gzugs kyi ldan pa zhes bya ba yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ldan pa zhes bya ba yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: And it must be accepted that form is possessed.🔽And how is this sixth case, called the nature of form, imagined?

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba drug pa 'di yang ji ltar brtag / de lta bas na skye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni ma byung ba las byung ba kho nar shes par bya ba'i don du brtags pa tsam mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba drug pa 'di yang ji ltar brtag / de lta bas na skye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni ma byung ba las byung ba kho nar shes par bya ba'i don du brtags pa tsam mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this so-called arising is merely imagined for the purpose of understanding that what was not previously existent has now arisen.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye bde yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye bzhes drug par mdzad de /
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye bde yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye bzhes drug par mdzad de /
translated: Since arising has many aspects, the Abhidharmakosa states, “The arising of form is the arising of the six,” in order to specify it.

original: ci nas kyang gzugs zhes bya ba kho na skye bar shes par bya'i gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gzugs zhes bya ba kho na skye bar shes par bya'i gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It is stated in this way so that one will understand that only that called form arises and not anything else.

original: dper na tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa dang / mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa dang / mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the expression “the smell of sandalwood” and “the body of a lump of sugar.”

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par bya'o //🔽gal te skye ba med par skye na nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyang ci'i phyir mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par bya'o // gal te skye ba med par skye na nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyang ci'i phyir mi skye zhe na /
translated: Similarly, endurance and so on should be understood in the appropriate way.🔽If that which does not exist previously arises, why does unconditioned space not arise?

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba yin na 'dus ma byas ni rtag tu yod pa'i phyir mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba yin na 'dus ma byas ni rtag tu yod pa'i phyir mi skye'o //
translated: Arising is the occurrence of that which did not previously exist, but unconditioned states are not arisen because they always exist.

original: yang ji ltar chos nyid kyis thams cad skye ba dang ldan par mi 'dod pa de ltar thams cad mi skye'o zhes bya bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar chos nyid kyis thams cad skye ba dang ldan par mi 'dod pa de ltar thams cad mi skye'o zhes bya bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Just as you do not accept that all things are endowed with production by virtue of their own nature, so you should accept that all things are not produced.

original: yang na ji ltar skye ba dang ldan par mtshungs pa las de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de dag las gzhan pa bskyed par nus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du thams cad kyis kyang 'dus ma byas bskyed par mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar skye ba dang ldan par mtshungs pa las de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de dag las gzhan pa bskyed par nus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du thams cad kyis kyang 'dus ma byas bskyed par mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, just as, although they are similar in being endowed with production, other conditions are not capable of producing anything other than those , so too all would be incapable of producing the unconditioned.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re skye ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi dngos por grub pa nyid do //🔽ri dags dag yod ces te nas mi rmo ba ma yin pa dang sbrang bu dag yod ces tel du mi bza' ba ma yin pa ltar sun 'byin pa dag yod ces te lung dor du mi rung bas de lta bas na skyon rnams la yang lan gdab
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re skye ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi dngos por grub pa nyid do // ri dags dag yod ces te nas mi rmo ba ma yin pa dang sbrang bu dag yod ces tel du mi bza' ba ma yin pa ltar sun 'byin pa dag yod ces te lung dor du mi rung bas de lta bas na skyon rnams la yang lan gdab
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: Production and so on are established as substantial entities.

original: par bya la ;
analyzed: par bya la ;
translated: Just as one does not avoid planting barley because there are deer, or one does not avoid eating honey because there are flies, one should not avoid scripture because there are refutations. Therefore we must respond to the faults.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar yang bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar yang bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: The Sūtra teaches that the aggregates are six.

original: mtshan nyid rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregates have been discussed.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the collection of names, etc.?

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni //
translated: The collection of names, etc.

original: ming dang ngag dang yi ge'i tshogs //
analyzed: ming dang ngag dang yi ge'i tshogs //
translated: The collection of names, phrases, and syllables.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates the collection of phrases and the collection of syllables.

original: de la @84b ming byed pa ni ming ste /
analyzed: de la @84b ming byed pa ni ming ste /
translated: Name is that which shows only the particular.

original: dper na gzugs sgra zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs sgra zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the names “form,” “feeling,” etc.

original: ngag ni tshig ste /
analyzed: ngag ni tshig ste /
translated: Phrase is that which shows the particular and the universal.

original: dper na / kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /🔽gang gis bya ba dang yon tan dang dus kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa ste / gang gis bya ba dang yon tan dang dus kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the phrase “impermanent, ” etc.

original: yi ge ni yi ge ste /
analyzed: yi ge ni yi ge ste /
translated: Sylable is that which cannot be divided.

original: dper na aa a'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na aa a'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the syllable “a, ” etc.

original: yi ge rnams kyang yi ge 'bru'i yan lag dag gi ming dag ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyang yi ge 'bru'i yan lag dag gi ming dag ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are not the letters the names of the parts of the syllables?

original: yi ge 'bru'i yan lag rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir yi ge rnams byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yi ge 'bru'i yan lag rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir yi ge rnams byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The letters are not made in order to designate the parts of the syllables.

original: ji ltar na ming thos pa bris pas go bar 'gyur zhes yi ge rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir ni yi ge'i 'bru rnams byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar na ming thos pa bris pas go bar 'gyur zhes yi ge rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir ni yi ge'i 'bru rnams byas pa yin pas /
translated: The parts of the syllables are made in order to designate the letters, since one does not understand the letters when one hears the name of the parts of the syllables.

original: yi ge rnams ni de dag gi ming ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni de dag gi ming ma yin no //
translated: Thus the letters are not the names of the parts of the syllables.

original: ming la sogs pa de dag gi tshogs ni ming la sogs pa'i tshogs dag yin te /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa de dag gi tshogs ni ming la sogs pa'i tshogs dag yin te /
translated: The collections of names, etc. are the collections of names, etc.

original: mang po'i don gang yin pa'o //🔽de la ming gi tshogs ni dper na gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya dag ces bya ba ste ;
analyzed: mang po'i don gang yin pa'o // de la ming gi tshogs ni dper na gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya dag ces bya ba ste ;
translated: The meaning of “collection” is “a multiplicity”.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽tshig gi tshogs ni dper na 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dag go // mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'o // tshig gi tshogs ni dper na 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dag go // mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The collection of names is, for example, the names rupa, “form”, sabda, “sound”, gandha, “smell”, rasa, “taste”, sprastavya, “tangible”, etc.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The collection of words is, for example, the words “all formations are impermanent”, “all contaminated things are suffering”, “all dharmas are without self”, “nirvana is peace”, etc.🔽The collection of syllables is, for example, the syllables a, ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, etc.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni dper na ka kha ga gha nga zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni dper na ka kha ga gha nga zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The collection of letters is, for example, ka, kha, ga, gha, ṅa,

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.🔽Since speech is their intrinsic nature, they are by nature sound.

original: de dag kyang ngag ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs kyi rang bzhin dag ma yin nam ci'i phyir sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ngag ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs kyi rang bzhin dag ma yin nam ci'i phyir sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called not associated with mind?

original: de dag ni ngag gi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ngag gi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: They are not by nature speech.

original: ngag gi sgra yin na sgra tsam gyis ni don gang dag go bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gi sgra yin na sgra tsam gyis ni don gang dag go bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If speech is sound, then sound alone does not convey meaning.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ngag ni ming la 'jug la ming gis ni don rjod par byed do //
analyzed: ngag ni ming la 'jug la ming gis ni don rjod par byed do //
translated: Speech engages names, and names express meaning.

original: sgra tsam kho na ni ngag ma yin gyi sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur ba'i sgra de dag yin no //
analyzed: sgra tsam kho na ni ngag ma yin gyi sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur ba'i sgra de dag yin no //
translated: Sound alone is not speech; rather, speech is that sound by which meaning is conveyed.

original: yang sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what sound is meaning conveyed?

original: gang gis smra ba po rnams kyis don dag la mtshams bcad pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis smra ba po rnams kyis don dag la mtshams bcad pa ste /
translated: By that sound by which speakers delimit meaning.

original: dper na goo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na goo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, by the sound go.

original: sgra de ni don dgu dag la mtshams bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra de ni don dgu dag la mtshams bcad pa yin te /
translated: This sound is limited to nine meanings:🔽The wise should understand the word go as🔽having nine meanings: speech, direction,🔽light ray, cattle, eye, diamond,

original: ngag phyogs pa dang 'od zer dang // phyugs dang mig dang rdo rje dang // mtho ris chu dang don dgu la //🔽mkhas pas goo sgra des gzung bya /🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngag phyogs pa dang 'od zer dang // phyugs dang mig dang rdo rje dang // mtho ris chu dang don dgu la // mkhas pas goo sgra des gzung bya / zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: heaven, water, and path.🔽One who thinks that a name expresses a meaning must certainly accept that

original: gang yang ming gis don rjod par byed do snyam du sems pa des kyang gdon mi za bar gal te don go bar byed pa yin zhes @85a * //🔽bya ba 'di khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: gang yang ming gis don rjod par byed do snyam du sems pa des kyang gdon mi za bar gal te don go bar byed pa yin zhes @85a * // bya ba 'di khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: it causes the meaning to be understood.

original: de ni don go bar byed pa'i sgra tsam kho nas 'grub na don gzhan rdzas ming btags te ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de ni don go bar byed pa'i sgra tsam kho nas 'grub na don gzhan rdzas ming btags te ci zhig bya /
translated: If that is accomplished by the mere sound that causes the meaning to be understood, what is the use of positing another object, a substance called a name?

original: ji star  na ngag ming la 'jug pa 'di yang mi shes so //🔽ci re zhig skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: ji star  na ngag ming la 'jug pa 'di yang mi shes so // ci re zhig skyed par byed dam /
translated: We do not understand how speech engages a name.

original: 'on te gsal bar byed /
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar byed /
translated: Does it generate it or does it manifest it?

original: gal te skyed par byed na ni ngag ni sgra'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad kyis ming skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skyed par byed na ni ngag ni sgra'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad kyis ming skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it generates it, then all mere sounds would generate all names, because speech has the nature of sound.

original: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig ming skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de nyid don rjod par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig ming skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de nyid don rjod par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you maintain that such a particular sound generates the name, then that sound itself would express the meaning.

original: 'on te gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na ni ngag gi sgra'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad kyi ming gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na ni ngag gi sgra'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad kyi ming gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you maintain that it manifests the name, then all mere sounds would manifest the name, because speech is by nature sound.

original: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig gsal bar byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de nyid don gsal bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig gsal bar byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de nyid don gsal bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you maintain that such a particular sound manifests the name, then that sound itself would manifest the meaning.

original: yang sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med la chos gcig la cha shas kyi skyed pa yang rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med la chos gcig la cha shas kyi skyed pa yang rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, sounds do not exist as a collection, and it is illogical that a single phenomenon generates a part.

original: skyed par byed pa na ji ltar dag gis ming skyed par byed /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa na ji ltar dag gis ming skyed par byed /
translated: And if it generates, how does it generate the name?

original: re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed /
translated: First, how does the final moment of informative form that relies on the past generate noninformative form?

original: de lta na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas ming skyed pa'i phyir gang gis de gcig kho na thos pa des kyang don go ngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas ming skyed pa'i phyir gang gis de gcig kho na thos pa des kyang don go ngar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then since the last sound alone generates the name, even one who hears that last sound alone would understand the meaning.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du ngag gis ni yi ge skyed par byed la /
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du ngag gis ni yi ge skyed par byed la /
translated: But if you think that speech generates syllables,

original: yi ges ni ming skyed par byed do snyam du rtog par byed na /
analyzed: yi ges ni ming skyed par byed do snyam du rtog par byed na /
translated: and syllables generate names,

original: 'di la yang skyon de nyid yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang skyon de nyid yod de /
translated: then the same error would apply to that.

original: yi ge rnams tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no collection of syllables.

original: ngag ming gsal bar byed pa yin na yang skyon de nyid yod do //
analyzed: ngag ming gsal bar byed pa yin na yang skyon de nyid yod do //
translated: If speech manifests the name, the same error would apply.

original: yi ge yang ngag las khyad par du yod par shes rab dang ldan par yid brtan pas kyang mtshan nyid gyi  sgo nas yongs su bcad par mi nus pas dag ni yi ge skyed par byed pa yin par yang mi rung la /
analyzed: yi ge yang ngag las khyad par du yod par shes rab dang ldan par yid brtan pas kyang mtshan nyid gyi  sgo nas yongs su bcad par mi nus pas dag ni yi ge skyed par byed pa yin par yang mi rung la /
translated: Since even a wise and prudent person cannot ascertain the characteristics of syllables that are distinct from speech, it is not tenable that speech generates syllables,

original: gsal bar byed pa yin par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yin par yang mi rung ngo //

original: 'on te mang don dang lhan cig skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mang don dang lhan cig skyed pa yin te /

original: skye ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de lta na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming da lta ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de lta na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming da lta ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that it is like birth, etc., then the name of a past or future object would not be present.

original: pha rnams kyis bu dag gi ming dga' mgur 'dogs na ming gang zhig de dang lhan cig skyes pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: pha rnams kyis bu dag gi ming dga' mgur 'dogs na ming gang zhig de dang lhan cig skyes pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: When fathers give their children names at will, what name would be innate?

original: chos 'dus ma byas pa rnams kyi ming yang gang dang lhan cig skyes pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos 'dus ma byas pa rnams kyi ming yang gang dang lhan cig skyes pa yin par 'gyur /

original: de lta bas na 'di @85b nyid mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di @85b nyid mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this is not accepted.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis //
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis //
translated: Also, the Blessed One said:

original: tshigs bcad ming la brten pa ste //
analyzed: tshigs bcad ming la brten pa ste //
translated: A verse is based on a name.

original: tshigs bcad bzhi ni snyan dngags mkhan //🔽zhes gsungs pa der yang don rnams la mtshams bcad pa'i sa ni ming yin la /
analyzed: tshigs bcad bzhi ni snyan dngags mkhan // zhes gsungs pa der yang don rnams la mtshams bcad pa'i sa ni ming yin la /
translated: A poet is based on a verse.🔽Here, a name is the basis for the division of the meaning.

original: ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad par yang tshigs su bcad pa yin pas ming la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad par yang tshigs su bcad pa yin pas ming la brten pa yin no //
translated: And a verse is a particular arrangement of names, so it is based on a name.

original: bkod pa'i khyad par yang rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad de phreng ba lta bu dang sems kyi rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bkod pa'i khyad par yang rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad de phreng ba lta bu dang sems kyi rim pa bzhin no //
translated: The difference in arrangement is not tenable as a different substance, like a garland or the order of the mind.

original: yi ge tsam zhig rdzas gzhan gyi dngos por yongs su rtog pa yin du chug na yang de'i tshogs kho na ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yin par 'gyur bas de dag tu rtog don med pa yin no //

translated: Even if you imagine that mere letters are a different substance, then only a collection of those letters would be the collection of names and so on, so it is pointless to imagine them as different.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //

translated: Vaibhasikas say: Since all phenomena are not the domain of sophistry, the collections of names and so on that are by nature nonassociated compositional factors definitely exist as substances.

analyzed: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag ldan pa 'am / sems can du ston pa 'am ;

analyzed: / rgyu mthun las byung lung bstan min // 'di dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa dag yin no //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs med par gtogs ba yang yod mod kyi de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //

analyzed: ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag sems can du ston pa dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag yin ba de bzhin skal mnyam de ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /

original: rnam par smin pa 'ang yin /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'ang yin /
translated: Homogeneity is also karmic maturation.

original: khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa ste /

analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: It exists in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.

analyzed: thab rnam gnyis / thob pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba @86a * //
