analyzed: dang ; rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag yin no // mtshan nyid rnams kyang /
translated: Obtainment is either arisen from natural outflow or arisen from karmic maturation.🔽Characteristics are also twofold.

original: rnam gnyis zhes bya bar sbyar te thob pa bzhin no //🔽snyoms 'jug dang / mi ldan pa dag rgyu mthun pa /
analyzed: rnam gnyis zhes bya bar sbyar te thob pa bzhin no // snyoms 'jug dang / mi ldan pa dag rgyu mthun pa /
translated: Obtainment is like the characteristics.🔽The meditative attainments and nonpossession are natural outflow.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kho na yin no //
translated: The two meditative attainments and nonpossession are only arisen from natural outflow.

original: 'di dag gi brjod par bya ba lhag ma dang / lhag ma 'du shes med pa pa dang / srog gi dbang po dag gis ni bshad zin pas de'i phyir yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi brjod par bya ba lhag ma dang / lhag ma 'du shes med pa pa dang / srog gi dbang po dag gis ni bshad zin pas de'i phyir yang mi brjod do //
translated: The rest of the topics of discussion, namely, the remainder, the state of non-perceptual beings, and the faculty of life force, have already been explained, so they will not be discussed here.

original: ji ltar thob pa rnams kyi sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa rnams kyi sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin ce na /
translated: How is it that possession is said to be only of sentient beings?

original: ldan pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be an endowment.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid rnams sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin par bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid rnams sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin par bshad ce na /
translated: How is it that the characteristics are said to be both sentient and non-sentient?

original: 'dus byas thams cad dang lhan cig 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad dang lhan cig 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they occur together with all conditioned phenomena.🔽The discussion of the non-concurrent formations is now complete.

original: ldan ba ma yin pa rnams bshad zin to //🔽rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni //
analyzed: ldan ba ma yin pa rnams bshad zin to // rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni //
translated: The root text states:

original: skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed min //🔽zhes gang bshad pa /🔽rgyu rnams ni gang ;
analyzed: skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed min // zhes gang bshad pa / rgyu rnams ni gang ;
translated: The arising of an arising does not give rise to that which is to be arisen without causes and conditions.🔽What are the causes?

original: rkyen rnams ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions?

original: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung ba dang // skal mnyam mtshungs par ldan pa dang // kun tu 'gro dang rnam smin dang // rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung ba dang // skal mnyam mtshungs par ldan pa dang // kun tu 'gro dang rnam smin dang // rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
translated: The efficient cause is the six causes.

original: rgyu ni drug po 'di dag ste //
analyzed: rgyu ni drug po 'di dag ste //
translated: The six causes are🔽the efficient cause, the homogeneous cause, the associated cause, the concomitant cause, the universal cause, and the ripening cause.🔽The efficient cause is all phenomena,🔽except for the action itself and its result.

original: byed pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The efficient cause is all phenomena, except for the action itself and its result.

original: de la rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
analyzed: de la rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
translated: The action itself does not act as the efficient cause of itself.🔽The result of the action does not act as the efficient cause of that action.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The result does not act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the action.🔽The action acts as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The result acts as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the result.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni chos 'dus byas kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni chos 'dus byas kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The result does not act as the efficient cause of the action.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the action.

original: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result does not act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The result does not act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the action.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The result does not act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the action.🔽The result does not act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.

original: zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la skye ba de dag shes pa de la mi skye'o zhes gsungs pas de dag skye ba la yang shes pa gegs byed la /
analyzed: zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la skye ba de dag shes pa de la mi skye'o zhes gsungs pas de dag skye ba la yang shes pa gegs byed la /
translated: The result does not act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the action.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The action does not act as the efficient cause of the action.🔽The result does not act as the efficient cause of the result.🔽The other phenomena act as the efficient cause of the other phenomena.🔽The action

original: skar ma rnams mthong ba la yang nyi ma'i 'od bgegs byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skar ma rnams mthong ba la yang nyi ma'i 'od bgegs byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don’t the rays of the sun obstruct the seeing of the stars?

original: ji ltar na rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad chos 'dus byas kyi byed rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad chos 'dus byas kyi byed rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How can all phenomena, with the exception of their own nature, be the active cause of conditioned phenomena?

original: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they exist in the nature of not obstructing arising.

original: re zhig skye ba la bgegs byed nus pa rnams ni bgegs mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig skye ba la bgegs byed nus pa rnams ni bgegs mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Those that are able to obstruct arising become causes because they do not obstruct.

original: dper na spyod par byed pa'i mi 'tshe ba'i dbang du byas nas grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes 'dzer blta bu yin na /
analyzed: dper na spyod par byed pa'i mi 'tshe ba'i dbang du byas nas grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes 'dzer blta bu yin na /
translated: For example, in dependence on the absence of harm by a lord, villagers say, “We are made happy by the lord.”

original: gang @86b zhig bgegs byed par mi nus pa dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos can rnams lta bu dang / gzugs med pa'i sems can gyi phung po skye ba la dmyal ba la sogs pa dag lta bu de go ji ltar na rgyu'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: gang @86b zhig bgegs byed par mi nus pa dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos can rnams lta bu dang / gzugs med pa'i sems can gyi phung po skye ba la dmyal ba la sogs pa dag lta bu de go ji ltar na rgyu'i dngos po yin /
translated: For example, nirvana is not a cause of the arising of all phenomena, and phenomena that are not produced, such as the aggregates of sentient beings in the formless realm, are not causes of the arising of the aggregates of sentient beings in the hells.

original: de dag med du zin kyang de kho na bzhin du bgegs byed mi nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag med du zin kyang de kho na bzhin du bgegs byed mi nus par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they do not exist, they are still not able to obstruct.

original: spyod par byed par mi nus bzhin du yang de skad du 'dzer ba yod pas 'dir dpe ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyod par byed par mi nus bzhin du yang de skad du 'dzer ba yod pas 'dir dpe ni de nyid yin no //
translated: Even though they are not able to obstruct, they are called causes. This is the example.

original: 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a general statement.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu gtso bo gang yin pa 'di ni bskyed par bya ba la yang nus / yod de dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig dang gzugs dag dang / lus la zas dang / myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu gtso bo gang yin pa 'di ni bskyed par bya ba la yang nus / yod de dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig dang gzugs dag dang / lus la zas dang / myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The primary active cause is able to generate its effect, for example, the eye and form are causes of the eye consciousness, food is a cause of the body, and seeds are causes of sprouts and so on.

original: gang zhig 'di skad du gal te mi sgrib pa'i ngo pos chos thams cad rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di skad du gal te mi sgrib pa'i ngo pos chos thams cad rgyu dag yin no //
translated: Someone might argue as follows: If all things are causes by way of the nature of nonobstruction,

original: ci'i phyir chos thams cad cig car skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos thams cad cig car skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: why don’t all things arise simultaneously?🔽And why don’t all sentient beings constantly rely on killing and so on, as do butchers and so on?

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa la yang gshed ma pa bzhin du thams cad de bsten par mi 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed pa de'i de ni klan kar mi rung ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa la yang gshed ma pa bzhin du thams cad de bsten par mi 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed pa de'i de ni klan kar mi rung ste /
translated: This is not a proper objection,

original: 'di ltar mi sgrib pa'i ngo bos chos thams cad rgyu yin par dam 'cha'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi sgrib pa'i ngo bos chos thams cad rgyu yin par dam 'cha'i /
translated: because we maintain that all things are causes by way of the nature of nonobstruction,

original: byed pa po'i ngo bo ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po'i ngo bo ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not by way of the nature of an agent.

original: gzhan dag na re thams cad skyes pa la byed pa'i rgyu thams cad kyang nus pa yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thams cad skyes pa la byed pa'i rgyu thams cad kyang nus pa yod de /
translated: Others say that all causes have the ability to produce all things that have arisen,

original: 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la nus pa yod pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la nus pa yod pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: because even nirvana has the ability to produce eye consciousness.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dmigs pa des yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba skye la /
analyzed: dmigs pa des yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba skye la /
translated: From that object, virtuous and nonvirtuous mental consciousness arises.

original: des rim gyis phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i phyir rgyu rgyud pa'i sgo nas de yang rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir nus pa yod do //
analyzed: des rim gyis phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i phyir rgyu rgyud pa'i sgo nas de yang rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir nus pa yod do //
translated: The eye sense-faculty, in turn, is the cause of the visual consciousness. Thus, the eye sense-faculty is a condition of the visual consciousness, indirectly, as a cause-condition.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The same holds for the other sense-faculties.

original: 'di ni phyogs tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs tsam du zad do //
translated: This is only a brief indication.

original: byed pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //🔽lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu bshad zin to // lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: The efficient cause has been discussed.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig ste /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig ste /
translated: The simultaneous cause is that which is the effect of one another.

original: chos gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: That which is the effect of one another are simultaneous causes of one another.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /🔽'byung bzhin sems kyi rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na / 'byung bzhin sems kyi rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
translated: What are the factors that are the effect of one another?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //🔽sems ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos @87a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no // sems ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos @87a * //
translated: The four great elements are a simultaneous cause of one another.

original: rnams kyi yin la de dag kyang sems kyi yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi yin la de dag kyang sems kyi yin no //
translated: The mind and the factors that are associated with the mind are a simultaneous cause of one another.🔽The characteristics of the conditioned are a simultaneous cause of the factor characterized.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan gzhi'i yin la de yang de dag gi yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan gzhi'i yin la de yang de dag gi yin te /
translated: The characteristics of conditioned states are the characteristics of the characterized.

original: de ltar na 'dus byas thams cad ni ci rigs par lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dus byas thams cad ni ci rigs par lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Thus all conditioned states are coemergent causes in the appropriate manner.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid med bzhin du chos ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la de dag ni de'i ma yin pas kha bskang bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid med bzhin du chos ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la de dag ni de'i ma yin pas kha bskang bar bya'o //
translated: Although phenomena and the characteristics of similar status are not reciprocal results, phenomena are the coemergent causes of the characteristics of similar status, but the characteristics of similar status are not coemergent causes of phenomena.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that are concomitant with the mind?🔽The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:🔽The mind and its concomitant states, the two types of vows,

original: sems las byung dang sdom gnyis dang // sems dang de dag gi mtshan nyid //
analyzed: sems las byung dang sdom gnyis dang // sems dang de dag gi mtshan nyid //
translated: and the characteristics of the mind and its concomitant states.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang // sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang / de dag dang sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i chos de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang // sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang / de dag dang sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i chos de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those phenomena that are concomitant with the mind, all those that are associated with the mind, the meditative discipline, the undefiling discipline, and those that arise together with the mind, etc., are called “concomitant with the mind.”

original: de dag ji ltar sems kyi rjes su 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar sems kyi rjes su 'jug ce na /
translated: How are they concomitant with the mind?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: dus dang ni /
analyzed: dus dang ni /
translated: by time,

original: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
translated: by result, etc., by virtue, etc.

original: re zhig dus las ni sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: re zhig dus las ni sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: First, by time: they are born, abide, and perish together with the mind, and they belong to the same time period.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pas ni 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang ; rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pas ni 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang ; rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis te /
translated: By result, etc.: they have the same result, the same ripening, and the same natural outcome.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The former term “same” should be understood to mean “together.”

original: dge ba la sogs pas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la /
translated: The wholesome, etc., are the homogeneous causes of the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral minds.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral minds are the homogeneous causes of the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral minds.

original: de ltar na rgyu bcus sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu bcus sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the mind and mental factors are called “concomitant” because of these ten causes.

original: de la sems nang na nyung ba ni chos lnga bcu rtsa brgyad kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la sems nang na nyung ba ni chos lnga bcu rtsa brgyad kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Among the minds, the smallest number of dharmas is the homogeneous cause of a small mind, namely, fifty-eight dharmas.

original: sa mang po pa bcu dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid bzhi bcu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad kyi yin no //
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid bzhi bcu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad kyi yin no //
translated: Ten universal mental factors, forty characteristics of the primary and secondary characteristics of the four aggregates that are associated with the mind, and the eight characteristics of the primary and secondary characteristics of these mental factors.

original: de'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: The homogeneous cause of this small mind is fifty-four dharmas.

original: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: The eight characteristics of the primary and secondary characteristics of the mental factors are excluded.

original: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi yin te /
translated: Others say that it is fourteen dharmas,

original: sa mang po pa bcu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dag kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dag kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: namely, the ten universal mental factors and the four characteristics.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod de //
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod de //
translated: But this is not the correct explanation.

original: de ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung /
analyzed: de ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung /
translated: Thus it would contradict the treatise topic divisions, which states:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden @87b pa la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden @87b pa la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self but is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is the afflicted truth of suffering that is other than those states that are the generation, aging, duration and impermanence of the afflicted view of the self and the phenomena that are concomitant with it.

original: /'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu yang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu yang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is caused by the afflicted view of the self and is also a cause of the afflicted view of the self is that which is not excluded.

original: kha che ba rnams na re'o na ni gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don pa de dag gis kyang de skad du gdon par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re'o na ni gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don pa de dag gis kyang de skad du gdon par bya ba 'am /
translated: Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say: Well then, those who do not recite the passage that states, the phenomena that are concomitant with it, should recite it.

original: yang na don gyis de ltar go bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na don gyis de ltar go bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Or else, the meaning is that they are understood to be so.

original: re zhig gang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa des ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa des ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no //
translated: First, that which is a cause as co-existent cause is also co-existent.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba yin la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba yin la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.

original: chos kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / de dag phan tshun dang / sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams nyid dang / de dag phan tshun dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa phan tshun dang / thogs pa med pa cung zad dang /🔽thams cad 'byung ba dag dang lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / de dag phan tshun dang / sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams nyid dang / de dag phan tshun dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa phan tshun dang / thogs pa med pa cung zad dang / thams cad 'byung ba dag dang lta bu'o //
translated: The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.

original: thob pa dang ldan pa'i thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang lhan cig 'byung ba yin la lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thob pa dang ldan pa'i thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang lhan cig 'byung ba yin la lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent cause.🔽The characteristics of the primary elements are co-existent but not a cause as co-existent

original: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect, the ripening, and the natural outcome are not the same.

original: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig spyod pa'i dang tshul can yang ma yin te sngar yang skye la phyis kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig spyod pa'i dang tshul can yang ma yin te sngar yang skye la phyis kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not concomitant with the mind, because they arise before and after the mind.

original: de thams cad kyang rung mod kyi 'on kyang sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grags pa rnams la tshul 'di mi snang bas ji ltar lhan cig 'byung pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang rung mod kyi 'on kyang sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grags pa rnams la tshul 'di mi snang bas ji ltar lhan cig 'byung pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de brjod par bya'o //
translated: All of this is acceptable, but since this mode of causality is not seen in the case of such things as seeds, it must be explained how co-existent factors can be cause and effect.

original: dper na mar me dang 'od dag dang myu gu dang grib ma dag lta bu yin no //🔽re zhig ci mar me 'od kyi rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: dper na mar me dang 'od dag dang myu gu dang grib ma dag lta bu yin no // re zhig ci mar me 'od kyi rgyu yin nam /
translated: For example, like the flame and the light, or like the sprout and its shadow.🔽First of all, is the flame the cause of the light?

original: 'on te tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho na mar me 'od dang bcas pa skye ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho na mar me 'od dang bcas pa skye ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Or is the cause of the flame and the light the prior collection of causes?

original: 'o na ni yod dam med na de dag dang lhan cig de'i phyir rgyu smra ba rnams rgyu dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni de yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni yod dam med na de dag dang lhan cig de'i phyir rgyu smra ba rnams rgyu dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni de yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: If you say that they exist or do not exist together, then the proponents of causes would say that the definition of a cause that possesses a cause is that.

original: gang zhig yod dam med na gang zhig nges par yod dam med pa de ni rgyu yin zhing cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig yod dam med na gang zhig nges par yod dam med pa de ni rgyu yin zhing cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: That which definitely exists or does not exist when something exists or does not exist is its cause and the other is that which possesses a cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung pa'i chos rnams @88a * //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung pa'i chos rnams @88a * //
translated: Coemergent phenomena

original: kyang gcig yod na thams cad yod la gcig med na thams cad med pas rgyu de dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: kyang gcig yod na thams cad yod la gcig med na thams cad med pas rgyu de dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rigs pa yin no //
translated: are also a cause and effect because if one exists, all exist and if one does not exist, all do not exist.

original: re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rung na phan tshun du go ji ltar rung /
analyzed: re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rung na phan tshun du go ji ltar rung /
translated: If coemergent phenomena are suitable to be cause and effect, how could they be mutually cause and effect?

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of that.

original: de lta na 'o na ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med na mi 'byung ba phan tshun dang 'byung ba rnams dang yang lhan cig der thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med na mi 'byung ba phan tshun dang 'byung ba rnams dang yang lhan cig der thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then primary elements that do not arise without derivative form would be mutually cause and effect and coemergent cause and effect with derivative form.

original: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa yang sems la sogs pa dang nger thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa yang sems la sogs pa dang nger thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics of the mind, etc., would also be the mind, etc.🔽But, in the same way that three sticks placed together stand by the force they borrow from one another, coexistent factors are established as cause and effect.🔽We must examine whether these factors stand by the force of co-existence,🔽or whether they occur in this way by the power of a previous complex.🔽In the first case, there is no doubt that the factors stand by the force of co-existence.

original: 'o na ni myu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub bo //🔽re zhig ci 'di dag lhan cig 'byung ba'i stobs kyis gnas sam /
analyzed: 'o na ni myu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub bo // re zhig ci 'di dag lhan cig 'byung ba'i stobs kyis gnas sam /
translated: In the second case, the factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of co-existence.🔽The first complex stands by the force of co-existence.🔽The factors stand by the force of co-existence.

original: 'on te tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis de ltar 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya'o //🔽de la gzhan yang srad bu 'am gzer bu 'am rten par byed pas yang cung zad yod do //
analyzed: 'on te tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis de ltar 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya'o // de la gzhan yang srad bu 'am gzer bu 'am rten par byed pas yang cung zad yod do //

analyzed: de la yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid grub bo // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.🔽The factors stand by the force of a previous complex.

original: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: The previous complex stands by the force of a previous complex.🔽The previous complex

original: chos 'dra ba rnams ni chos 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chos 'dra ba rnams ni chos 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Phenomena similar to those that are homogeneous causes are homogeneous causes of phenomena similar to them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dge ba'i phung po lnga po dag ni phan tshun dge ba rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i phung po lnga po dag ni phan tshun dge ba rnams kyi yin no //
translated: the five virtuous aggregates are homogeneous causes of the five virtuous aggregates.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The five afflicted aggregates are homogeneous causes of the five afflicted aggregates.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The five neutral aggregates are homogeneous causes of the five neutral aggregates.

original: gzhan dag na re lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs ni lnga po dag gi yin la /🔽bzhi ni gzugs kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs ni lnga po dag gi yin la / bzhi ni gzugs kyi ma yin te /
translated: Others say: Unmanifest form is a homogeneous cause of the five aggregates.

original: dman pa dang stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dman pa dang stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The four formless aggregates are not a homogeneous cause of form because they are inferior and weak.🔽The stage of kalala is a homogeneous cause of the ten stages.

original: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin no //
analyzed: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin no //
translated: The stage of abhisaṃskaraṇa is a homogeneous cause of the nine stages.🔽The stage of birth is a homogeneous cause of the eight stages.🔽The stage of childhood is a homogeneous cause of the seven stages.🔽The stage of youth is a homogeneous cause of the six stages.🔽The stage of middle age is a homogeneous cause of the five stages.🔽The stage of old age is a homogeneous cause of the four stages.🔽The stage of extreme old age is a homogeneous cause of the three stages.🔽The stage of death is a homogeneous cause of the two stages.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa ni ris mthun pa gcig la re re phri nas mer mer po la sogs pa'i yin no //🔽rnam pa mthun pa gzhan dag tu ni gnas skabs bcu char yang bcu po dag gi yin no //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa ni ris mthun pa gcig la re re phri nas mer mer po la sogs pa'i yin no //🔽rnam pa mthun pa gzhan dag tu ni gnas skabs bcu char yang bcu po dag gi yin no //
translated: The stage of the intermediate existence is a homogeneous cause of the one stage of the intermediate existence.

original: phyi'i dag la yang nas ni nas kyi yin la /
analyzed: phyi'i dag la yang nas ni nas kyi yin la /
translated: Also, in terms of external seeds, barley arises from barley,🔽

original: s'a lu ni s'a lu'i yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: s'a lu ni s'a lu'i yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The external is also like this: barley is the homogeneous cause of barley, rice of rice.🔽Those who do not accept that form is a homogeneous cause of form🔽are contradicted by the treatise passage that states:

original: gang dag gzugs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gzugs yin par mi 'dod pa de dag la ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung @88b ba chen po rnams kyi rgyu dang bdag po yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di 'dod pa la🔽gnod par gnas so //
analyzed: gang dag gzugs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gzugs yin par mi 'dod pa de dag la ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung @88b ba chen po rnams kyi rgyu dang bdag po yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di 'dod pa la gnod par gnas so //
translated: Past primary elements are the cause and the dominant condition of future primary elements.

original: ci 'dra ba thams cad 'ang ba thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba thams cad 'ang ba thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all similar states homogeneous causes of all similar states?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽rang ris sa pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / rang ris sa pa'o //
translated: What is the meaning of similar?🔽They are similar in type and level.

original: 'di dag la rang gi ris dang sa yod pas 'di dag ni rang gi ris dang sa pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag la rang gi ris dang sa yod pas 'di dag ni rang gi ris dang sa pa dag go //
translated: They are similar in type and level.

original: ris ni lnga ste /
analyzed: ris ni lnga ste /
translated: Type is of five types:

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang par bya pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang par bya pa'i bar ro //
translated: to be abandoned by the path of seeing suffering, to be abandoned by the path of seeing origin, to be abandoned by the path of seeing cessation, to be abandoned by the path of seeing the path, and to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: sa ni dgu ste /
translated: Level is of nine levels:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad do //
translated: The realms are the desire realm, the four meditations and the four formless realms.

original: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang par bya ba rnams ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spar par bya ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang par bya ba rnams ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spar par bya ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: The factors to be abandoned by insight into the truth of suffering are homogeneous causes of those factors to be abandoned by insight into the truth of suffering, but not of other factors.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi yin no //
translated: In the same way, those to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are homogeneous causes of those to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de dag kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni yang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni yang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi yin la /
translated: Those of the desire realm are homogeneous causes of those of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i yin pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i par dag kyang de'i sa pa'i rnams kho na'i yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i yin pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i par dag kyang de'i sa pa'i rnams kho na'i yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Those of the first meditation are homogeneous causes of those of the first meditation, and so on up to: those of the summit of cyclic existence are homogeneous causes of those of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: But not all of them are homogeneous causes of all.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression sabhāgahetu?

original: sngar skyes pa rnams ni phyi ma skye ba dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa rnams ni phyi ma skye ba dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Those already arisen are homogeneous causes of those arisen and of those not yet arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa khon skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag las smras pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa khon skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag las smras pa /
translated: But future factors are not a homogeneous cause.

original: bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las te /
translated: This is stated in the treatise.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is a homogeneous cause?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar byung ba rnams ni rang gi khams na dge ba'i rtsa ba phyis 'byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar byung ba rnams ni rang gi khams na dge ba'i rtsa ba phyis 'byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu yin no //
translated: The wholesome roots that have previously arisen are the homogeneous cause of the wholesome roots that will arise later in the same realm, and of the factors associated with them.

original: de ltar na 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Thus they are of those of the past and present.🔽But those of the past and present are of those of the future.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is how it should be stated.

original: chos gang chos gang gi rgyu'i yin pa'i chos de res 'ga' zhig chos de'i rgyu ma yin pa yin nam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: chos gang chos gang gi rgyu'i yin pa'i chos de res 'ga' zhig chos de'i rgyu ma yin pa yin nam zhe na smras pa /
translated: Is it possible that a phenomenon which is the cause of a certain phenomenon is not sometimes the cause of that phenomenon?

original: nam yang ma yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di yang bstan bcos yin no //
analyzed: nam yang ma yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di yang bstan bcos yin no //
translated: It is said, “It is never not a cause.” This is also a treatise.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir de ni nyes pa med @89a * //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir de ni nyes pa med @89a * //
translated: There is no fault in this statement, because it is stated with the intention of the coemergent cause, the concomitant cause, and the cause of karmic maturation.

original: do ; / gang zhig chos ma 'ongs pa de yang skye pa'i tshe'i gnas skabs na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: do ; / gang zhig chos ma 'ongs pa de yang skye pa'i tshe'i gnas skabs na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Also, that future phenomenon is definitely an homogeneous cause at the time of its arising.

original: de'i phyir tha ma'i gnas skabs de las dgongs nas nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so snyam du sems pa de ni de'i lan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha ma'i gnas skabs de las dgongs nas nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so snyam du sems pa de ni de'i lan du mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is stated, “It is never not a cause” with the final state in mind.

original: 'di ltar chos de skye pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol nas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las phyis yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de skye pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol nas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las phyis yin pas so //
translated: That is not a suitable response because that phenomenon is not a homogeneous cause prior to the time of its arising, but it is a homogeneous cause after that.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yin pa'i chos de res 'ga' zhig chos de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba 'dri ba 'di yang yongs su rtogs pa 'dis res 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes brjod par
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yin pa'i chos de res 'ga' zhig chos de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba 'dri ba 'di yang yongs su rtogs pa 'dis res 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes brjod par
translated: Is it possible to answer this question by this understanding, namely, that sometimes it is not?

original: nus na ci'i phyir 'di skad du gal te chos de ma skyes par gyur na'o zhes gsungs /🔽der ji lta ba de bzhin 'dir yang brjod par bya la /
analyzed: nus na ci'i phyir 'di skad du gal te chos de ma skyes par gyur na'o zhes gsungs / der ji lta ba de bzhin 'dir yang brjod par bya la /
translated: If it is possible, why did the Lord say, “If that dharma had not arisen”?🔽Just as it is there, so it should be stated here.

original: 'dir ji lta ba de bzhin der yang brjod par bya'o zhes sgo gnyis su bstan par bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'dir ji lta ba de bzhin der yang brjod par bya'o zhes sgo gnyis su bstan par bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: Just as it is here, so it should be stated there.

original: de lta yin na yon tan ci zhig 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yon tan ci zhig 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, what good quality is obtained?

original: de lta na 'dir bstan bcos byed pa mi mkhas pa kho nar yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'dir bstan bcos byed pa mi mkhas pa kho nar yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be believed that the author of the treatise is simply unskilled.

original: de lta bas na 'dir lan snga ma kho na legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir lan snga ma kho na legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the former answer is better here.

original: 'o na gang 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gang 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni yin la /
translated: The other truth of suffering that is not the future afflicted view of the self and not the truth of suffering that is concomitant with it arises from the cause of the afflicted view of the self,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: That which is not excluded arises from the cause of the afflicted view of the self and is the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa zhes brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa zhes brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: This should be stated as: The other truth of suffering that is not the future afflicted view of the self and not the truth of suffering that is concomitant with it.

original: yang na don gyis na de ltar go par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na don gyis na de ltar go par bya'o //
translated: Or it should be understood in this way by implication.

original: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa chos thams cad ni bzhi chen du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa chos thams cad ni bzhi chen du nges pa yin te /
translated: But if that is so, then why does the commentary to the Abhidharmakośa state: All phenomena are ascertained as being included in four great categories?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / rten dang dmigs par nges so zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar dang / 'dir rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / rten dang dmigs par nges so zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar dang / 'dir rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is the associated cause and the co-existent cause.

original: 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag @89b po'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag @89b po'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The effect is the effect of human action and the effect of dominance.

original: rten ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The support is the eye, etc.

original: dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The object is form, etc.

original: de lta na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las rgyu yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las rgyu yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If this is the case, then would not that which is not a homogeneous cause become a homogeneous cause?

original: gnas skabs ni 'dod pa kho na yin gyi rdzas la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs ni 'dod pa kho na yin gyi rdzas la ni ma yin te /
translated: The state is accepted, not the substance.

original: tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can yin gyi /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can yin gyi /
translated: The collection has a state as its effect,

original: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not have a substance as its effect.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang ma 'ongs pa yin na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang ma 'ongs pa yin na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the homogeneous cause were future, like the cause of karmic maturation, what would result?

original: bstan bcos las de smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las de smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would have been mentioned in the treatise.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin par byed nus pa gang yin pa de kho na smos pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin par byed nus pa gang yin pa de kho na smos pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: There is no error, because only those that are able to project and to hold the effect are mentioned.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na de yang ma 'ongs pa la rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na de yang ma 'ongs pa la rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because a homogeneous cause is endowed with an effect that is an effect of natural outflow, and that is illogical for future states,

original: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no earlier or later.

original: byung zin pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun par mi rung ste /
analyzed: byung zin pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun par mi rung ste /
translated: Also, it is illogical for that which has already arisen to be the homogeneous cause of a future state,

original: dper na da lta'i 'das pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na da lta'i 'das pa bzhin no //
translated: because it would be like the present and past.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu nga na mi rung bas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu nga na mi rung bas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
translated: Since it is illogical for the effect to precede the cause, a future homogeneous cause does not exist.

original: de lta na rnams par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma 'ongs pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na rnams par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma 'ongs pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, a future state would not be a cause of karmic maturation,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu snga ba dang lhan cig pa mi rung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu snga ba dang lhan cig pa mi rung ba'i phyir la /
translated: because it is illogical for the effect of karmic maturation to be either earlier or simultaneous.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la yang snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la yang snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the future does not have earlier and later parts.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni snga phyi med par 'dra ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'dra ba yin bas phan tshun du rgyur gyur pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni snga phyi med par 'dra ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'dra ba yin bas phan tshun du rgyur gyur pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: because homogeneous causes are similar homogeneous causes that are not earlier or later. Therefore, they are reciprocal causes. It follows that they are reciprocal results,

original: phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid du ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid du ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not logical that they are reciprocal results.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni snga phyi med bzhin du yang de ltar phun tshun 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni snga phyi med bzhin du yang de ltar phun tshun 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Although the cause of karmic maturation does not have earlier and later parts, it does not follow that they are reciprocal results.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir do  //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir do  //
translated: Because the cause and result are different in their characteristics.

original: de lta bas na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni gnas skabs las rnam par gnas pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni gnas skabs las rnam par gnas pa kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, homogeneous causes are only distinguished by their states.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mtshan nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi bzlog go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mtshan nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi bzlog go //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is distinguished by its characteristics. Therefore, it is not refuted that it is future.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi sa pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ci de ltar nges sam zhe na /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi sa pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ci de ltar nges sam zhe na /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: The homogeneous cause consists of factors of a given stage.

original: de zag pa dang bcas pa la ni nges so //
analyzed: de zag pa dang bcas pa la ni nges so //
translated: But this is not certain, for the homogeneous cause can also be impure factors of a different stage.

original: sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du //🔽skal ba mnyam @90a * //
analyzed: sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du // skal ba mnyam @90a * //
translated: The path of the nine stages is the homogeneous cause of the path.🔽The path of the nine stages is the homogeneous cause of the path of the same stage.

original: pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yin no // zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The path of the stage of the preliminary concentration is the homogeneous cause of the path of the same stage.🔽The path of the fourth meditation is the homogeneous cause of the path of the fourth meditation.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum dag gi lam gyi bden pa ni phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum dag gi lam gyi bden pa ni phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The path of the sphere of nothingness is the homogeneous cause of the path of the sphere of nothingness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: This path is adventitious to these stages.

original: sa de pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir khams de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin te /🔽de bas na sa gzhan pa'i rigs mthun pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: sa de pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir khams de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin te / de bas na sa gzhan pa'i rigs mthun pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: It is not included in the realms, for the beings of these stages do not appropriate it as theirs.🔽Thus it is the homogeneous cause of the same class of stage, but of another stage.

original: de yang / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
analyzed: de yang / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
translated: It is also the homogeneous cause of the path of a higher stage.

original: chung ngu'i rgyu ni ma yin te //
analyzed: chung ngu'i rgyu ni ma yin te //
translated: The weak path is not the cause of the strong path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In fact:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de nyid ma 'ongs pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i khyad par can gyi rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de nyid ma 'ongs pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i khyad par can gyi rgyu yang yin no //
translated: The receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness is the cause of future receptivity and of the special cognition of nonarising.

original: mi skye ba shes pa ni khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa ni khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa kho na'i yin no //
translated: The cognition of nonarising is the cause of the cognition of nonarising alone, for there is no other special path.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams ni gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams ni gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi yin no //
translated: The paths of insight, cultivation and of those beyond training are, respectively, the cause of three, two and one paths.

original: de la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam ni dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i lam gyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam ni dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i lam gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: In this regard, the path of weak faculties is the cause of the path of weak and sharp faculties.

original: dbang po rnon po'i lam ni dbang po rnon po'i lam kho na yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i lam ni dbang po rnon po'i lam kho na yin te /
translated: The path of sharp faculties is the cause of the path of sharp faculties alone.

original: 'di lta ste dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni drug dang bzhi dang gnyis dag gi yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni drug dang bzhi dang gnyis dag gi yin no //
translated: In fact, the paths of the pursuer through faith, the pursuer through conviction, and the one liberated through circumstances are, respectively, the cause of six, four and two paths.

original: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dang mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol pa'i lam rnams ni gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi yin no //
analyzed: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dang mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol pa'i lam rnams ni gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi yin no //
translated: The path of seeing, the path of cultivation and the path of those beyond training are, respectively, the homogeneous causes of three, two and one path.

original: yang ji ltar sa gong ma pas 'og ma pa'i lam dang mnyam ba'am khyad par can yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa gong ma pas 'og ma pa'i lam dang mnyam ba'am khyad par can yin zhe na /
translated: How can the higher path be equal or superior to the lower path?

original: dbang po dang rgyus rgyas par byas pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: dbang po dang rgyus rgyas par byas pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: By reason of the faculties and the cause which perfects it.

original: de la rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa ni mthong pa'i lam la sogs pa dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa gong nas gong du'o //
analyzed: de la rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa ni mthong pa'i lam la sogs pa dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa gong nas gong du'o //
translated: The path of seeing, etc., and the weak-weak path, etc., are perfected by a cause which perfects it.

original: rgyud gcig la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dag mi srid mod kyi 'byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyud gcig la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dag mi srid mod kyi 'byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Although the path of those who are convinced through faith and the path of those who are convinced through doctrines cannot coexist in the same stream, they are, nevertheless, the homogeneous cause of each other.

original: ci lam kho na mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci lam kho na mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na smras pa ma yin te /
translated: Is the path alone a homogeneous cause according to the principle of equality or superiority?

original: 'jig rten pa dag kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag kyang /
translated: The mundane path is also a homogeneous cause.

original: sbyor byung de gnyis kho na'i yin //
analyzed: sbyor byung de gnyis kho na'i yin //
translated: They are the homogeneous cause of these two, of the first two.

original: mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi dman pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi dman pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: They are the homogeneous cause of the qualities arisen from the preparatory causes, of the first two of the qualities arisen from hearing, etc.

original: dper ji lta bu zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: dper ji lta bu zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is the example?

original: thos dang bsams byung la sogs @90b pa'ang ;
analyzed: thos dang bsams byung la sogs @90b pa'ang ;
translated: The qualities arisen from hearing, etc.

original: / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba sbyor ba las 'byung ba'i yon tan de dag kyang nyams pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i rgyu yin gyi dman pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /🔽'di lta ste /🔽'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba rnams ni thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin no //🔽bsam pa las byung ba rnams ni bsams pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba sbyor ba las 'byung ba'i yon tan de dag kyang nyams pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i rgyu yin gyi dman pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te / 'di lta ste / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba rnams ni thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin no // bsam pa las byung ba rnams ni bsams pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin te /
translated: are the homogeneous cause of the qualities arisen from hearing, etc., of the first two of the qualities arisen from hearing, reflection and meditation.🔽The qualities arisen from hearing are the homogeneous cause of the qualities arisen from hearing and reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities arisen from reflection are the homogeneous cause of the qualities arisen from reflection, because there are no qualities arisen from meditation in the realm of desire.🔽The qualities arisen from meditation are the homogeneous cause of the qualities arisen from meditation.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba rnams ni thos pa las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin te /🔽bsams pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba rnams ni thos pa las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin te / bsams pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those derived from meditation in the form realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the form realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams ni bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams kho na'i yin no //🔽de dag kyang rnam pa dgu tha dad pa'i phyir chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni thams cad kyi yin la /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams ni bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams kho na'i yin no // de dag kyang rnam pa dgu tha dad pa'i phyir chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni thams cad kyi yin la /
translated: Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring po dag ni brgyad kyi yin te /🔽lugs ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring po dag ni brgyad kyi yin te / lugs ni de lta bu'o //
translated: Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.

original: skyes nas thob pa can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //🔽ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te / nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o // ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the form realm.🔽Those derived from meditation in the formless realm are the homogeneous causes of those derived from meditation in the formless realm.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa 'am /
translated: Those derived from meditation in the formless realm

original: bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems lhan cig skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems lhan cig skyes pa rnams te /
translated: the mind governing creative expression, and the innate mind of creation.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du bzhi dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du bzhi dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: They are, respectively, homogeneous causes of four, three, two, and one.

original: sprul pa'i sems bsam gtan bzhi'i 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems bsam gtan bzhi'i 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yin te /
translated: The mind of creation is also the result of the desire realm and the four absorptions.

original: de la bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: The result of a higher absorption is not the result of a lower absorption.

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu ni dman pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu ni dman pa ma yin te /
translated: The result of a homogeneous cause that is a compositional factor is not inferior, because it would then follow that effort would be fruitless.

original: dper na s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa'i lta bu'o //
translated: For example, rice and barley are not inferior results.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zag pa med pa skyes pa zag pa med pa ma skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhe na yod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zag pa med pa skyes pa zag pa med pa ma skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhe na yod de /
translated: Therefore, is there an unarisen uncontaminated state that is not the result of an arisen uncontaminated state?🔽Yes, there is.

original: dper na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu dang / khyad par can thams cad dman pa'i lta bu'o //🔽rgyu gcig la nges pa'i zag pa med pa'i @91a * //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu dang / khyad par can thams cad dman pa'i lta bu'o // rgyu gcig la nges pa'i zag pa med pa'i @91a * //
translated: Or, for example, all special states are like inferior states.

original: chos sngon thob pa phyis skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: chos sngon thob pa phyis skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do any uncontaminated states that are ascertained to be the same cause not exist as the cause of those that arise later?

original: yod de sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa dag sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i lta bu'o //🔽'di ltar 'bras bu snga ma 'am /
analyzed: yod de sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa dag sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i lta bu'o // 'di ltar 'bras bu snga ma 'am /
translated: Yes, future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is not a cause of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
translated: In this way, future states that are homogeneous causes of prior results do not exist.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams zag pa med pa'i chos phyis skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhe na yod de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams zag pa med pa'i chos phyis skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhe na yod de /
translated: Do any previously arisen uncontaminated states not exist as the cause of later arisen uncontaminated states?

original: chen po chung ngu'i lta bu ste /
analyzed: chen po chung ngu'i lta bu ste /
translated: Yes, for example, greater states are not the cause of smaller states.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'bras bu gor ma las yongs su nyams pa 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa skad cig ma phyi ma dang lhan cig skyes pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa rnams kyi lta bu🔽ste / dman pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu gor ma las yongs su nyams pa 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa skad cig ma phyi ma dang lhan cig skyes pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa rnams kyi lta bu ste / dman pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Obtainment of the lower result is similar to that.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: Homogeneous cause has been explained.

original: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung /
analyzed: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung /
translated: Concomitant cause is minds and mental factors.

original: de lta na ni dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams phan tshun du mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams phan tshun du mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that those generated from different times and different realms would be concomitant causes of each other.

original: 'o na ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig la dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig la dag pa yin no //
translated: They are concomitant causes of those that are similar in aspect and focal object.

original: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that they would be concomitant causes of those that are similar in aspect and focal object.

original: 'o na ni dus gcig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni dus gcig pa dag yin no //
translated: They are concomitant causes of those that are similar in time.

original: de lta na zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la lta ba'i lta bur rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la lta ba'i lta bur rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that those that arise from different continua, such as the eye that sees the crescent moon, would also be concomitant.

original: de lta bas na rten mtshungs pa can rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rten mtshungs pa can rnams so //
translated: Therefore, they are concomitant with those that have a similar basis.

original: gang dag la rten mtshungs pa yod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni phan tshun du mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
