analyzed: gang dag la rten mtshungs pa yod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni phan tshun du mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Those minds and mental factors that have a similar basis are mutually concomitant causes.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: Similar means undifferentiated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: the eye sense faculty that is the basis of eye consciousness is also the basis of those concomitant with it, such as feeling.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yid kyi skad cig ma yin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yid kyi skad cig ma yin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the mind faculty that is the basis of mental consciousness and those concomitant with it.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: The co-existent cause is also a associated cause.

original: yang don gang gis na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: yang don gang gis na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin /
translated: But what is the meaning of co-existent cause?

original: gang gis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of associated cause?

original: phan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The meaning of mutual effect is the meaning of co-existent cause.

original: @91b 'dron pa rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: @91b 'dron pa rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Like travelers who travel together by the strength of each other.

original: mtshungs pa lngas mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa lngas mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The meaning of association by the five similarities is the meaning of associated cause.

original: 'dron pa de dag nyid zas la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dron pa de dag nyid zas la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: Like those travelers who are engaged in the same activities, such as eating.

original: gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par mi ldan pas 'di ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par mi ldan pas 'di ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Since they are not associated if even one is missing, this is the nature of their cause.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pervasive cause?

original: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //
translated: The pervasive cause is a defiled factor.

original: rnams kyi rang sar kun 'gro lnga //🔽rang gis pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos /
analyzed: rnams kyi rang sar kun 'gro lnga // rang gis pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos /
translated: The five pervasive factors are the pervasive causes of defiled factors of their own stage.

original: phyi ma rnams kyi kun tu 'gro pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams kyi kun tu 'gro pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The defiled factors arisen previously are the pervasive causes of the defiled factors arisen later.

original: de dag kyang 'og nas phra rgyas bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas nyid nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'og nas phra rgyas bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas nyid nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: These will be explained below in the chapter on the proclivities.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin bas na skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par gzhan go //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin bas na skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par gzhan go //
translated: They are distinguished from homogeneous causes because they are the common cause of defiled factors.

original: ris gzhan dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ris gzhan dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are the cause of other classes as well,

original: de dag gi mthus ni ris gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mthus ni ris gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for, by their power, the defilements of other classes also arise.

original: ci 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba dag yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba dag yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do the defiled factors of a noble one also arise from a pervasive cause?

original: kha che ba rnams na re nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba dag yin te /🔽'di ltar rab tu byed pa dag las mthong bas spang par bya pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba dag yin te / 'di ltar rab tu byed pa dag las mthong bas spang par bya pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: Kasmiri Vaibhasikas say: All afflicted phenomena arise from causes abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽Thus the Prakaraṇa states:🔽What phenomena arise from causes abandoned by the path of seeing?🔽They are afflicted phenomena and the karmic maturation of phenomena abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What phenomena arise from neutral causes?🔽They are neutral conditioned phenomena and nonvirtuous phenomena.🔽What phenomena are caused by the afflicted view of the self?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu can yin pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i rgyu can yin pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang /
translated: What phenomena are not caused by the afflicted view of the self?

original: chos de dag gi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes zer ro //🔽'o na btags pa'i bshad pa mi dge ba'i chos mi dge ba'i rgyu can kho @92a * //
analyzed: chos de dag gi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes zer ro // 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa mi dge ba'i chos mi dge ba'i rgyu can kho @92a * //
translated: and the arising, aging, enduring and impermanence of those phenomena are the afflicted truth of suffering that is other than those phenomena.🔽If that is so, then how do you interpret the Subcommentary, which states:

original: na yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: na yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there an unvirtuous phenomenon that is a cause of unvirtuous phenomena alone?

original: yod de / 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa de las dang por nyon mongs pa can gyi sems pa mngon du byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: yod de / 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa de las dang por nyon mongs pa can gyi sems pa mngon du byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: Yes, for example, when a virtuous person regresses from freedom from attachment to the desire realm, the afflicted volition that is manifest for the first time.

original: de ni rgyu ma spangs pa las dgongs nas gsungs pa yin gyi de'i rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni spangs zin pa'i phyir ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni rgyu ma spangs pa las dgongs nas gsungs pa yin gyi de'i rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni spangs zin pa'i phyir ma gsungs so //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of not abandoning the cause, but the cause that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is not mentioned because it has already been abandoned.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu bshang zin to //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu bshang zin to //
translated: The omnipresent cause has already been explained.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /🔽rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na / rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
translated: What is the ripening cause?🔽The ripening cause consists of unfavorable actions and favorable contaminated actions.

original: mi dge pa rnams dang / dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: mi dge pa rnams dang / dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Unfavorable actions and favorable contaminated actions are the ripening cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the ripening cause because they are the factors that have the nature of ripening.

original: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa 'grub par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa 'grub par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why do neutral factors not produce a ripening?

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir te sa bon rul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs chung ba'i phyir te sa bon rul pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are weak, like rotten seeds.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the uncontaminated factors not a ripening cause?

original: sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not moistened by craving.

original: mngon par ma brlan pa'i sa bon grung po bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par ma brlan pa'i sa bon grung po bzhin no //
translated: They are like dry seeds.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams gang dang ldan pa'i rnam par smin pa zhig mngon par 'grub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams gang dang ldan pa'i rnam par smin pa zhig mngon par 'grub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: What is the ripening of the non-associated compositional factors?

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir 'grub par byed de sa bon grung po mngon par brlan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir 'grub par byed de sa bon grung po mngon par brlan pa bzhin te /
translated: The remaining causes are causes that are both, like a moist seed that is not damaged.

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: How is this known?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhig rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhig rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: Is the cause of karmic maturation a cause that is karmic maturation?

original: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin /
translated: Or is it a cause that is karmic maturation because it is karmic maturation itself?

original: des na cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur /
translated: What is wrong with these?

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhig rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin na ni mig gi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhig rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin na ni mig gi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation is a cause that is karmic maturation, then it would not be said that the eye is derived from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las las skyes pa'i phyir la las kyang rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i phyir la las kyang rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from karma and karma is not by nature karmic maturation.

original: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin na ni las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin na ni las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation is a cause that is karmic maturation because it is karmic maturation itself, then it would not be said that it is the karmic maturation of karma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir la rnam par smin pa yang las kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir la rnam par smin pa yang las kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is the ripening, and the ripening is not the nature of action.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It was explained above that both are correct.

original: yang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term “ripening”?

original: mi 'dra bar @92b smin pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra bar @92b smin pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The ripening is the dissimilar maturation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni thob pa rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni thob pa rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the desire realm, the cause of ripening is a single aggregate that has a single result, such as the obtainment of the aggregates and their arising.

original: phung po gnyis pa la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni lus dang ngag gi las dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gnyis pa la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni lus dang ngag gi las dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is two aggregates that have a single result, such as bodily and vocal actions and their arising.

original: phung po bzhi las 'bras bu gcig pa can ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: phung po bzhi las 'bras bu gcig pa can ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: It is four aggregates that have a single result, such as virtuous and nonvirtuous minds and mental factors and their arising.

original: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la rnam par smin pa gcig pa can ni thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la rnam par smin pa gcig pa can ni thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the form realm, the cause of karmic maturation that has one karmic maturation and one aggregate is attainment and the meditative attainment of non-perception along with birth and so on.

original: phung po gnyis pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par rig byed skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gnyis pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par rig byed skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation that has one karmic maturation and two aggregates is the informative form of the first absorption along with birth and so on.

original: phung po bzhi pa ni dge ba'i sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa na'o //
analyzed: phung po bzhi pa ni dge ba'i sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa na'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation that has one karmic maturation and four aggregates is a virtuous mind that is not in equipoise.

original: phung po lnga pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa na'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa na'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation that has one karmic maturation and five aggregates is a virtuous mind that is in equipoise.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyus phung po gcig la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni thob pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyus phung po gcig la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni thob pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the formless realm, the cause of karmic maturation that has one karmic maturation and one aggregate is attainment and the meditative attainment of cessation along with birth and so on.

original: phung po bzhi pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po bzhi pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation that has one karmic maturation and four aggregates is virtuous minds and mental factors and their birth and so on.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las kyang yod de /
translated: There is action the ripened result of which is a single sense sphere, namely the sense sphere of factors.

original: gang gi srog gi dbang po yin pa'o //🔽gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi srog gi dbang po yin pa'o // gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te /
translated: This is the sense sphere of life force.

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag go //
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag go //
translated: There is action the ripened result of which is two sense spheres, namely the sense spheres of the mental faculty and of factors.🔽This is the sense sphere of the mental faculty.

original: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o // gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gsum ste /
translated: The same holds for the sense sphere of tangibility.🔽There is action the ripened result of which is three sense spheres, namely the sense spheres of the body, tangibility and factors.

original: lus dang reg bya dang / chos kyi skye mched dag go //
analyzed: lus dang reg bya dang / chos kyi skye mched dag go //
translated: This is the sense sphere of the body.

original: gang gi gzugs dang dri dang ro'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang gi gzugs dang dri dang ro'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o // gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni bzhi ste /
translated: The same holds for the sense spheres of visible form, odor and taste.🔽There is action the ripened result of which is four sense spheres, namely the sense spheres of the eye, body, tangibility and factors.

original: mig dang lus dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang lus dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
translated: This is the sense sphere of the eye.

original: gang gi rna ba dang ; sna dang / lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang gi rna ba dang ; sna dang / lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same holds for the sense spheres of the ear, nose and tongue.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig smin par 'gyur ba'i las de yang yod de /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig smin par 'gyur ba'i las de yang yod de /
translated: There is also action whose fruition is five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, or elevenfold.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds,

original: las kyi 'dras bu sna tshogs dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir phyi'i sa bon @93a * //
analyzed: las kyi 'dras bu sna tshogs dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir phyi'i sa bon @93a * //
translated: which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.

original: bzhin no // dper na phyi'i sa bon rnams la kha cig ni 'bras bu sna tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bzhin no // dper na phyi'i sa bon rnams la kha cig ni 'bras bu sna tshogs pa yin te /
translated: For example, some external seeds are of various kinds,

original: 'di lta ste padma dang / bal po se'u dang / shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa dag gi lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste padma dang / bal po se'u dang / shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa dag gi lta bu'o //
translated: such as the lotus, the pomegranate, the banyan tree, etc.

original: kha cig ni 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some are not of various kinds,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: nas dang gro la sogs pa dag gi lta bu'o ;
analyzed: nas dang gro la sogs pa dag gi lta bu'o ;
translated: barley, wheat, etc.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.

original: / las dus gcig pa'i rnam par smin pa dus gsum pa rnam par smin pa ni mi 'gyur gyi las dus gnyis pa'i yang dus gcig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / las dus gcig pa'i rnam par smin pa dus gsum pa rnam par smin pa ni mi 'gyur gyi las dus gnyis pa'i yang dus gcig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.🔽The result of action is not like external seeds, which are sometimes of various kinds and sometimes not.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect would be too small in relation to the cause.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gcig pa'i skad cig ma du ma pa ni yin gyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gcig pa'i skad cig ma du ma pa ni yin gyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the effect is of many moments when the cause is of one moment, but not the reverse.

original: rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa yang ma yin la mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa yang ma yin la mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
translated: The effect of a ripened result does not ripen simultaneously with its cause, nor immediately after its cause.

original: mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moment that immediately follows the cause is drawn by the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu smin pa ni rgyu la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu smin pa ni rgyu la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The effect of a ripened result that has arisen from a cause of a ripened result is dependent on its cause.

original: yang rgyu 'di dag gi dus nges pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang rgyu 'di dag gi dus nges pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definite time of these causes?

original: 'di dag gi dus nges par don gyis ni bshad mod kyi mdor byas nas ma bshad pas /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dus nges par don gyis ni bshad mod kyi mdor byas nas ma bshad pas /
translated: The definite time of these causes has been explained in the sense of the words, but not in brief.

original: de'i phyir mdor byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdor byas te /
translated: Therefore, in brief:🔽The pervasive and the homogeneous are of two times.

original: kun 'gro skal mnyam dus gnyis pa dang / 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba kho na yin gyi ma 'ongs pa dag ni med do //
analyzed: kun 'gro skal mnyam dus gnyis pa dang / 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba kho na yin gyi ma 'ongs pa dag ni med do //
translated: They are past and present only, not future.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to //🔽gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to // gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa //
translated: The reason has already been explained.🔽The three causes that are mentioned in the sutra are causes that exist in the three times.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag ni dus gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag ni dus gsum pa yin no //
translated: The coemergent cause, the homogeneous cause, and the ripening cause exist in the three times.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dus nges pa ma bstan pas dus thams cad pa dang / dus dang bral bar yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dus nges pa ma bstan pas dus thams cad pa dang / dus dang bral bar yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The active cause is not specified as to time, therefore it should be understood that it exists in all times and also transcends time.

original: rgyu rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu rnams bshad zin to //
translated: Causes have been explained.

original: rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i 'bras bu de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i 'bras bu de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the effects that are caused by those causes?

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, “The effect of the cause is a conditioned phenomenon and cessation obtained through analysis.”

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise states,

original: 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the phenomena that are effects?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are all conditioned phenomena and cessation obtained through analysis.”

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then because unconditioned states are effects, they would also be causes of those effects.

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is a cause, it is also a result of that which is its effect.

original: 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod kyi /
translated: Only conditioned factors are causes and results.

original: 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
translated: Unconditioned factors are neither.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid @93b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid @93b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the six types of causes and the five types of results are impossible with regard to them.

original: ci'i phyir lam 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why do you not accept the path as a disconnection cause?

original: 'di ltar de ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa yin na 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa yin na 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: In fact, it is established as the cause that does not hinder arising. But the unconditioned does not arise.

original: da ni de gang gi 'am ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: da ni de gang gi 'am ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the result of the unconditioned?

original: lam gyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result of the path.

original: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obtained by the power of the path.

original: 'o na ni de de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But if that is so, then only the possession of disconnection is the result of the path, not disconnection itself, because the path is only capable of producing the possession of disconnection.

original: thob pa la yang de'i nus pa gzhan la /
analyzed: thob pa la yang de'i nus pa gzhan la /
translated: Also, the obtainment of that has the capacity to generate it in another.🔽

original: bral ba la yang gzhan te /
analyzed: bral ba la yang gzhan te /
translated: The power of the path is different in the case of obtaining, and different in the case of separation.🔽How is the path powerful with regard to obtaining?

original: thob pa la de ji ltar nus she na bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa la de ji ltar nus she na bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates it.

original: bral ba la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: bral ba la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it powerful with regard to separation?

original: thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the obtaining of separation.

original: de lta bas na re zhig lam ni ji ltar yang 'di'i rgyu ma yin gyi bral ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig lam ni ji ltar yang 'di'i rgyu ma yin gyi bral ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Thus, the path is not a cause of the unconditioned in any way. Separation is its effect.

original: yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go ji ltar na 'dus ma byas byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go ji ltar na 'dus ma byas byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If the unconditioned is not a dominant result, how can it be a cause that is an active cause?

original: skye ba la mi sgrib pa'i dngos pos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin gyi 'di la 'bras bu yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la mi sgrib pa'i dngos pos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin gyi 'di la 'bras bu yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is a cause that is an active cause by virtue of not obstructing arising, but it does not have an effect,

original: dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / smin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / smin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is free from time does not have the power to hold or project an effect.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis gang las kyang 'dus ma byas rgyu yin no zhes ma gsungs kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang las kyang 'dus ma byas rgyu yin no zhes ma gsungs kyi /
translated: The Sautrantikas say:

original: rgyu ma yin no zhes rnam grangs kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin no zhes rnam grangs kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavan has not stated that the unconditioned is a cause, but he has stated that it is not a cause.

original: ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is this explained?

original: gzugs skyed pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na rgyu dang rkyen mi rtag pa dag la brten nas byung ba'i gzugs lta rtag par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs skyed pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na rgyu dang rkyen mi rtag pa dag la brten nas byung ba'i gzugs lta rtag par ga la 'gyur /
translated: The causes and conditions that produce form are impermanent. How could form be permanent when it arises in dependence on impermanent causes and conditions?

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The same applies up to consciousness.

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'dus ma byas rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'dus ma byas rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then unconditioned states would not be the objective conditions of consciousness.

original: skyes pa'i zhes dkar ba'i phyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i zhes dkar ba'i phyir 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is said that they arise.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag na zhes gsungs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag na zhes ni mi gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag na zhes gsungs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag na zhes ni mi gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the causes and conditions that produce consciousness are impermanent, but it is not said that the conditions of consciousness are impermanent.

original: rgyu rnams kyang gang dag skyed pa'i rgyu de dag kho na mi rtag go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyang mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam gyis byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du mi dgag pa yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang gang dag skyed pa'i rgyu de dag kho na mi rtag go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyang mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam gyis byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du mi dgag pa yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that unconditioned states are not refuted as active causes by mere nonobstruction?

original: mdo las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi mi sgrib pa'i rgyu yin par ni ma gsungs pas /
analyzed: mdo las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi mi sgrib pa'i rgyu yin par ni ma gsungs pas /
translated: A sutra declares that they are objective conditions, but it does not declare that they are active causes.

original: mdo las 'dus ma byas rgyu'i dngos po mi @94a * //
analyzed: mdo las 'dus ma byas rgyu'i dngos po mi @94a * //
translated: Therefore, the fact that unconditioned states are causes is not established in sutra.

original: 'grub bo // ma gsungs mod kyi bkag pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'grub bo // ma gsungs mod kyi bkag pa ni med do //
translated: Although it is not stated, it is not refuted.

original: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub nam gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par gzung yang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di ci /
analyzed: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub nam gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par gzung yang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di ci /
translated: But how do you know that most sutras have disappeared?

original: sngar so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes ma bshad dam /
analyzed: sngar so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes ma bshad dam /
translated: Didn’t we previously explain that it is analytical cessation?

original: de'i tshe ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang zhe na /
translated: At that time we explained, “What is analytical cessation?

original: gang bral ba'o zhes bshad /
analyzed: gang bral ba'o zhes bshad /
translated: It is freedom.”

original: da ni bral ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: da ni bral ba gang zhe na /
translated: Now we ask, “What is freedom?”

original: gang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o zhes bshad pas phan tshun rten pa'i bshad pa 'di ni de'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar bya ba la nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o zhes bshad pas phan tshun rten pa'i bshad pa 'di ni de'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar bya ba la nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The explanation of the cessation of that which is susceptible to being discerned is not capable of clarifying its intrinsic nature.

original: de lta bas na de'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, its intrinsic nature should be described in another way.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'phags pa rnams kho nas so sor rang gis rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'phags pa rnams kho nas so sor rang gis rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: Its intrinsic nature is to be personally experienced by the noble ones alone.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa brtags pa dang dge ba'i rdzas gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig ni brjod par nus so //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa brtags pa dang dge ba'i rdzas gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig ni brjod par nus so //
translated: It is only possible to say that it is a real entity that is different from the other factors that are investigated and that is virtuous.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re 'dus ma byas thams cad kyang rdzas su med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re 'dus ma byas thams cad kyang rdzas su med pa kho na ste /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that all unconditioned factors are not real entities.

original: de ni gzugs dang tshor pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas gzhan du ni med do //
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang tshor pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas gzhan du ni med do //
translated: They do not exist as real entities in the way that form, sensation, etc., exist as real entities.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is space?

original: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin te /
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin te /
translated: Space is the mere absence of contact.

original: 'di ltar mun pa'i nang dag na thogs pa ma rnyed na nam mkha'o zhes zer to /
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa'i nang dag na thogs pa ma rnyed na nam mkha'o zhes zer to /
translated: In the same way, when one does not encounter any resistance in the darkness, one says that there is space.

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis gzhan mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis gzhan mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of the arising of the proclivities and of birth, by the power of the discernment of the truths, is cessation due to discernment.

original: so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste dper na bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste dper na bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The non-arising of that which has not yet arisen, due to the absence of the conditions of arising, without any discernment of the truths, is cessation not due to discernment. For example, the remainder of the homogeneous character of beings who die in the intermediate state.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re phra rgyas rnams mi skye bar bya ba la shes rab kyi nus pa yod do //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re phra rgyas rnams mi skye bar bya ba la shes rab kyi nus pa yod do //
translated: Other schools maintain that discernment has the power to prevent the arising of the proclivities.

original: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is cessation due to discernment.

original: sdug bsngal mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i rkyen phra rgyas med pa kho na'i phyir de la shes rab kyi nus pa med de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i rkyen phra rgyas med pa kho na'i phyir de la shes rab kyi nus pa med de /
translated: The non-arising of suffering is due solely to the absence of the conditions of arising, namely, the proclivities. Discernment has no power with regard to that.

original: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no zhes zer te de yang so sor brtags pa med pas mi 'grub pas de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no zhes zer te de yang so sor brtags pa med pas mi 'grub pas de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
translated: But this is not established without deliberation, so it is only cessation due to deliberation.

original: gzhan dag na re sngar skyes pa phyis med pa gang yin pa de nyid rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no @94b zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sngar skyes pa phyis med pa gang yin pa de nyid rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no @94b zhes zer te /
translated: According to another opinion, cessation not due to deliberation is the natural cessation of previously arisen factors, since they perish on their own.

original: rtogs pa de la ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs pa de la ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: In this hypothesis, cessation not due to deliberation would be impermanent,

original: ma zhig na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhig na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it does not exist when the factor has not perished.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But, one would say, cessation due to deliberation is also impermanent, since it is preceded by deliberation.

original: de ni so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: No, for deliberation does not precede cessation.

original: sngar so sor brtags pa yin la phyis skye ba rnams kyi mi skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar so sor brtags pa yin la phyis skye ba rnams kyi mi skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Deliberation occurs first, and later the non-arising of the factors that should have arisen.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de dag mi skye ba de ni snga nas yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dag mi skye ba de ni snga nas yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But this non-arising is already present.

original: chos gang dag so sor brtags ba med na skye bar 'gyur ba de dag so sor brtags pa skyes na yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag so sor brtags ba med na skye bar 'gyur ba de dag so sor brtags pa skyes na yang mi skye'o //
translated: The factors that would arise if there were no discernment do not arise when discernment arises.

original: 'di la so sor brtags pa'i mthu ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la so sor brtags pa'i mthu ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the power of discernment:

original: 'di lta ste gegs ma byas pa rkyen rnams skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gegs ma byas pa rkyen rnams skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: it is the non-doing of that which should not be done.

original: gal te mi skye ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin na 'o na mdo'i tshig dbang po lnga po 'di dag kun tu bsten /🔽goms par byas /
analyzed: gal te mi skye ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin na 'o na mdo'i tshig dbang po lnga po 'di dag kun tu bsten / goms par byas /
translated: If non-arising is nirvāṇa, how can one explain the Sūtra?🔽“By cultivating and developing much the five controlling faculties, i.e., faith, etc.🔽one abandons the defilements of the past, the future and the present.

original: lan mang du byas na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang /
analyzed: lan mang du byas na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang /
translated: If you do this many times, you will abandon suffering in the past, future, and present.🔽

original: spangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Abandonment is nirvāṇa.

original: mi skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa kho na yin gyi 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa kho na yin gyi 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Non-arising is future factors only, not past or present factors.

original: de skad du 'byung ba yang yod mod kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'byung ba yang yod mod kyi 'on kyang /
translated: Indeed, such statements do occur,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal spong bar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal spong bar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: but the Bhagavān said that suffering is abandoned by abandoning the affliction that focuses on it.

original: gzugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa di spongs shig /'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs na khyed kyis gzugs de lta bu de yang spangs pa dang yongs su shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa di spongs shig /'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs na khyed kyis gzugs de lta bu de yang spangs pa dang yongs su shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Abandon desire and attachment for form, if you abandon desire and attachment, you will abandon and thoroughly destroy that form.

original: rgyas par rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyas par rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: This is stated extensively up to consciousness.

original: de ltar na dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal yang spangs par rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal yang spangs par rung ngo //
translated: Thus it is suitable that suffering of the three times is abandoned.

original: ci ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were stated that past, future and present affliction is abandoned,

original: der yang tshul ni 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: der yang tshul ni 'di kho na yin no //
translated: the method would be just this.

original: yang na dgongs pa ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa ni tshe rabs snga ma pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na dgongs pa ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa ni tshe rabs snga ma pa yin la /
translated: Or the intention is that past affliction is that of former lives,

original: da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa ni tshe 'di pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa ni tshe 'di pa yin te /
translated: The affliction that is present is of this life.

original: dper na sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la 'das pa'i dus la brten nas sred pa rnam par spyad pa bcva brgyad do zhes 'byung ba 'das pa'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa dang / @95a * //
analyzed: dper na sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la 'das pa'i dus la brten nas sred pa rnam par spyad pa bcva brgyad do zhes 'byung ba 'das pa'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa dang / @95a * //
translated: For example, it is said that there are eighteen types of craving that are based on the past, and it is said that there are eighteen types of craving that are based on the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ba lta bu'o //
translated: The same is true of the present.

original: nyon mongs pa gnyis po 'dis kyang rgyud 'di la ma 'ongs pa bskyed pa'i phyir sa bon gyi dngos po bzhag pa de spangs pas de yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gnyis po 'dis kyang rgyud 'di la ma 'ongs pa bskyed pa'i phyir sa bon gyi dngos po bzhag pa de spangs pas de yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: Since these two afflictions generate future afflictions in this stream of being, they plant the seeds. When they are abandoned, they are also abandoned.

original: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pa las zad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o /
analyzed: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pa las zad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o /
translated: For example, it is like the exhaustion of karmic maturation.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal la nyon mongs pa ni sa bon med pa'i phyir gtan du mi skye ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal la nyon mongs pa ni sa bon med pa'i phyir gtan du mi skye ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: The future suffering and affliction are abandoned as the nonarising of seeds because they are without seeds.

original: de lta ma yin na 'das pa dang da ltar la ci zhig spang du yod de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'das pa dang da ltar la ci zhig spang du yod de /
translated: If that were not so, what is there to abandon in the past and present?

original: 'gags zin pa dang / 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa la ni 'bad pa don dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gags zin pa dang / 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa la ni 'bad pa don dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that which has already ceased and that which is about to cease, effort is pointless.

original: gal te 'dus ma byas med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ma byas med pa kho na yin na /
translated: If unconditioned dharmas do not exist,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang dag 'dus byas kyang rung 'dus ma byas kyang rung de dag gi mchog ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par bshad do zhes gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang dag 'dus byas kyang rung 'dus ma byas kyang rung de dag gi mchog ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par bshad do zhes gang gsungs pa /
translated: then how can the Blessed One have declared: “Among all conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, dispassion is declared supreme”?

original: ji ltar na med pa rnams kyi mchog yin par 'os /
analyzed: ji ltar na med pa rnams kyi mchog yin par 'os /
translated: How can non-existence be supreme?

original: 'dus ma byas med pa kho na'o zhes kyang mi smra'i de ni kho bo cag gis ji skad du bshad pa de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas med pa kho na'o zhes kyang mi smra'i de ni kho bo cag gis ji skad du bshad pa de lta bu yin no //
translated: We do not say that unconditioned dharmas do not exist at all. They exist in the way we have explained.

original: dper na sgra la snga na med pa yang yod /
analyzed: dper na sgra la snga na med pa yang yod /
translated: For example, although sound does not exist prior to its production,

original: phyis med pa yang yod ces bya mod kyi 'on kyang med pa ni yod par mi 'grub pa ltar 'dus ma byas kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyis med pa yang yod ces bya mod kyi 'on kyang med pa ni yod par mi 'grub pa ltar 'dus ma byas kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: and does not exist later in the state of cessation, still, it is not established that non-existence exists. Unconditioned dharmas should be viewed in the same way.

original: med pa yang kha cig shin tu bsngags pa yod de /
analyzed: med pa yang kha cig shin tu bsngags pa yod de /
translated: Some say: Nonexistence is also highly praised.

original: gang gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba de ni 'dul ba rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir gzhan dag gi mchog yin no zhes bsngags pa 'thob par 'os so //
analyzed: gang gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba de ni 'dul ba rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir gzhan dag gi mchog yin no zhes bsngags pa 'thob par 'os so //
translated: If something is free from all faults, it is praised as the best of all, since it is the object of aspiration for those to be trained.

original: gal te 'dus ma byas med pa tsam zhig yin na 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ma byas med pa tsam zhig yin na 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If unconditioned states are mere nonexistents, they would not be the truth of cessation,

original: de cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are nothing at all.

original: re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don 'di gang yin /
analyzed: re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don 'di gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the truth of cessation?

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the meaning of nonerroneous?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Aryas see both of these as they are:

original: sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal kho na'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal kho na'o //
translated: suffering is only suffering and🔽the absence of suffering is only the absence of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal med pa la yang med pa kho na'o zhes 'di gnyi ga yang phyin ci ma log par gzigs na 'di 'phags pa'i bden pa nyid yin par 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa la yang med pa kho na'o zhes 'di gnyi ga yang phyin ci ma log par gzigs na 'di 'phags pa'i bden pa nyid yin par 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What contradicts their being the noble truths?

original: ji ltar med pa yang yin la 'phags pa'i bden pa gsum pa yang yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa yang yin la 'phags pa'i bden pa gsum pa yang yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be both nonexistent and the third noble truth?

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa yin pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa yin pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained how it is an noble truth.

original: gnyis pa'i 'og tu mthong ba dang bstan pas na @95b gsum pa yin no //🔽gal te 'dus ma byas dngos po med pa tsam yin na nam mkha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro //🔽'di ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid bsam par bya'o //🔽gal te 'dus ma byas rdzas kho nar 'dod par gyur na cir 'gyur /🔽ci zhig tu yang 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i 'og tu mthong ba dang bstan pas na @95b gsum pa yin no // gal te 'dus ma byas dngos po med pa tsam yin na nam mkha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro // 'di ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid bsam par bya'o // gal te 'dus ma byas rdzas kho nar 'dod par gyur na cir 'gyur / ci zhig tu yang 'gyur /
translated: It is the third because it is seen and taught after the second.

original: bye brag tu smras pa'i phyogs bskyab par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te 'di bskyab par bya ba yin par sems na lha skyob par 'gyur grang /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu brtags par 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smras pa'i phyogs bskyab par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te 'di bskyab par bya ba yin par sems na lha skyob par 'gyur grang /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu brtags par 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du de'i rang gi ngo bo yang mi dmigs la mig la sogs pa bzhin du las kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du de'i rang gi ngo bo yang mi dmigs la mig la sogs pa bzhin du las kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Its intrinsic reality is not perceived, like form, feeling, etc., and its action is not perceived, like the eye, etc.

original: dngos po che ge mo zhig gi 'gog pa 'di yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yang ji ltar rab tu brtags te /
analyzed: dngos po che ge mo zhig gi 'gog pa 'di yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yang ji ltar rab tu brtags te /
translated: How can it be established that this is the cessation of such and such a thing?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir de ni de dang lhan cig 'brel pa 'ga' yang med kyi che ge mo zhig med pa'o zhes 'gag pa tsam du rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir de ni de dang lhan cig 'brel pa 'ga' yang med kyi che ge mo zhig med pa'o zhes 'gag pa tsam du rung ngo //
translated: Since the possibility of things such as cause and effect is not possible, it is not related to anything at all, but it is appropriate to say that it is the mere cessation of such and such a thing.

original: dngos po gzhan nyid yin na yang nyon mongs pa gang gi thob pa chad nas 'gog pa gang thob pa de de'i yin no zhes tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan nyid yin na yang nyon mongs pa gang gi thob pa chad nas 'gog pa gang thob pa de de'i yin no zhes tha snyad gdags so //
translated: Even if it were a different thing, it is designated as the cessation of that affliction in regard to which its obtainment is severed and that in regard to which its obtainment is obtained.

original: 'o na de thob par 'dod pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na de thob par 'dod pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin /
translated: Well, what is the cause of obtaining it?🔽How can it be possible to obtain a nonexistent state?

original: mdo las mthong pa'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i dge slong zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar na med pa thob par rung /
analyzed: mdo las mthong pa'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i dge slong zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar na med pa thob par rung /
translated: The sutra states, “The bhikṣu who obtains nirvana in this life.”

original: gnyen po thob pas nyon mongs pa dang / yang srid pa'i skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten thob pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po thob pas nyon mongs pa dang / yang srid pa'i skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten thob pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One attains nirvana because one attains a basis that is utterly incompatible with the afflictions and birth in existence, having obtained the antidote.

original: lung las kyang dngos po med pa tsam nyid du brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: lung las kyang dngos po med pa tsam nyid du brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Also, scripture declares that it is just the mere absence of things:

original: 'di skad du sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs pa /
analyzed: 'di skad du sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs pa /
translated: It is the complete abandonment of this suffering,

original: nges par spangs pa /
analyzed: nges par spangs pa /
translated: its definite abandonment,

original: byang bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: byang bar 'gyur ba /
translated: its wearing away,

original: zad pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: zad pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: its extinction, its dispassion,

original: 'gog pa / rnam par zhi ba /
analyzed: 'gog pa / rnam par zhi ba /
translated: its cessation, its pacification,🔽its disappearance,

original: nub pa / sdug bsngal gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyong ba med pa /
analyzed: nub pa / sdug bsngal gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyong ba med pa /
translated: its non-arising of another suffering,

original: len pa med pa /
analyzed: len pa med pa /
translated: its non-appearance,

original: 'byung ba med pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: its non-occurrence,

original: phung po thams cad nges par spangs pa /
analyzed: phung po thams cad nges par spangs pa /
translated: that is, the definite abandonment of all the aggregates,

original: sred pa zad pa /
analyzed: sred pa zad pa /
translated: the exhaustion of craving,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: the dispassion of attachment,

original: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni zhi ba'o //
translated: the cessation, nirvana, which is peace,

original: 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: which is excellence.

original: 'dir yin na 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba de ltar ci ste mi 'dod ce na /🔽bdun pa 'di ni nus @96a * //
analyzed: 'dir yin na 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba de ltar ci ste mi 'dod ce na / bdun pa 'di ni nus @96a * //
translated: But if it exists, it would not arise. Therefore, why not accept that nirvana is the nonexistence of the aggregates?

original: pa med par lta'o //
analyzed: pa med par lta'o //
translated: The seventh position is that nirvana is powerless.

original: 'dir yin na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya pa ji skad du bshad pa yin /
analyzed: 'dir yin na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya pa ji skad du bshad pa yin /
translated: But if it exists, it would not arise.

original: gal te yod na zhes bya bar sbyar na ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi rtag pa'i phyir rtag tu mi 'byung ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na zhes bya bar sbyar na ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi rtag pa'i phyir rtag tu mi 'byung ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you interpret the passage to mean that nirvana exists, then it follows that nirvana is not always nonarisen, because it is impermanent.

original: 'on te thob na zhes bya bar sbyar na ni gang kho nas de 'thob par yongs su rtog pa de nyid yod dam thob na sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig / de ltar na /
analyzed: 'on te thob na zhes bya bar sbyar na ni gang kho nas de 'thob par yongs su rtog pa de nyid yod dam thob na sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig / de ltar na /
translated: If you interpret the passage to mean that nirvana is attained, then you should assert that suffering does not arise when it exists or when it is attained, and you should consider what it is that attains it.🔽The example of nirvana being like the extinction of a flame🔽is also well stated.🔽The sutra states:

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
translated: Just as a lamp is pacified,

original: de yi sems kyi rnam par thar //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i dpe 'di yang legs par drangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yi sems kyi rnam par thar //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i dpe 'di yang legs par drangs pa yin te /
translated: so is the liberation of the mind.

original: ji ltar mar me shi ba med pa ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sems kyi rnam par thar pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me shi ba med pa ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sems kyi rnam par thar pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the extinction of a lamp is not a thing, so too is the liberation of the mind of the Fortunate One.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang dngos po med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang dngos po med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: The Abhidharma also says, “What are non-existent things?

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos dag yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos dag yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: They are unconditioned things.

original: dngos po med pa ni lus med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo med pa ni zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni lus med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo med pa ni zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: ” Non-existent means not having a body, not having an intrinsic nature.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that this is not the meaning of the sūtra.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is the meaning?

original: dngos po ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of things:

original: rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni ji skad du de dngos po gang zhig thob pa'i dngos po de dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni ji skad du de dngos po gang zhig thob pa'i dngos po de dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: 1. Essential thing: “He who obtains a certain thing possesses that thing.”

original: dmigs pa'i dngos po ni ji skad du chos thams cad dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas shes par bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dngos po ni ji skad du chos thams cad dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas shes par bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: 2. Objective thing: “All things are to be known by knowing things as they are.”

original: ldan pa'i dngos po ji skad du dngos po gang la rjes su chags pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa de yang khong khro ba'i kun nas bkris pa dang yang ldan no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i dngos po ji skad du dngos po gang la rjes su chags pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa de yang khong khro ba'i kun nas bkris pa dang yang ldan no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The state of possession is like the statement, “One who is bound by the fetter of passion is also bound by the fetter of hostility.”

original: rgyu'i dngos po ni ji skad du dngos po dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po ni ji skad du dngos po dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: The state of cause is like the statement, “What are the dharmas that have a real basis?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are the conditioned dharmas.”

original: yongs su gzang ba'i dngos po ni ji skad du zhing gi dngos po dang / khyim gyi dngos po zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yongs su gzang ba'i dngos po ni ji skad du zhing gi dngos po dang / khyim gyi dngos po zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The state of appropriation is like the statement, “The state of the field and the state of the house.”

original: de la 'dir ni rgyu'i dngos po'i sgrar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni rgyu'i dngos po'i sgrar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the state of cause is meant by the word “state.”

original: de lta bas na 'dus ma byas rdzas su yod pa kho na yin la de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dus ma byas rdzas su yod pa kho na yin la de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, unconditioned [dharmas] are real substances, but they do not have cause and effect.”
